commit_message:
Make aiopcpu subnode directory more deterministic

Put subnode logs in the same place on every run to make it easy to load
them into logstash

Change-Id: Icf842ec12e87ccd208c551870312c8e4b62613bd

Before:
base.py (uses non-admin creds - primary creds)
test_load_balancers.py (runs 37 tests)

Now:
(a) base.py - created new class to introduced admin credentials
(b) test_load_balancers_default_user.py - General tests for any user either admin/non-admin. Uses primary_creds (runs 35 tests)
(c) test_load_balancers_non_admin.py - This tests is for only non_admin user. Uses primary creds (runs 3 tests)
(d) test_load_balancers_admin.py - This tests is for only admin user. Uses admin_creds (runs 3 tests)

Differentiating like this gives a fair understanding for the users. Leaving this discussion to "open"'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-09 02:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Please find inline comments.'}, {'account_id': 12403, 'date': '2015-04-09 15:27:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

When I run test tests under my devstack I'm getting several failures.  I've marked one with a comment but there are others failing also.

The problem could be with my setup, I will continue to investigate, but marking as -1 for now.

I also agree with the comments Santosh made."}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2015-04-09 20:33:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

I prefer to have admin clients instead of overwriting the ones which get created in the base class. If we want to keep overriding them you should remove the super call...

There is a case for overriding since then you can use the convenience methods Santosh is referring to.

If you decide to go that way be consistent (one of your clients is named admin) and also remove the super call.'}, {'account_id': 11302, 'date': '2015-04-09 21:41:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Admin/Non-admin API tempest tests

Classified the following files to include admin/non-admin tests in neutron-lbaas

(a) base.py - created new class to introduce admin credentials
(b) test_load_balancers_non_admin.py - This tests is specially for non_admin user
(c) test_load_balancers_admin.py - This tests is specially for admin user
(d) test_pools_non_admin.py - This tests is specially for non_admin user
(e) test_pools_admin.py - This tests is specially for admin user

Change-Id: I0c502a3d8b282b00885707103143b12a946ffe42

Looks reasonable to me.  Please add a regression test to cover that case, however…'}, {'account_id': 13318, 'date': '2015-04-06 10:08:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Dear Kevin, Can I get some help/guidance on writing regression test?. Thanks in advance.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2015-04-06 19:00:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

So, what I'm looking for is for you to add a test to the test suite that would demonstrate the bug you're trying to fix.  Then, when I see that the test suite passes with your fix, I have added confidence that the bug has really been fixed.  The reason for a "regression" test is to protect against regressions; that is, if someone makes some future change to the code path you're working on and accidentally re-introduces the bug, we'll see that the test fails.  Without a regression test, if someone were to accidentally re-introduce the bug, we might not know until someone opens another bug report.

Does that help explain what I'm looking for?  You can take a look at novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py to get an idea of how the test suite is organized for shell.py, but basically what I'm looking for you to do is add a test in an appropriate place that verifies that _parse_block_device_mapping_v2() will raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError when ephemeral_spec is in the wrong format…'}, {'account_id': 13318, 'date': '2015-04-07 05:15:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This explanation is good enough for me to move forward. Thank you Kevin :)'}, {'account_id': 13318, 'date': '2015-04-07 09:17:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-07 10:11:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified-1

commit_message:
Report better error message --ephemeral poor usage

The eph_dict expects the format size=value.Catch valueError and return
proper error text

Change-Id: I99ef7efe7dc14aa346913009e244ad4eea0369a9
Closes-bug: #1433200

[{'created': '2015-04-20 06:36:44.000000000', 'message': "Rework logrotate configuration

- instead of rotating logs daily and weekly, run the script every 15
  minutes
- merge weekly and daily configuration files
- rotate logs basing on two criteria: age (a week; only if file is
  bigger than 10M) and size (rotate the file always if its size exceedes
  100M, regardless its age)
- use dateformat to make rotated logs' filenames more readable;
  as logrotate supports only year, month, day and unix epoch, use them
  all
- fix a lot of lint complaints, including aligments, curly braces and
  proper quoting; give logrotate related files more intuitive names

Change-Id: Ie7040ebcdc1a3329ebb7507807e5c27f0c87b484
Closes-Bug: 1382515

commit_message:
Rework logrotate configuration

- instead of rotating logs daily and weekly, run the script every 15
  minutes
- merge weekly and daily configuration files
- rotate logs basing on two criteria: age (a week; only if file is
  bigger than 10M on master or 5MB on remote nodes) and size (rotate the file
  always if its size exceedes 100M on master or 20M on remote nodes, regardless
  its age)
- use dateformat to make rotated logs' filenames more readable;
  as logrotate supports only year, month, day and unix epoch, use them
  all
- fix a lot of lint complaints, including aligments, curly braces and
  proper quoting; give logrotate related files more intuitive names
- dump.log has been renamed to shotgun.log (LP#1318516)
- check if there is no logrotate instances running before executing
  cronjob

DocImpact: ops guide

Change-Id: Ie7040ebcdc1a3329ebb7507807e5c27f0c87b484
Closes-Bug: 1382515
Closes-Bug: 1446790

commit_message:
Minor fixes for API-based plugin

This patch contains the following fixes:

 * Take out 'Task' off the test class names to be consistent with
   the plugin class name which also does not have 'Task' in its name
 * Add i18n import in config.py to fix the '_' undefined error when
   running the run_test.sh script
 * Fix import name conflict 'exc'

Change-Id: I1902ddd3368758f1de09f75a5b1661445d10ddb1

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-23 00:14:33.000000000', 'message': 'Skip django-pyscss 2.0.0

django-pyscss 2.0.0 attempts to import Py3K stdlib module pathlib
even on Python 2.x where it does not exist.

File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/django_pyscss/compiler.py",
        line 4, in <module>
    from pathlib import PurePath
ImportError: No module named pathlib

https://github.com/fusionbox/django-pyscss/issues/33

Change-Id: I5df5baca3c5b79bfb173c4197421a7312da6ccd8
(cherry picked from commit 8c0ff9178c367c5749100fdf00e3a61815c81baa)
'}]
commit_message:
Skip django-pyscss 2.0.0

django-pyscss 2.0.0 attempts to import Py3K stdlib module pathlib
even on Python 2.x where it does not exist.

File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/django_pyscss/compiler.py",
        line 4, in <module>
    from pathlib import PurePath
ImportError: No module named pathlib

https://github.com/fusionbox/django-pyscss/issues/33

Change-Id: I5df5baca3c5b79bfb173c4197421a7312da6ccd8
(cherry picked from commit 8c0ff9178c367c5749100fdf00e3a61815c81baa)

commit_message:
Catch exceptions from get_class in validate template

The new improved get_class raises an exception when the template is not
found. This poses a problem to validate_template() as it does not have the
files.

Partial-bug: 1407392
Change-Id: Ie8afbd9e30f1d18fc579162f428e86f5f78f12d0

django-pyscss 2.0.0 attempts to import Py3K stdlib module pathlib
even on Python 2.x where it does not exist.

File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/django_pyscss/compiler.py",
        line 4, in <module>
    from pathlib import PurePath
ImportError: No module named pathlib

https://github.com/fusionbox/django-pyscss/issues/33

Change-Id: I5df5baca3c5b79bfb173c4197421a7312da6ccd8
'}]
commit_message:
Skip django-pyscss 2.0.0

django-pyscss 2.0.0 attempts to import Py3K stdlib module pathlib
even on Python 2.x where it does not exist.

File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/django_pyscss/compiler.py",
        line 4, in <module>
    from pathlib import PurePath
ImportError: No module named pathlib

https://github.com/fusionbox/django-pyscss/issues/33

Change-Id: I5df5baca3c5b79bfb173c4197421a7312da6ccd8

commit_message:
Update definition of tosca.nodes.WebServer

In the latest spec, node WebServer no longer provides 'http_endpoint'
and 'https_endpoint'. Instead 'data_endpoint', 'admin_endpoint' and
its type definition is added.

partially implements: bp tosca-capabilities-endpoint
Change-Id: Ia21883d00935677a286aadcfa6ec9fbb4402b7c8

subject: Delete DHCP ports on network delete
messages:
[{'account_id': 8837, 'date': '2015-04-15 09:27:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-15 09:36:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-networking-midonet-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/36/173736/1/check/gate-networking-midonet-pep8/a18ef3c/ : SUCCESS in 2m 29s
- gate-networking-midonet-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/36/173736/1/check/gate-networking-midonet-docs/b2b14a5//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 12s
- gate-networking-midonet-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/36/173736/1/check/gate-networking-midonet-python27/de794f7/ : SUCCESS in 3m 59s
- check-tempest-dsvm-networking-midonet http://logs.openstack.org/36/173736/1/check/check-tempest-dsvm-networking-midonet/b0d7129/ : FAILURE in 6m 39s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 156, 'date': '2015-04-15 17:11:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2015-04-19 07:55:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Unit test?'}, {'account_id': 156, 'date': '2015-04-21 18:26:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review -Workflow

Looking at the change in Neutron that caused this, now I don't think this is the right way to fix it.  MidoNet should be able to do cascade port deletion on network delete."}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2015-04-21 19:27:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think neutron prevents network from being deleted if there are ports on the network'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2015-04-21 19:32:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Actually, it does take care if dhcp ports https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py#L988'}, {'account_id': 156, 'date': '2015-04-21 22:16:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah so the logic is that it first attempts to delete directly from DB all the DHCP ports on network/subnet deletion.  Then, within the same transaction, it checks whether there is any other port left for this network/subnet (non-dhcp port).  If any such port is found, the PortInUse exception is thrown, and rolls back the dhcp port deletion.  This patch is to address the case in which this cascade deletion goes through because there are only DHCP ports.  Thus, IMO, network/subnet deletion, MidoNet translation should also delete these ports.  In fact, MidoNet translation should delete all ports under the network/subnet getting deleted, and let Neutron decide what's allowed and what's not.  Once the task is submitted to MidoNet to delete a network, it should assume that Neutron has already permitted all resources under that network to be deleted."}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2015-04-22 05:39:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

+2'}, {'account_id': 8837, 'date': '2015-04-23 02:20:26.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Not needed because changes to cascade delete in the translator will solve this problem.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-15 09:27:55.000000000', 'message': 'Delete DHCP ports on network delete

Neutron deletes DHCP ports without calling the plugin. In our case,
we need the port deletion to happen so that the corresponding tasks
can be inserted into our task table.

Change-Id: Ief1d90be15d364246be2d34ea9cb63b7cd75b10e
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Delete DHCP ports on network delete

Neutron deletes DHCP ports without calling the plugin. In our case,
we need the port deletion to happen so that the corresponding tasks
can be inserted into our task table.

Change-Id: Ief1d90be15d364246be2d34ea9cb63b7cd75b10e
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>

This driver will allocate a neutron port and fixed_ip on the VIP's network.
Upon plugging the VIP, it will use neutron's allowed address pair to allow
traffic to pass through that VIP port with DEST IPs of the amphorae that

Also changed the network driver interface to handle different

reflects what ip addresses the amphora should be listening on and what
IP should be considered the HA IP should an amphora driver choose to
use active/passive topology based on vrrp software running on the
amphorae.

commit_message:
Added neutron allowed address pairs network driver

This driver will allocate a neutron port and fixed_ip on the VIP's network.
Upon plugging the VIP, it will use neutron's allowed address pair to allow
traffic destined for the ha_ip to pass to raised on amphora interfaces.

Change-Id: I7bce4c2bbb9b35905c21caf79cb865e0ca146dac

commit_message:
Persist parent_resource_name and make sure it's available

We are persisting for a number of reasons:
- so we don't have to pass this through ever rpc call
- the API exposes parent_resource (currently always None as
  it is not persisted)

Closes-bug: #1438978
Change-Id: Id2db36c0234a085ec4f0ce2ab114ec483ea29d81
(cherry picked from commit edf86aeac2f7b68243b0eccc3c49fa1a579e664b)

- gate-heat-specs-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/60/168660/1/check/gate-heat-specs-docs/edb5f99//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 47s'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2015-03-30 10:10:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I struggle to find a use case for this. Do you really have a need for this, or is it just to cover the keystone API? This is normally done prior to Heat even being available. If we had user-based services/endpoints this would make more sense.'}, {'account_id': 10487, 'date': '2015-03-30 11:26:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Angus, This is very useful when users want to create Openstack deployment by using heat as deployment tool. And TripleO is one such example.

In these deployment environment, once keystone and heat are deployment and configured them to functional, for the rest of the Openstack services, user could make use of the Heat keystone resources for creating Service and Endpoint. And in multi-region environment, user could use Region resource as well for creating and managing the Region. 

So blueprint is to facilitate the deployment use cases based on Heat as deployment tool.'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2015-03-31 10:58:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2015-04-09 02:25:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Use stevedore to load API handler

Updates controller base to load handler via stevedore
Updates setup.cfg with entry point
Updates octavia.conf for api_handler default example
Updates config.py for api_handler
Updates requirements.txt for stevedore

Change-Id: I67e3da376fad1d48cec7f56f990c4b13ac7f4b83

The stable/icehouse backport for I53b0c9d949404288e8687b304361a74b53d69ef3
broke handling of Not Authorized from neutron, by referring to a excpetion

commit_message:
Avoid referring to juno-era exception type

The stable/icehouse backport for I53b0c9d949404288e8687b304361a74b53d69ef3
broke handling of Not Authorized from neutron, by referring to a excpetion
class renamed in juno (i.e. exception.NotAuthorized was renamed as
exception.Forbidden).

Change-Id: I9576eb7372195f2479d763f27a5d30a6a4bade21
Closes-Bug: #1446376

commit_message:
Fix valueerror when ceilometer-api start

If change local language to other language(like ja), ceilometer-api
will failed to start.

This patch will remove i18 support from ceilometer/storage/__init__.py

Change-Id: I8dc7ff0921d69e64a41e588207c97548513c99ed
Closes-Bug: #1446983

commit_message:
Add support for pod name in pod-update command

This patch supports using command pod-update with pod name also.

Change-Id: I34b090389b9903467c58465f2dfc8ad703e84f89
Partially-Implements: blueprint name-based-resource-management

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2014-12-19 16:47:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

That may be true of the Cinder API, but Nova can certainly enforce that for the volumes it creates that they be specified.

If the code that uses this today specifies these (it must, or this code would be broken), then I don't think this change helps anything.

Do you have another change that needs this?"}, {'account_id': 12175, 'date': '2014-12-20 01:43:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

hi Russell,
thanks for reviewing my patch.
I don't have other changes which will be help with this patch,
but what I am thinking is that, this change is much reasonable.

nova require cinder to create a volume without provide volume name, this is work, so make name in the cinder api create function as default(None) parameter is much reasonable, for other changes, this will be a good interface since this won't mislead developer that he should pass a None parameter to cinder even he don't really need a specify  volume name.

anyway, I will drop this patch if you are still not agree my point, looking forward for your reply.
-Eli."}, {'account_id': 11189, 'date': '2015-03-02 03:01:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12175, 'date': '2015-03-18 01:59:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

According to cinder client api, name and description in create method
can be None, and are not forced.

https://github.com/openstack/python-cinderclient/blob/master/cinderclient/v1/volumes.py#L146
https://github.com/openstack/python-cinderclient/blob/master/cinderclient/v2/volumes.py#L168

commit_message:
Correct parameter in cinder api create method

According to cinder client api, name and description in create method
can be None, and are not forced.

https://github.com/openstack/python-cinderclient/blob/master/cinderclient/v1/volumes.py#L146
https://github.com/openstack/python-cinderclient/blob/master/cinderclient/v2/volumes.py#L168

Change-Id: I5f70e92a868529c02c57cee3f8e9cdb545bf1c42

commit_message:
fixed_ip unreserve should use an ip liked address

This patch uses a ip liked address to test reserve_fixed_ip, and removes
lib_exc.BadRequest since we change it to HTTPBadRequest.

See I7b18b76745f9092456d511ad023a9ed3a24cca84 and
Ifa7e0dd5a91cfe881077b92aeb7019d0435d780a.

Closes-Bug: 1386525

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-30 05:50:47.000000000', 'message': "API: Don't reload policy files in policy.d every time

We added policy files in policy.d, currently, the code will reload the policy
in policy.d every api call.

This patch changes read_cached_file to store the cache information of a
directory. And we check if the policy.d fresh or not before work though it.

Besides, add another condition then overwrite is False. we only do reload when
overwrite is False and force_reload is Ture, this will prevent reloading policy
in policy.d every api call.

Closes-Bug: 1437992
Change-Id: I7e1e5801d08fcedd4f9fcf88ab06ce4f9fa61b37
"}, {'created': '2015-04-01 05:50:35.000000000', 'message': 'API: Avoid reloading policy files in policy.d for every call

We added policy files in policy.d, currently, the code will
reload the policy in policy.d every enforce been called.
This patch caches the file mtime of the most newest file in
the directory (or the directory itself if it is empty) and uses
that to detect if we need to reload files in the policy.d
directory.

Closes-Bug: 1437992
Depends-On: Ia8c273c8566a4b472cb8807b1576ef1dee8ef054
Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas (dims) <davanum@gmail.com>

commit_message:
API: Avoid reloading policy files in policy.d for every call

We added policy files in policy.d, currently, the code will
reload the policy in policy.d every enforce been called.
This patch caches the file mtime of the most newest file in
the directory (or the directory itself if it is empty) and uses
that to detect if we need to reload files in the policy.d
directory.

Closes-Bug: 1437992
Depends-On: Ia8c273c8566a4b472cb8807b1576ef1dee8ef054
Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas (dims) <davanum@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I7e1e5801d08fcedd4f9fcf88ab06ce4f9fa61b37

commit_message:
Update the status of Image API v1.1

In I98e182aaee3d3577764ec957dfbbd898a1137ea9 Glance is updating the
image versions response to indicate that version 1.1 of the image API is
"supported" and no longer "current".

Change-Id: I3f7baba0300659b678de90276900831623d10d5e

commit_message:
Add some tests to validate specs

Tests were added to
- Compare titles with the skeleton template.rst.
- Detect trailing whitespaces
- Check lines are limited to a maximum of 79 characters.
- Detect literal carriage returns

Note: Taken from nova-specs/tests/test_titles.py and modified for
Heat.

Change-Id: Ib8bc85c086cbf37ec79b787c07657b9ffd7d17ac

[{'created': '2015-03-29 08:22:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add options to ssh to prevent prompting

When doing migration with lbivirt driver there are
ssh commands that can cause prompting if ssh
is not configure correctly.
This patch disable the prompting by adding
BatchMode=yes and StrictHostKeyChecking=yes options
to the ssh command.

Closes-Bug: 1437790

Change-Id: Ib1e38f397afaac96a2e1a8717c87a4b6756419db

commit_message:
libvirt: Add option to ssh to prevent prompting

When doing migration with libvirt driver there are
ssh commands that can cause prompting if ssh
is not configured correctly.
This patch disables the prompting by adding
BatchMode=yes option to the ssh command.

Closes-Bug: #1437790

Change-Id: Ib1e38f397afaac96a2e1a8717c87a4b6756419db

Nice.
Good catch!'}, {'account_id': 7221, 'date': '2015-03-24 21:56:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

While I think having this extra affinity check in the manager is better than what we had before, and I agree it needs to be there, it still doesn't cover the following race condition:

4 VMs are deployed into an empty affinity group simultaneously.
VM1 and VM2 get scheduled to Host 1, and VM3 and VM4 get scheduled to Host 2. When this check is hit for the VM with the last time-stamp (let's say that is VM4), there will be VM members older than it. VM1 and VM2 on Host 1, VM3 on Host 2. Since this VM4's host is also Host 2, it will not pass the following check:
    "if group_hosts and self.host not in group_hosts:". 
So the VM wouldn't be rescheduled, and this would result in VMs deployed to Host 1 and Host 2 in the same affinity group.'}, {'account_id': 7221, 'date': '2015-03-24 22:18:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(2 comments)

Same comment as before w/o the garbled format.

While I think having this extra affinity check in the manager is better than what we had before, and I agree it should be implemented, it still doesn't cover the following race condition.

4 VMs are created into an empty affinity group simultaneously. VM1 and VM2 get scheduled to Host1, and VM3 and VM4 get scheduled to Host2. When this check is hit for the VM with the last time-stamp (let's say that is VM4), there will be 3 VM members older than it. VM1 and VM2 on Host1, and VM3 on Host2. Since VM4's host is also Host2, it will not pass the following check.

"if group_hosts and self.host not in group hosts".

So VM4 wouldn't be rescheduled, and this would result in VMs deployed to Host1 and Host2 in the same affinity group.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2015-03-24 22:28:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Jennifer, I think that comment is more applicable to "https://review.openstack.org/#/c/164762/".  This commit is really focused on bringing the affinity case up to par with the existing anti-affinity case.

As for the substance of your comment, perhaps for affinity what we really want is the host of the earliest-created group member?

And of course we'll have to revisit this for the soft-affinity policy that's being developed.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2015-03-31 16:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Oops, one more case I think it broken.

1. Two instances get rescheduling because violate the affinity policy. But the instance.host still the host which is choiced by the first scheduling.

2. After rescheduling, at conductor task manager's build_instances, it will call setup_instance_group. So the first host will be populated into the group info.

3. When rescheduling in the AffinityGroupFilter, this filter will choice the first host again by the affinity policy.

4. but the RetryFilter will filter out the first host.

Then the final result will be no valid host."}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2015-04-18 06:11:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Hi Alex...this patch is purely to enable some form of validation for the "affinity" policy since currently we have no validation at all.  (And I think some validation is better than none.)

The two dependent patches are intended to fix various races. (I didn't want this patch to get overly complicated.)'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2015-04-18 08:56:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Chris, emm... sorry, I think the dependent patch didn't fix the case what I said. I think there need more fix for rescheduling affinity policy's instance, and at least that fix should be before this patch. Although we have validate in this patch, but it doesn't works. Does make sense to you? Thanks Alex"}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2015-04-20 17:22:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Alex: I don't see why we need to fix the races before submitting this.  "The perfect is the enemy of the good", and all that.

Without this patch we have a huge window for race conditions.  Adding this patch narrows the window for race conditions.  And each of the follow-on patches narrows the race window further.

I'm happy to take suggestions on how to improve it, but given the inherently racy parallel process of scheduling, adding instance to group, trying to run, potentially being sent back for rescheduling, changing the host, etc.  I don't think we *can* close all the race windows.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2015-04-20 18:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(3 comments)

Chris, nice work on this. Left a note about an improvement to the exception message, but you can make that in some follow up patch.

Best,

-jay'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-20 18:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: -Verified

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-09 20:19:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix up server group policy validation

In git commit a79ecbe Russel Bryant submitted a partial fix for a race
condition when booting an instance as part of a server group with an
"anti-affinity" scheduler policy.

That fix only solves part of the problem, however. There are a couple
of issues remaining:

1) It's possible to hit a similar race condition for server groups with
the "affinity" policy. Suppose we create a new group and then create two
instances simultaneously. The scheduler sees an empty group for each,
assigns them to different compute nodes, and the policy is violated.

2) It's possible to create two instances simultaneously, have them be
scheduled to conflicting hosts, both of them detect the problem in
_validate_instance_group_policy(), both of them get sent back for
rescheduling, and both of them get assigned to conflicting hosts
*again*, resulting in an error.

This commit addresses the first issue by adding a check in
_validate_instance_group_policy() to cover the "affinity" case.  It
addresses the second issue by modifying the validation code to ignore
group members created after the instance being validated.

Closes-Bug: #1423648
Change-Id: Icf95390a128e2062293e1f5b7b78fe79747f5f27
'}, {'created': '2015-03-12 16:36:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix up server group policy validation

2) It's possible to create two instances simultaneously, have them be
scheduled to conflicting hosts, both of them detect the problem in
_validate_instance_group_policy(), both of them get sent back for

This commit addresses the first issue by adding a check in

Closes-Bug: #1423648
Change-Id: Icf95390a128e2062293e1f5b7b78fe79747f5f27
'}, {'created': '2015-03-13 06:25:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix up server group policy validation

*again*, resulting in an error.

This commit addresses the first issue by adding a check in
_validate_instance_group_policy() to cover the "affinity" case.  It
addresses the second issue by modifying the validation code to ignore
group members created after the instance being validated.

Closes-Bug: #1423648
Change-Id: Icf95390a128e2062293e1f5b7b78fe79747f5f27
'}, {'created': '2015-03-16 15:29:32.000000000', 'message': 'Validate server group anti-affinity policy

In git commit a79ecbe Russel Bryant submitted a partial fix for a race
condition when booting an instance as part of a server group with an
"anti-affinity" scheduler policy.

It's possible to hit a similar race condition for server groups with
the "affinity" policy. Suppose we create a new group and then create two
instances simultaneously. The scheduler sees an empty group for each,
assigns them to different compute nodes, and the policy is violated.

To guard against this, we extends _validate_instance_group_policy()
to cover the "affinity" case as well as "anti-affinity".

commit_message:
Validate server group affinity policy

In git commit a79ecbe Russell Bryant submitted a partial fix for a race
condition when booting an instance as part of a server group with an
"anti-affinity" scheduler policy.

It's possible to hit a similar race condition for server groups with
the "affinity" policy. Suppose we create a new group and then create two
instances simultaneously. The scheduler sees an empty group for each,
assigns them to different compute nodes, and the policy is violated.

To guard against this, we extend _validate_instance_group_policy()
to cover the "affinity" case as well as "anti-affinity".

Partial-Bug: #1423648
Change-Id: Icf95390a128e2062293e1f5b7b78fe79747f5f27

commit_message:
Add bay_uuid to container create

Containers now need to be associated with Bays so that Magnum
can use each Bay's swarm connection to create the container.
Because of this, bay_uuid was added to containers and made
mandatory.

Change-Id: I1d9d555f0ec849507e062230dd8d8b7faa06cd8f
Implements: bp docker-conductor-connect-to-docker-bay

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-15 16:58:51.000000000', 'message': 'Ignoring jshint on legacy JS code

Once undef and unused are enabled, legacy code will throw over 365 errors.
Remember that undef check for undefined variables while unused checks
for unused variables, both are good for quality control.

We have two options going forward:
1. Clean up legacy code
2. Ignore legacy code

Since legacy is stable enough, cleaning it up might have higher risk of
regression and does not improve code or add value. This patch implements
option 2.

Change-Id: Ieac1be3baff6fce6c889e5eefc54dac6ed6094c7
Closes-bug: #1444584
'}, {'created': '2015-04-16 16:33:31.000000000', 'message': 'Ignoring jshint on legacy JS code

Once undef and unused are enabled, legacy code will throw over 365 errors.
Remember that undef check for undefined variables while unused checks
for unused variables, both are good for quality control.

We have two options going forward:
1. Clean up legacy code
2. Ignore legacy code

Since legacy is stable enough, cleaning it up might have higher risk of
regression and does not improve code or add value. This patch implements
option 2.

Change-Id: Ieac1be3baff6fce6c889e5eefc54dac6ed6094c7
Closes-bug: #1444584
'}]
commit_message:
Ignoring jshint on legacy JS code

Once undef and unused are enabled, legacy code will throw over 365 errors.
Remember that undef check for undefined variables while unused checks
for unused variables, both are good for quality control.

We have two options going forward:
1. Clean up legacy code
2. Ignore legacy code

Since legacy is stable enough, cleaning it up might have higher risk of
regression and does not improve code or add value. This patch implements
option 2.

Change-Id: Ieac1be3baff6fce6c889e5eefc54dac6ed6094c7
Closes-bug: #1444584

commit_message:
Compile horizon translation files.

In order to make horizon translations available, it's necessary to compile the
translation files in the horizon source tree. This requires gettext to
be installed. It would be better to do this at install time but it
requires the settings file be complete.

Change-Id: I23e664f97fab4745d91070773cbcf4d675adfb35
Closes-Bug: 1430445

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-18 03:33:17.000000000', 'message': "Remove unused URL_BASENAME from acquire-image

As far as I can tell URL_BASENAME is never used explicitly - it's just
duplicated into METADATA_PATH. I've removed one unneccessary line.

Change-Id: Ie87ee49b898448b75be7700752ac4b7a2c115870
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unused URL_BASENAME from acquire-image

As far as I can tell URL_BASENAME is never used explicitly - it's just
duplicated into METADATA_PATH. I've removed one unneccessary line.

Change-Id: Ie87ee49b898448b75be7700752ac4b7a2c115870

commit_message:
Kilo Consistency Group CLI update

This patch addresses the following:
* Modify Consistency Group
  * Add CLI to update a consistency group, i.e., changing name and
    description, adding existing volumes to CG and removing volumes
    from CG.

cinder consisgroup-update --name <name> --description <description>
    --add-volumes <uuid1,uuid2,...> --remove-volumes <uuid5,uuid6,...>

Implements: blueprint consistency-groups-kilo-update
Change-Id: I76317dc006c1f80e2e6c83218e9566f1d37d935e

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-20 19:20:54.000000000', 'message': "Remove paramiko from requirements.txt

Apparently any ssh we do in nova is done via the command line. Until we
change that to actually use paramiko (or a wrapper library), we don't
need the unused runtime dependency.

Change-Id: Id4eb435088bf5b42b3f752b245d3e2c02cad6cf1
"}]
commit_message:
Remove paramiko from requirements.txt

Apparently any ssh we do in nova is done via the command line. Until we
change that to actually use paramiko (or a wrapper library), we don't
need the unused runtime dependency.

Change-Id: Id4eb435088bf5b42b3f752b245d3e2c02cad6cf1

commit_message:
Set EnablePacemaker for the HA job

This enables pacemaker for the HA job by providing
a custom heat environment that can enable the setting
for us.

Change-Id: Ia69c2c78a2b62b7d92dd3925d8ff716664f006e2

Change-Id: I30e518e6b5da640976919d4c0cc83b01ce841dbd
"}]
commit_message:
Enforce owner readonly permissions on stackrc

This file may get copied around so we should make sure its not world
readable as we don't know the permissions of the parent directory.

Change-Id: I30e518e6b5da640976919d4c0cc83b01ce841dbd

commit_message:
Add function decorator `log_deprecated_args'

Add decorator `log_deprecated_args' that issues a message whenever
the decorated function is called with deprecated keyword arguments
supplied.  Message is issued only once or per each call depending
on the configuration.

Change-Id: Icedf72c40d9255f8d82233ebf640165d4827d53b

commit_message:
[Swift] Add base for Swift API Benchmarks: Patch-2

This patch adds swift scenarios, cleanup resource, and unit tests.

Swift Scenarios:
- create_container_and_object_then_list_objects
- create_container_and_object_then_delete_object
- create_container_and_object_then_download_object

Blueprint benchmark-scenarios-for-swift

This patch also fixed a minor bug with osclients.py where incorrect
"authurl" param name was used.

Change-Id: I0e5f09551fcf61e62347d56fd86f7baf9288adea

This looks fine, but I have some misgivings. Firstly, I spent a few hours at the sprint trying to get this to work on an Ubuntu machine after James and Dan's comments about rinse. I'm tempted to try this out and see what happens, but I suspect it will work fine on Fedora/RHEL/CentOS, and fail miserably on Debian/Ubuntu."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2015-03-31 21:39:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: -Code-Review

I'm still digging in, but it looks like the urlgrabber error is just the beginning on Ubuntu. Debian actually has a fix already for it, so I'm adding that patch to Ubuntu now: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/urlgrabber/+bug/1200288 -- That is SRU worthy since urlgrabber's default is entirely incompatible with the version of pycurl in Ubuntu.

However, the next one is that xz compression is not available, and I'm not sure where to start on that. Still, I think this may be worth chasing."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2015-04-01 00:25:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

Ok, so I have uploaded a fixed urlgrabber package to vivid and trusty-proposed. Using the fixed package, things work fine. One also needs python-lzma, which we should document clearly, as it is not listed in yum-utils's dependencies. I also submitted a bug to Debian that it should be added. I think this can land as-is, since it is likely to work fine on Debian and probably already does on Fedora/RH/CentOS"}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2015-04-06 21:32:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-06 22:05:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified+1

commit_message:
Add a yum-minimal element that just uses yum

The centos-minimal approach of using rinse does not, it turns out, work
on centos. That's a bummer. It's also rather heavyweight. Instead, with
minor machinations, we can just use yum itself pointed at a chroot.

Also adding fedora-minimal element which creates a fedora image using
the new yum-minimal approach.

Co-Authored-By: Gregory Haynes <greg@greghaynes.net>

Change-Id: I026fd9d323e786dae5bb67824c6501067e1ceaa3

'}, {'created': '2015-03-30 21:19:10.000000000', 'message': "Add element to process config-drive network info

If you don't want cloud-init, you may need to get a few things
from config-drive because you may be operating on a cloud with no DHCP.
In that case, simply reading some values from config-drive and writing
out either DHCP or static network info, in addition to grabbing ssh keys
is helpful. Both Infra and bifrost want this for their images.

Change-Id: I2746ed256b9783eab058b803130d3ccac484eaeb

commit_message:
Add element to process config-drive network info

If you don't want cloud-init, you may need to get a few things
from config-drive because you may be operating on a cloud with no DHCP.
In that case, simply reading some values from config-drive and writing
out either DHCP or static network info, in addition to grabbing ssh keys
is helpful. Both Infra and bifrost want this for their images.

Co-Authored-By: Gregory Haynes <greg@greghaynes.net>

Change-Id: I2746ed256b9783eab058b803130d3ccac484eaeb

commit_message:
VPNaaS: Refactor functional tests to use discover

Reworking so that modules with import errors are not silently
ignored (which was happening when using unitttest for loading
modules).

Verified that for each of the two functional jobs, the associated
modules are tested (some driver specific, some common).

Change-Id: I240a66cddb64dec7c6954bc249e69b2c9ed9628f
Closes-Bug: #1445056

commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] Security Group Nova Net

When nova networking is enabled, the input to security
groups needs to be by name.  When neutron, it needs
to be by id. This solves that issues.

Change-Id: If32671af90facd16e60caa33ed84ba7c9796ad11
Closes-Bug: #1445235
(cherry picked from commit b7de0333b13f73f6a66380623d7579373709c756)

commit_message:
Enable Trove plugin for devstack

devstack has implemented a plugin architecture for modules, which will
allow trove to manage how devstack installs trove from within the trove
repo. This change (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/167047 and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/167447 ) requires that we
notify devstack about the plugin.

The localrc.rc needs to have this command added:
enable_plugin trove $OPENSTACK_GITSOURCE/trove

Closes-Bug: #1445099
Change-Id: I20746491aa794bf84f93592dd386e676e5249ee0

commit_message:
Fix super cleanUp for fullstack ProcessFixture

This fixes a problem where the fullstack neutro-server process
would sometimes not be stopped after tests completed.

Change-Id: Iadf9f47fc22b39144cfc6163330ca60fefc8b464

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-17 03:40:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Could you add a test for this bug?'}, {'account_id': 15648, 'date': '2015-04-21 02:23:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

test already exists:

This is an implicit bug, because incorrect translation_type will raise InvalidTranslationType exception first.'}, {'account_id': 15648, 'date': '2015-04-21 02:25:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-21 02:29:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Nice catch!'}, {'account_id': 13790, 'date': '2015-04-21 02:40:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12875, 'date': '2015-04-21 19:08:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think the existing test is not sufficient because it was passing before your bug fix.  Maybe if you added a similar test with 

 'translation-type': 'LIS'

That would fail without your bug fix?"}, {'account_id': 15648, 'date': '2015-04-22 03:53:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15648, 'date': '2015-04-22 03:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The test won't fail without my fix.
see datasource_driver.py, line 378.

Whenever "LIS" or "LI" is passed to function `driver.register_translator()`, it will raise exception 'InvalidTranslationType' all the same with or without my bug fix in function `_validate_by_translation_type()`.

There is a `VALID_TRANSLATION_TYPES` check before my bug fix.
I've added the test if you wish.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-22 04:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

commit_message:
Fix incorrect validation of translation_type

translation_type should not be the substring of self.LIST.
It should match exactly to self.List.

Change-Id: Ia51b46dfe722ed0b4d7b2d4bdd0ae7da676001a5
Closes-Bug: #1445292

commit_message:
Add glean to infra

glean is the no-dependencies-required replacement for cloud-init that
understands Rackspace config-drive extensions and static networking.

Depends-On: Idf43e88813cdfdd8ed224f4393546725624e8a9a
Change-Id: Iaccc1851122b9acdc5c01c5041fa754f6746dfa9

commit_message:
Remove stable-compat-jobs for projects that have stable branchs

This affects keystonemiddleware, keystone and ceilometer client. Since
they now have stable branch, patch against master should not be tested
with gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-${name}-icehouse.

Change-Id: I3080c7b0b10b6178777f97ce07194299b7729a47

which is the way documented in OpenStack [1] and already the default
in puppetlabs-mysql [2].

[1] http://goo.gl/GA5gyZ
[2] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/blob/master/manifests/db.pp#L7

commit_message:
MySQL: change default MySQL collate to utf8_general_ci

Install & configure MySQL database by using utf8_general_ci collation
which is the way documented in OpenStack [1] and already the default
in puppetlabs-mysql [2].

[1] http://goo.gl/GA5gyZ
[2] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/blob/master/manifests/db.pp#L7

Change-Id: I9fb58a749436873b60b51bb67127ae9524f944db
Closes-bug: #1446375

subject: MySQL: change default MySQL collate to utf8_general_ci

commit_message:
MySQL: change default MySQL collate to utf8_general_ci

Install & configure MySQL database by using utf8_general_ci collation
which is the way documented in OpenStack [1] and already the default
in puppetlabs-mysql [2].

[1] http://goo.gl/GA5gyZ
[2] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/blob/master/manifests/db.pp#L7

Change-Id: I8037d3c1971e4b9bc965a9fd0884e1839585d071
Closes-bug: #1446375

commit_message:
MySQL: change default MySQL collate to utf8_general_ci

Install & configure MySQL database by using utf8_general_ci collation
which is the way documented in OpenStack [1] and already the default
in puppetlabs-mysql [2].

[1] http://goo.gl/GA5gyZ
[2] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/blob/master/manifests/db.pp#L7

Change-Id: I7ceecaa3e7fe964e53714cfd4c6fd2b8ff90fce0
Closes-bug: #1446375

One query I'd have is why python-keystoneclient (which has a stable branch already) doesn't have the equivalent?

 $ cat gerrit/acls/openstack/python-keystoneclient.config 
 [access "refs/heads/*"]
 abandon = group keystone-core
 label-Code-Review = -2..+2 group keystone-core
 label-Workflow = -1..+1 group keystone-core

 [access "refs/heads/proposed/*"]
 abandon = group keystone-milestone
 label-Code-Review = -2..+2 group keystone-milestone
 label-Workflow = -1..+1 group keystone-milestone

 [access "refs/tags/*"]
 pushSignedTag = group keystone-release

 [receive]
 requireChangeId = true
 requireContributorAgreement = true

 [submit]
 mergeContent = true'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2015-04-15 11:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

- gate-project-config-jenkins-project http://logs.openstack.org/82/172982/1/check/gate-project-config-jenkins-project/924b026/ : SUCCESS in 17s'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2015-04-20 23:39:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think this is the job of openstack's release managers. Can we check with them to make sure they are on board delegating this action?"}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2015-04-21 00:23:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I need to be able to create branches for python-neutronclient. Are we delegating that responsibility to the release manager from now on? We've not done this in clients before. Perhaps I'll sync with Doug and ttx first."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2015-04-21 16:46:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's fine to have a neutron-release group as long as the existing release team is a member so we can help with issues."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2015-04-21 16:47:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2015-04-21 16:49:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Wait, on second thought I'm not sure we want that. It isn't necessary to be able to create a branch to create a release, and I think we want to make sure branch creation is managed by the release team for now. Thierry, please let me know if I have your intent wrong there or if you have plans we haven't discussed related to the big tent changes."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2015-04-21 19:40:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Could you explain why you'd need that right for ?

Release management will probably still do stable/* in the future. Is that for feature branches ? If yes, we usually discuss and create them as well (to avoid spreading over too many branches and become confusing)"}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2015-04-22 20:53:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

based on doug and ttx's responses, branch management should be coming from the release management team."}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2015-04-22 21:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Per discussion, not needed.'}]

Change-Id: Id5afca1d49058590713c7196a99e2e9965e35ab0
'}]
commit_message:
Add neutron-release as branch creation group

Allow creation of branches for python-neutronclient.

Change-Id: Id5afca1d49058590713c7196a99e2e9965e35ab0

commit_message:
Change stackforge references to openstack

README and prepare_devstack.sh were using stackforge/congress. However,
with Congress now being part of Openstack this needs to be updated

Change-Id: I26aa9c5b15a695ffe12cfbea89593cc2342bf4fd

the tree.

The other action we've exposed through the Python client is the policy-simulate command; to see how that works, check out congressclient/osc/v1/policy.py:SimulatePolicy

And you need to enable that class by modifying congressclient/setup.cfg.  Add something like the following to the list of commands already there.

congress_datasource_execute = congressclient.osc.v1.datasource:ExecuteDatasource"}, {'account_id': 14795, 'date': '2015-04-22 00:03:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add client datasource action API for action-execution-interface

The changes add function to call datasource action API to execute
and action on a specified service, e.g.
POST v1/data-sources/nova?action=execute

Implements: blueprint action-execution-interface

Change-Id: I34568c7e853245b85a40da7e9f17aa098bd32089

[{'account_id': 8876, 'date': '2015-03-05 17:01:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8876, 'date': '2015-03-05 17:05:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-05 17:13:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

- gate-nova-specs-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/82/161782/2/check/gate-nova-specs-docs/e9cd9a6//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 10s
- gate-nova-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/82/161782/2/check/gate-nova-specs-python27/68b98ae/ : SUCCESS in 1m 43s'}, {'account_id': 9060, 'date': '2015-03-05 17:58:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

From an operator's perspective, it would be great to have a quick quota fix feature like this.  I did not know about the until_refresh/max_age combo before, so that's also a step forward for some interim solution.

Obviously the ideal thing is to fix the quota bugs in the first place so quotas won't get out of sync.  But if we think that is going to continue to be a problem, it would be nice to give operators the tooling to be able to fix it quickly (and without going to SQL.)

As far as whether this feature should be exposed for project owners, I'm on the fence.  On one hand it'd be a nice self-service fix thing, but on the other hand it also sends a pretty poor message to end users: "Hey go run this quota refresh call if you think your quota usage is screwed up."  End users will expect quota usage to be accurate in the first place.

+1'ing because as an operator I want something like this.  However I understand that all the technical details need to be hashed out yet.'}, {'account_id': 9237, 'date': '2015-03-05 18:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

As someone who has had to go in to the database and manually fix quotas multiple times, I think this is a good idea.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2015-03-05 19:02:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

While I would prefer to fix the quota issue by making it not get out of sync ever. This sounds like a reasonable interim solution, perhaps one that we can treat as a bug and land in Kilo.'}, {'account_id': 136, 'date': '2015-03-05 19:36:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Confirm the operator need for a process to recalculate quotas. We get this at CERN all the time and the pressure is to fix the quota (i.e. give a bit more quickly) rather than find the inconsistent data.'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2015-03-06 06:46:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2015-03-06 18:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

If there are any reproducible quota bugs that we can fix in the mean time?'}, {'account_id': 8579, 'date': '2015-03-07 22:56:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

This is a real annoyance for any self-service system.
As a principle, I'd rather not build this into the code.
However, it seems that every operator has some kind of script laying around to fix this very issue (have one myself).
So having a standard path to do it without playing inside the database at least shields us from potential manipulation errors.

I would restrict usage to admin only.
If an operator wants to open up to owner, it's his choice. 
As an operator, this also allows for a clean way to delegate the task to support staff."}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2015-03-09 05:25:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Ahmed

Thanks for your comment, I got another idea from your comment.
How about having/implementing a script tool in nova repository for this feature instead of implementing it as REST API?
If implementing a REST API, this feature seems a standard way, not a workaround. and even if fixing a root problem, we cannot remove this REST API because of backwards incompatibility.
If administrator only needs this feature, a script would be enough instead of REST API, I feel.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2015-03-11 13:41:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

I'd prefer to see this in nova-manage rather than a REST API probably.  If we can't fix quota bugs and we want to give the admin a lever to pull that goes directly to the database, nova-manage is a good option for now. We could always move a thing out of nova-manage and into a REST API later, but once it's an API we can't remove it."}, {'account_id': 9060, 'date': '2015-03-11 20:37:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8876, 'date': '2015-03-11 21:34:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)

So if I sum up:
 * Such a feature is useful
 * nova-manage is a better place to host it

I will upload a new version of the specs accordingly.
Thank you all for your comments.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2015-03-11 21:36:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I am very interested to hear how to possible reproduce some of these quota bugs so we can better understand them and hopefully fix the root causes.

Steps to reproduce don't have to be short or work every time. Something like, run this script for an hour and hope something breaks is fine.

I am looking for what types of operations and whatnot are causing these issues"}, {'account_id': 9237, 'date': '2015-03-11 21:49:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

No, I don't think its that simple. If we knew where the bugs were, we'd be pushing to have them fixed without needing this workaround. All we know at this point is we've seen times where various parts of the dashboard's arithmetic don't add up. Leading to users complaining at times that they aren't using the the instances that they are claimed to be using. What causes it is a mystery at the moment.

That said, I've mostly experienced it in tenants that were some of the earliest created during a new cloud deploy, so I do think its somewhat related to misconfiguration or a condition where if some component is not contactable due to network issue or something, a wrong value is entered. What exactly those conditions though, I'm not sure.

It would be interesting to see if someone could come up with some test cases where a not all services were online for a bit, launch/delete vm's, and double check quota after."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2015-03-11 22:17:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Kevin, so that is useful feedback. I am trying keep all the feedback on the tracking bug. I see you have posted some of this there already, thanks.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2015-03-12 00:27:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

woops forgot to link the bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1284424'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2015-03-12 22:46:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Has anyone tried "nova quota-delete --tenant UUID" to fix quota counts? My preliminary testing show it works (resets usage to 0, then upon some action that touches quotas they get reset correctly)'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2015-03-12 22:49:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

So Here is a quick proof of concept of this spec as a nova-manage command:

http://paste.ubuntu.com/10588043/


This has the added benefit over nova quota-delete that it doesn't reset quota usage to 0 initially."}, {'account_id': 9060, 'date': '2015-03-13 23:34:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

FWIW, I deployed max_age and until_refresh in our envs today.  Did a short write-up on it for those interested (or finding themselves here from a google search): http://t.co/Q5X1hTgJG1'}, {'account_id': 8876, 'date': '2015-03-17 09:34:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-17 09:56:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Very much in favor of going forward with the proposed solution, and _not_ the alternative laid out in the spec.

If this tool only resets the quota usages to -1 (forcing a refresh on the next reservation), we still run the risk of that refresh-triggering reservation failing (when the out of sync usage is already too high and exceeds the user's/project's limit.)

It's better to actually fix the usage value directly, so that any future reservations will run correctly."}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2015-03-19 22:35:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

For some reasons*, the quotas usage can be out of sync.
When a quota is wrongfully reached, a user cannot launch new VMs anymore.
This "refresh" feature allows operators to quickly unblock users without
manually running queries against the database or temporarily increase the
quota.

[*] It seems that there are several root causes and there is no procedure
    to reproduce bugs. Although these root causes will eventually be
    identified, we cannot guarantee that some bugs will not occur again.

commit_message:
Refresh quotas usage

For some reasons*, the quotas usage can be out of sync.
When a quota is wrongfully reached, a user cannot launch new VMs anymore.
This "refresh" feature allows operators to quickly unblock users without
manually running queries against the database or temporarily increase the
quota.

[*] It seems that there are several root causes and there is no procedure
    to reproduce bugs. Although these root causes will eventually be
    identified, we cannot guarantee that some bugs will not occur again.

Change-Id: I2facab15aa858c7920d01bd6bcd5d637e7a966f3

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 00:31:49.000000000', 'message': 'Increasing gap between form-groups

In new Launch Instance wizard, vertical margin between .form-group(s) is
zero, causing form fields getting too close.

Steps to reproduce:

- Open new Launch Instance wizard.
- Switch to Key Pare step
- Click on `Import Key Pair` button, you will see the Public Key field
  is too close to Key Pair Name field.

Change-Id: I0917238fc8dcf62ebe8ab8431cc7c37975f9b10b
Closes-Bug: #1446421
'}]
commit_message:
Increasing gap between form-groups

In new Launch Instance wizard, vertical margin between .form-group(s) is
zero, causing form fields getting too close.

Steps to reproduce:

- Open new Launch Instance wizard.
- Switch to Key Pare step
- Click on `Import Key Pair` button, you will see the Public Key field
  is too close to Key Pair Name field.

Change-Id: I0917238fc8dcf62ebe8ab8431cc7c37975f9b10b
Closes-Bug: #1446421

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-07 23:08:26.000000000', 'message': 'Improve a bit nova-spec tests

* If we add new spec without some "section" now we will get clear
  assertation failure. Before it was KeyError trace

* Assert that we found at least 1 release that will be tested.
  Otherwise test is quite dangerous, because if path is specified
  wrong it will 100% pass

Change-Id: I2a1241889ef5f0b5153cc3e3f64b4083a9ac0c03
'}]
commit_message:
Improve a bit nova-spec tests

* If we add new spec without some "section" now we will get clear
  assertation failure. Before it was KeyError trace

* Assert that we found at least 1 release that will be tested.
  Otherwise test is quite dangerous, because if path is specified
  wrong it will 100% pass

Change-Id: I2a1241889ef5f0b5153cc3e3f64b4083a9ac0c03

commit_message:
Add diskimage-builder functests

In diskimage-builder Ie491e27f00bde54f73af6b47c9696ec04d973b14 we are
adding functional tests. Adding jobs per distro since this a very
distro-dependent operation.

Change-Id: Ic80f44fc07c7ae9b4498417dee38e123fe1c2e71

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-20 15:47:31.000000000', 'message': "Fix RabbitMQ ocf_run with the timeout command.

W/o this fix, the timeout command is used with ocf_run wrapper,
which uses a 'su'. This is an issue as the 'su' changes the original
process group. And if the timeout command expired, it would kill
only processes in this original process group, leaving orphaned
commands what do not belong to whis group anymore.

The solution is to not use the ocf_run for timeout wrapped commands
in the OCF script.

Closes-bug: #1446241

Change-Id: I139255237fd34b555f248cb826deb13b7e134e8d
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
"}, {'created': '2015-04-21 08:15:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix RabbitMQ ocf_run with the timeout command.

W/o this fix, the timeout command is used with rabbitmqctl
wrapper, which uses a 'su' when invoked as not a rabbitmq user.
This is an issue as the 'su' changes the original
process group. And if the timeout command expired, it would kill
only processes in this original process group, leaving orphaned
commands what do not belong to whis group anymore.

The solution is to issue all timeout wrapped rabbitmqctl commands
as the rabbitmq user in the OCF script.

Closes-bug: #1446241

Change-Id: I139255237fd34b555f248cb826deb13b7e134e8d
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Fix RabbitMQ ocf_run with the timeout command.

W/o this fix, the timeout command is used with rabbitmqctl
wrapper, which uses a 'su' when invoked as not a rabbitmq user.
This is an issue as the 'su' changes the original
process group. And if the timeout command expired, it would kill
only processes in this original process group, leaving orphaned
commands what do not belong to whis group anymore.

The solution is to issue all timeout wrapped rabbitmqctl commands
as the rabbitmq user in the OCF script.

Closes-bug: #1446241

Change-Id: I139255237fd34b555f248cb826deb13b7e134e8d
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Move tripleo-puppet-elements to tripleo-core

The repository is only related to TripleO and does not contain Puppet
code. This change switches the core reviewer rights from
puppet-manager-core to tripleo-core. The other bits of the
setup (project group, gerritbot) are already set up correctly.

Change-Id: Ib37937dbc0b63a8fdd2d45853d3725047b9bdc5a

[{'created': '2015-04-20 15:36:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fix RabbitMQ apps eval in OCF

W/o this fix, if there are no apps running and rabbit node is actually
not functioning, get_status() would still report 0 considering the rabbit
resource is running. This is an issue as it may lead to the situations
when the resource reported OK, but in fact, the rabbit node is not a cluster
member.

The solution is to not rely only on which_applications() eval exit code
and test if the kernel app is running. Otherwise consider the pacemaker
resource is "not running" as well.

Closes-bug: #1446251

Change-Id: Ia2fcb18abb3d977c5fcb26bfdeac864b6834f478
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Fix RabbitMQ apps eval in OCF

W/o this fix, if there are no apps running and rabbit node is actually
not functioning, get_status() would still report 0 considering the rabbit
resource is running. This is an issue as it may lead to the situations
when the resource reported OK, but in fact, the rabbit node is not a cluster
member.

The solution is to not rely only on which_applications() eval exit code
and test if the kernel app is running. Otherwise consider the pacemaker
resource is "not running" as well.

Closes-bug: #1446251

Change-Id: Ia2fcb18abb3d977c5fcb26bfdeac864b6834f478
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-17 10:58:09.000000000', 'message': "Defer creation of router JSON in get_routers RPC

The get_routers method in the l3 RPC code has a log.debug
statement that formats all of the router data as indented
JSON. This method can be expensive if there are hundreds
of routers being synced and it happens even if debugging
is disabled since the function call result is the parameter
to the debug statement.

This patch adds and leverages a small helper class that takes a
callable and its args and defers calling it until the __str__ method
is called on it when it's actually trying to be rendered to a string.

Change-Id: I2bfceb286ce30f2a3595381b62bdc6dd71ed8483
Partial-Bug: #1445412
"}, {'created': '2015-04-21 08:12:57.000000000', 'message': "Defer creation of router JSON in get_routers RPC

statement that formats all of the router data as indented
JSON. This method can be expensive if there are hundreds
of routers being synced and it happens even if debugging
is disabled since the function call result is the parameter
to the debug statement.

This patch adds and leverages a small helper class that takes a
callable and its args and defers calling it until the __str__ method
is called on it when it's actually trying to be rendered to a string.

Change-Id: I2bfceb286ce30f2a3595381b62bdc6dd71ed8483
Partial-Bug: #1445412
"}]
commit_message:
Defer creation of router JSON in get_routers RPC

The get_routers method in the l3 RPC code has a log.debug
statement that formats all of the router data as indented
JSON. This method can be expensive if there are hundreds
of routers being synced and it happens even if debugging
is disabled since the function call result is the parameter
to the debug statement.

This patch adds and leverages a small helper class that takes a
callable and its args and defers calling it until the __str__ method
is called on it when it's actually trying to be rendered to a string.

Change-Id: I2bfceb286ce30f2a3595381b62bdc6dd71ed8483
Partial-Bug: #1445412

commit_message:
Upgrade rootwrap configuration for Nova Compute

This patch upgrades the rootwrap configuration for the compute
service, so that patches requiring new rootwrap configuration
can be tested with grenade.

Change-Id: I37dd5f7295a7ed92e6268003289cee4896dde8c0
Closes-Bug: #1416132

commit_message:
Upload app public key in app-create

Fetch the public key from the created plan, and use the
user's credentials to upload the public key. For the
API calls, a personal access token is accepted or generated
on behalf of the user.

Adds --private flag to app-create to force the upload.

Change-Id: I74a6055ad3301a3f4e5289d7b7b09bdabbc6306b

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-26 17:26:52.000000000', 'message': "Added note about removing bridge from mappings

A bridge removed from mappings is not managed by the OVS agent anymore,
but continues to be connected to the integration bridge.
Added a note about it in the config so that deployers make sure they
don't end up in a sticky situation.

Change-Id: I8992f842046651e0f231c6bf08b65efa07056757
Related-bug: #1436267
"}]
commit_message:
Added note about removing bridge from mappings

A bridge removed from mappings is not managed by the OVS agent anymore,
but continues to be connected to the integration bridge.
Added a note about it in the config so that deployers make sure they
don't end up in a sticky situation.

Change-Id: I8992f842046651e0f231c6bf08b65efa07056757
Related-bug: #1436267

commit_message:
[install-guide] update git URLs for Swift

* change branch from juno to kilo
* use git.openstack.org instead of githubusercontent.com

Partially implements bp installguide-kilo.

Change-Id: I359916c17e20353f82537a51a82d6ffecedade3c

commit_message:
Refactor utility to find identity resources

Based on the comments made in this patch:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/174908/2/

We should simplify and refactor the way we handle finding identity
resources.

Change-Id: I77db2e3564faa90a917082a6c6cb87269e93aebe

[{'created': '2015-04-10 20:15:55.000000000', 'message': 'Added vrrp_ip and ha_ip to amphora models

vrrp_ip will typically be the ip through which the amphora communicates with
its vrrp peer.

ha_ip will typically be the ip that is shared between the amphorae.

Since it is possible each amphora may have a different ha_ip and vrrp_ip,
it makes sense to add them to the model/table.  Adding them now because the
network driver will be assigning the values.

Changed the network driver spec and base class to mention the plug_vip method
should return a list of amphoras.

Change-Id: I04a97caf00bc6fa25f94e6470d3ed7da48880ae6
'}]
commit_message:
Added vrrp_ip and ha_ip to amphora models

vrrp_ip will typically be the ip through which the amphora communicates with
its vrrp peer.

ha_ip will typically be the ip that is shared between the amphorae.

Since it is possible each amphora may have a different ha_ip and vrrp_ip,
it makes sense to add them to the model/table.  Adding them now because the
network driver will be assigning the values.

Changed the network driver spec and base class to mention the plug_vip method
should return a list of amphoras.

Change-Id: I04a97caf00bc6fa25f94e6470d3ed7da48880ae6

[{'created': '2014-08-12 21:04:13.000000000', 'message': "Support stateful_path in control files

Adds a new option to os-apply-config control files called stateful_path.
The option is a boolean value defaulted to False. If True, the rendered
template's file path will be prefixed with the path from the
$STATEFUL_PATH environment variable.

This allows for some templates to be written under a configurable
stateful path directory (vs. a hardcoded /mnt/state), and some templates
to just be written under /.

Change-Id: I4c2ffbcc3183bf566209f6fc1446028847e6a59d
"}, {'created': '2014-09-03 09:08:24.000000000', 'message': "Support stateful_path in control files

Adds a new option to os-apply-config control files called stateful_path.
The option is a boolean value defaulted to False. If True, the rendered
template's file path will be prefixed with the path from the
$STATEFUL_PATH environment variable.

This allows for some templates to be written under a configurable
stateful path directory (vs. a hardcoded /mnt/state), and some templates
to just be written under /.

Change-Id: I4c2ffbcc3183bf566209f6fc1446028847e6a59d
"}]
commit_message:
Support stateful_path in control files

Adds a new option to os-apply-config control files called stateful_path.
The option is a boolean value defaulted to False. If True, the rendered
template's file path will be prefixed with the path from the
$STATEFUL_PATH environment variable.

This allows for some templates to be written under a configurable
stateful path directory (vs. a hardcoded /mnt/state), and some templates
to just be written under /.

Change-Id: I4c2ffbcc3183bf566209f6fc1446028847e6a59d

[{'created': '2015-04-21 20:55:40.000000000', 'message': 'Add puppet stackforge modules to tripleo jobs

We need to set the PROJECTS variable so that it contains all the
various puppet stackforge projects so that we can have proper
refspecs setup in /opt/stack/new for our CI jobs. This will
allow TripleO to provide CI coverage on these projects

Change-Id: I0aced3c0d1f3d2ce0bca00de847e41eee4dd2877

commit_message:
Add puppet stackforge modules to tripleo jobs

We need to set the PROJECTS variable so that it contains all the
various puppet stackforge projects so that we can have proper
refspecs setup in /opt/stack/new for our CI jobs. This will
allow TripleO to provide CI coverage on these projects
once we decide to enable it.

Change-Id: I0aced3c0d1f3d2ce0bca00de847e41eee4dd2877

commit_message:
Set EnablePacemaker == false be default

Pacemaker is a new feature and should probably be disabled
by default.

Change-Id: I840d08c9e0563aeb7128eb2b21929612b7a5bf7a

commit_message:
Parameter to enable/disable controller swift store

Adds a new ControllerEnableSwiftStorage parameter that
can be used to enable/disable use of the contoller node
as a Swift storage node.

Change-Id: Ic54144f4a46a671818c2f12e419cfa619b0dc1f9

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-10 23:06:27.000000000', 'message': 'Add option to enable ceph storage on controller

This patch adds a new ControllerEnableCephStorage option
which can be used to install and configure Ceph storage
(OSD) on the controller node.

The default is to have this disabled by default (this is
probably a more production like setting).

The motivation for this change is to help facilitate CI
jobs which actually use Ceph. Right now we have an issue
where once the Heat stack finishes Ceph is configured
and ready, but Cinder volume (required by our CI
devtest_overcloud.sh test) may or may not have had
enough time to recognize the amount of storage
on the remote Ceph storage nodes. Waiting another
periodic cycle for Cinder volume to recognize the
actual amount of storage on the remote OSD nodes
would work but there isn't a good way to do this
ATM. The right solution here is probably to
implement Heat breakpoints in our CI. As we haven't quite
landed that change, another option is to simply
make the controller node also be a Ceph storage node.
Since this runs as "step 2" within the controller
it ensures that the OSD will be available and thus
Cinder volume will register the correct amount of
storage on startup.

Enabling this feature also matches what we do with Swift
storage on the Controller (although we should provide
an option to actually disable this as well).

Change-Id: Ic47d028591edbaab83a52d7f38283d7805b63042

commit_message:
Add option to enable ceph storage on controller

This patch adds a new ControllerEnableCephStorage option
which can be used to install and configure Ceph storage
(OSD) on the controller node.

The default is to have this disabled by default (this is
probably a more production like setting).

The motivation for this change is to help facilitate CI
jobs which actually use Ceph. Right now we have an issue
where once the Heat stack finishes Ceph is configured
and ready, but Cinder volume (required by our CI
devtest_overcloud.sh test) may or may not have had
enough time to recognize the amount of storage
on the remote Ceph storage nodes. Waiting another
periodic cycle for Cinder volume to recognize the
actual amount of storage on the remote OSD nodes
would work but there isn't a good way to do this
ATM. The right solution here is probably to
implement Heat breakpoints in our CI. As we haven't quite
landed that change, another option is to simply
make the controller node also be a Ceph storage node.
Since this runs as "step 2" within the controller
it ensures that the OSD will be available and thus
Cinder volume will register the correct amount of
storage on startup.

Enabling this feature also matches what we do with Swift
storage on the Controller (although we should provide
an option to actually disable this as well).

Change-Id: Ic47d028591edbaab83a52d7f38283d7805b63042

commit_message:
Add third party CI working group tools repository

This adds the repository for third party ci tools, documents, configuration
settings and plugins as discussed in the working group meetings.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartyCIWorkingGroup
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/third-party-ci-wg-repo
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/third_party/2015/third_party.2015-04-15-15.01.log.html

Change-Id: I8e5d8e537abb84c2eaea4b3ece3a17c24d05e503

Given that this bug causes breakage of heat, I think we should have unit test to cover this scenario.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2015-04-22 09:46:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This patch will broke nova.floating_ips_bulk.list, since FloatingIPBulkManager uses FloatingIP class too[*]. Nova API doesn't return `ip` attribute for nova.floating_ips_bulk.list request:

    >>> nova.floating_ips_bulk.list()[0].__dict__
    {'instance_uuid': None, 
     'manager': novaclient.v1_1.floating_ips_bulk.FloatingIPBulkManager object at 0x7fe0d5ade1d0>, 
     'address': u'<removed>', 
     'interface': u'eth0', 
     '_info': {u'interface': u'eth0', 
               u'instance_uuid': None, 
               u'project_id': None, 
               u'pool': u'nova', 
               u'address': u'<removed>'}, 
     'project_id': None, 
     'pool': u'nova', 
     '_loaded': True}"}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2015-04-22 10:03:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2015-04-22 10:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

thanks for the review, new one coming.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2015-04-22 10:09:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-22 10:53:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

commit_message:
Fix Floating ip __repr__()

Use self.ip not self.address

Note this is breaking heat's gate.

Change-Id: I8d7a2edd343118369c79b50d671a59615bc447fd
Closes-bug: 1437244

commit_message:
Use identity_uri_transform for identiry_uri support

Remove deprecated keys and use identity_uri via the new transform
helper method.

Also, cleanup specs for endpoint testing to make sure Common is
fully tested.

Change-Id: I3beac9d8d80d8a1a15e44bf944f1d8ca84d45350
Implements: blueprint identity-uri
