commit_message:
Allow mq setup for keystone

In some cases, keystone notifications are required. This
Add identity to the list of component that could use messaging.

Another patch to Common must go in before this one.

Change-Id: I0ef0274991510197b28de496f2af53d9e88fa2cd
Partial-Bug: #1439306

going on with tests that causes tests to fail when run individually
without this change.

Change-Id: Ifc0b71656c87eacf3b8a37edafda00a7f3978b48
"}, {'created': '2015-04-22 16:35:59.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly request cloud name in test_caching

commit_message:
Explicitly request cloud name in test_caching

It's not entirely clear why, but there is some confusing interaction
going on with tests that causes tests to fail when run individually
without this change.

Change-Id: Ifc0b71656c87eacf3b8a37edafda00a7f3978b48

commit_message:
Kerberos

Uses the keystoneclient_kerberos auth plugin (if available)
to perfrom Kerberos authentication instead of userid and password
Logic is based on the presence of the KRB5CCNAME in the request;
this value is placed in the environment by mod_auth_kerb and
is required for S4U2Proxy request to Keystone.

Change-Id: I368367c2b6a9be7feaf545e8a6f676665101d82b

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-22 01:14:36.000000000', 'message': "service child process normal SIGTERM exit

service.py had some code where the child process would catch the
SIGTERM from the parent just so it could exit with 1 status rather
than with an indication that it exited due to SIGTERM. When
shutting down the parent doesn't care in what way the child ended,
only that they're all gone, so this code is unnecessary.

Also, for some reason this caused the child to never exit while
there was an open connection from a client. Probably something
with eventlet and signal handling.

Change-Id: Ie51669bd278288b768311ddf56ad31a2f28cc7ab
Closes-Bug: #1446583
"}]
commit_message:
service child process normal SIGTERM exit

service.py had some code where the child process would catch the
SIGTERM from the parent just so it could exit with 1 status rather
than with an indication that it exited due to SIGTERM. When
shutting down the parent doesn't care in what way the child ended,
only that they're all gone, so this code is unnecessary.

Also, for some reason this caused the child to never exit while
there was an open connection from a client. Probably something
with eventlet and signal handling.

Change-Id: Ie51669bd278288b768311ddf56ad31a2f28cc7ab
Closes-Bug: #1446583

commit_message:
Test flavor cache and add invalidation

Adding get_flavor_cache call so that the dogpile.cache decorator can
provide a magic invalidate method.

Change-Id: If3523430b9a9b816f72ef3aaf9100a2db17f09ad

commit_message:
Break install-types out of base

We support building elements without depending on the base element.
Breaking install-types out into its own element while making base depend
on it so elements can depend in it without base.

Change-Id: I104543d5482c76f60902e9fc32d91e196eeab51a

commit_message:
Direct ssh bash output to /dev/null

When using Fedora image the ssh command that executes
netcat doesn't return because stdout remanins open.

Closes-Bug: 1439065
Change-Id: I41a75a5a262ce184cbbb57c39863af3d8f21ad61

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-17 04:45:54.000000000', 'message': "Set IPset hash type to 'net' instead of 'ip'

The previous hash type was 'ip' and this caused a major
issue with the allowed address pairs extension since it
results in CIDRs being passed to ipset. When the hash type
is 'ip', a CIDR is completely enumerated into all of its
addresses so 10.100.0.0/16 results in ~65k entries. This
meant a single allowed_address_pairs entry could easily
exhaust an entire set.

This patch changes the hash type to 'net', which is designed
to handle a CIDRs as a single entry.

This patch also changes the names of the ipsets because
creating an ipset with different parameters will cause an
error and our ipset manager code isn't robust enough to handle
that at this time. There is another ongoing patch to fix
that but it won't be ready in time.[1]

The related bug was closed by increasing the set limit, which
did alleviate the problem. However, this change would also
address the issue because the gate tests run an allowed address
pairs extension test with the CIDR mentioned above.

1. I59e2e1c090cb95ee1bd14dbb53b6ff2c5e2713fd

Related-Bug: #1439817
Closes-Bug: #1444397
Change-Id: I8177699b157cd3eac46e2f481f47b5d966c49b07
(cherry picked from commit a38b5df5cd3c47672705aad4c30e789ae11ec958)
"}]
commit_message:
Set IPset hash type to 'net' instead of 'ip'

The previous hash type was 'ip' and this caused a major
issue with the allowed address pairs extension since it
results in CIDRs being passed to ipset. When the hash type
is 'ip', a CIDR is completely enumerated into all of its
addresses so 10.100.0.0/16 results in ~65k entries. This
meant a single allowed_address_pairs entry could easily
exhaust an entire set.

This patch changes the hash type to 'net', which is designed
to handle a CIDRs as a single entry.

This patch also changes the names of the ipsets because
creating an ipset with different parameters will cause an
error and our ipset manager code isn't robust enough to handle
that at this time. There is another ongoing patch to fix
that but it won't be ready in time.[1]

The related bug was closed by increasing the set limit, which
did alleviate the problem. However, this change would also
address the issue because the gate tests run an allowed address
pairs extension test with the CIDR mentioned above.

1. I59e2e1c090cb95ee1bd14dbb53b6ff2c5e2713fd

Related-Bug: #1439817
Closes-Bug: #1444397
Change-Id: I8177699b157cd3eac46e2f481f47b5d966c49b07
(cherry picked from commit a38b5df5cd3c47672705aad4c30e789ae11ec958)

commit_message:
[install-guide] [yum] initialize /etc/cinder/cinder.conf file

At the moment RDO packages do not ship a /etc/cinder/cinder.conf file
and it is necessary to manually copy /usr/share/cinder/cinder-dist.conf
to /etc/cinder/cinder.conf.

Workaround for https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1212900.

Partially implements bp installguide-kilo.

Change-Id: I21e22f7234613baa44aa8588a0c07c588b5d8183

commit_message:
Add the openstackid-resources repo

The openstackid-resources repository will host development of a
separate resource service for OpenStack Foundation information, such
as that used by the new marketplace system. This is tightly coupled
to OpenStackID token-based authroization, hence the repo name.

Change-Id: I8981926868bfdbbd7df6c53b4c02a8647a9dc0c8

commit_message:
[install-guide] [yum] initialize /etc/heat/heat.conf file

At the moment RDO packages do not ship a /etc/heat/heat.conf file
and it is necessary to manually copy /usr/share/heat/heat-dist.conf
to /etc/heat/heat.conf.

Workaround for https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1213476.

Partially implements bp installguide-kilo.

Change-Id: I93376e1f881409063bd7687a3ee0f8fc46bdb882

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-22 18:13:07.000000000', 'message': "Hyper-V: Sets *DataRoot paths for instances

Sets the path for the instance's ConfigurationDataRoot,
LogDataRoot, SnapshotDataRoot, SuspendDataRoot and
SwapFileDataRoot for vmutilsv2 instances and
ExternalDataRoot and SnapshotDataRoot for vmutils
to the instance's location.

Closes-Bug: #1430239

Change-Id: I3c9e2dece00df06cafdcd164ece6269337feda71
(cherry picked from commit 3e42c7ae3f7a9353834c8c9c4dc79ee39dd0783b)
"}]
commit_message:
Hyper-V: Sets *DataRoot paths for instances

Sets the path for the instance's ConfigurationDataRoot,
LogDataRoot, SnapshotDataRoot, SuspendDataRoot and
SwapFileDataRoot for vmutilsv2 instances and
ExternalDataRoot and SnapshotDataRoot for vmutils
to the instance's location.

Closes-Bug: #1430239

Change-Id: I3c9e2dece00df06cafdcd164ece6269337feda71
(cherry picked from commit 3e42c7ae3f7a9353834c8c9c4dc79ee39dd0783b)

commit_message:
Removes an unused tox environment

The venv environment is a hold over from when we were trying to share a
single virtualenv for multiple tox environments.

Change-Id: I1391a26433455539e8e552b5a7b6c03f778cddd8

commit_message:
Fix major update_user issues

update_user didn't actually work at all, and needed porting to the
tasks system. Also it needs to invalidate the user cache to make sure
the latest list is requested.

Note that this breaks backward compatibility because defaulting the
enabled argument to True would mean we are unable to tell if the user
passed True, or left it blank. But the old method was entirely broken
anyway so we don't care at all.

Change-Id: Ief38f75b9b715cf149ada599c28cea03f99c8174

commit_message:
create_user should return the user created

Otherwise callers won't know what ID their new user was assigned.

Change-Id: I3949b92aed7e1f262be43772846fc493e60f5462

commit_message:
Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

Change-Id: I37e0acc5ed8e1af565359290fa622456901c735e

I missed this - it looks like this is now appending to $PATH but the commit msg now says we should set a static path.

IMO we should really be setting a static PATH rather than appending, but others here seem to disagree?'}, {'account_id': 6721, 'date': '2015-04-17 00:16:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Originally I went with a static PATH, but decided to move to an appended PATH later. I did this because I thought that valid users might have additional things in their PATH that they depend upon.

Appending is almost certain to create duplicates in the PATH, although this probably doesn't matter.

I don't mind if it's static or appended, as either method will allow me to proceed using DIB."}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2015-04-17 08:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

hi Greg, from Ben comment "valid users might have additional things in their PATH that they depend upon"

to me this is a key factor for appending because we don't have control over which elements one is using and they might be using scripts placed somewhere out of a 'standard' path'}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2015-04-17 16:31:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This path operation only applies to inside the chroot though? So the case where it would matter is a user wanting to append to the PATH variable for operations that occur inside the chroot. I cant think of a use case where a user cant instead set PATH in their own element scripts if they want that?'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2015-04-20 23:34:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2015-04-22 16:21:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Although im still partial to just setting a sane path this does fix a bug and not make things worse, so im ok with it.'}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2015-04-22 16:21:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-22 16:21:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Verified

[{'created': '2015-04-15 21:17:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes path for distros lacking :/bin

Some distros lack a /bin directory, instead opting for symlinks to
/usr/bin. This patch alters the path to use an appropriate superset of
paths to fix dib on these distros.

Change-Id: I084aff7e449f5de811a6169ec90e352ada7da439
'}, {'created': '2015-04-16 09:01:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes path for distros lacking :/bin

Some distros lack a /bin directory, instead opting for symlinks to
/usr/bin. This patch alters the path to add an appropriate superset of
paths to fix dib on these distros.

Change-Id: I084aff7e449f5de811a6169ec90e352ada7da439
'}, {'created': '2015-04-16 10:19:35.000000000', 'message': "Fixes path for distros lacking :/bin

Some distros lack a /bin directory, instead opting for symlinks to
/usr/bin. This creates a problem because during image creation,
chroot commands will inherit the system's PATH (which lacks /bin).
As a result the 'sh' binary is not found (among others).

This patch alters the path to add an appropriate superset of
paths to fix dib on these distros.

Change-Id: I084aff7e449f5de811a6169ec90e352ada7da439
"}, {'created': '2015-04-16 18:23:29.000000000', 'message': 'Append full path to img-functions:run_in_target

The build host might not necessarily have a complete set of dirs
required in its PATH. It will likely be better to statically code a
complete(ish) set of PATH entries inside the function.

Some distros (ex: archlinux) are lacking some dirs commonly found in a
PATH. If this is used as a host OS, it will transfer this incomplete
PATH into the chroot, where other guests (ubuntu, centos) will fail to
find basic binaries due to the lack of a /bin entry.

Change-Id: I084aff7e449f5de811a6169ec90e352ada7da439
'}]
commit_message:
Append full path to img-functions:run_in_target

The build host might not necessarily have a complete set of dirs
required in its PATH. It will likely be better to statically code a
complete(ish) set of PATH entries inside the function.

Some distros (ex: archlinux) are lacking some dirs commonly found in a
PATH. If this is used as a host OS, it will transfer this incomplete
PATH into the chroot, where other guests (ubuntu, centos) will fail to
find basic binaries due to the lack of a /bin entry.

Change-Id: I084aff7e449f5de811a6169ec90e352ada7da439

Why are you invalidating the cache twice, once before checking the user, and also after that? Shouldn't we assume that if we properly invalidate cache with add/delete requests, cache should be up to date?"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2015-04-21 20:28:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-21 20:29:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Verified

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-21 20:36:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-2

This change depends on a change that failed to merge.'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2015-04-21 21:45:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The reason for invalidating before is to avoid change regression. Caches won't always be for a single user. If there are two users of the library and one of them has changed the cache, and we have our old version cached, then we might accidentally resurrect the old version upon write. This is still, of course, racey, as we could still do that with our new version of the cache, but we want that window to be as narrow as possible."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2015-04-22 16:35:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2015-04-22 16:50:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Test that deleting user invalidates user cache

In writing tests for this, a bug was found that there was no UserDelete
task, and the old internal API no longer functions. So that bit of code
was refactored to have a better chance at working in the real world.

Change-Id: I06fad3133bb0c5f9bd23318e32eb1c538cc27c24

commit_message:
Fix handling of pci_requests in consume_from_instance.

Properly retrieve requests from pci_requests in consume_from_instance.
Without this the call to numa_fit_instance_to_host will fail because
it expects the request list.
And change the order in which apply_requests and numa_fit_instance_to_host
are called. Calling apply_requests first will remove devices from pools
and  may make numa_fit_instance_to_host fail.

Change-Id: I41cf4e8e5c1dea5f91e5261a8f5e88f46c7994ef
Closes-bug: #1444021
(cherry picked from commit 0913e799e9ce3138235f5ea6f80159f468ad2aaa)

commit_message:
Use list of requests in InstancePCIRequests.obj_from_db.

InstancePCIRequests.obj_from_db assumes it's called with with a dict
of values from instances_extra table, but in some cases it's called
with just the value of pci_requests column.
This changes obj_from_db to be used with just the value of pci_requests column.

Change-Id: I7bed733c845c365081719a70b8a2f0cc9a58370c
Closes-bug: #1445040
(cherry picked from commit a074d7b4465b45730a5171e024c5c39a66a9c927)

[{'created': '2015-04-21 09:50:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add numa_node field to PciDevicePool

Without this field, PciDevicePool.from_dict will treat numa_node key in
the dict as a tag, which in turn means that the scheduler client will
drop it when converting stats to objects before reporting.

Converting it back to dicts on the scheduler side thus will not have
access to the numa_node information which would cause any requests that
will look for the exact match between the device and instance NUMA nodes
in the NUMATopologyFilter to fail.

Closes-Bug: #1441169
(cherry picked from commit 7db1ebc66c59205f78829d1e9cd10dcc1201d798)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py

Change-Id: I7381f909620e8e787178c0be9a362f8d3eb9ff7d
'}]
commit_message:
Add numa_node field to PciDevicePool

Without this field, PciDevicePool.from_dict will treat numa_node key in
the dict as a tag, which in turn means that the scheduler client will
drop it when converting stats to objects before reporting.

Converting it back to dicts on the scheduler side thus will not have
access to the numa_node information which would cause any requests that
will look for the exact match between the device and instance NUMA nodes
in the NUMATopologyFilter to fail.

Closes-Bug: #1441169
(cherry picked from commit 7db1ebc66c59205f78829d1e9cd10dcc1201d798)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py

Change-Id: I7381f909620e8e787178c0be9a362f8d3eb9ff7d

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 12:25:35.000000000', 'message': 'Improve coverage job

* Make decision based on missing lines not difference
  between percentage of coverage.

* Fix issue in case when stash has elements but
  there is no changes to stash. We pop stash only
  if coverage job created it

* Changes in UX:

  * Show diff of coverage reports if proposed patch
    coverage is less than in master

  * Better UI messages

Change-Id: I61bb5fff812628a163025eef0a6e2ed29cdd4353

commit_message:
Improve coverage job

* Make decision based on missing lines not difference
  between percentage of coverage.

* Fix issue in case when stash has elements but
  there is no changes to stash. We pop stash only
  if coverage job created it

* Changes in UX:

  * Show diff of coverage reports if proposed patch
    coverage is less than in master

  * Better UI messages

Change-Id: I61bb5fff812628a163025eef0a6e2ed29cdd4353

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 09:40:14.000000000', 'message': "scheduler: re-calculate NUMA on consume_from_instance

This patch narrows down the race window between the filter running and
the consumption of resources from the instance after the host has been
chosen.

It does so by re-calculating the fitted NUMA topology just before consuming it
from the chosen host. Thus we avoid any locking, but also make sure that
the host_state is kept as up to date as possible for concurrent
requests, as there is no opportunity for switching threads inside a
consume_from_instance.

Several things worth noting:
  * Scheduler being lock free (and thus racy) does not really affect
  resources other than PCI and NUMA topology this badly - this is due
  to complexity of said resources. In order for scheduler decesions to not
  be based on basically guessing, in case of those two we will likely need
  to introduce either locking or special heuristics.

  * There is a lot of repeated code between the 'consume_from_instance'
  method and the actual filters. This situation should really be fixed but
  is out of scope for this bug fix (which is about preventing valid
  requests failing because of races in the scheduler).

Change-Id: If0c7ad20506c9dddf4dec1eb64c9d6dd4fb75633
Closes-bug: #1438238

commit_message:
scheduler: re-calculate NUMA on consume_from_instance

This patch narrows down the race window between the filter running and
the consumption of resources from the instance after the host has been
chosen.

It does so by re-calculating the fitted NUMA topology just before consuming it
from the chosen host. Thus we avoid any locking, but also make sure that
the host_state is kept as up to date as possible for concurrent
requests, as there is no opportunity for switching threads inside a
consume_from_instance.

Several things worth noting:
  * Scheduler being lock free (and thus racy) does not really affect
  resources other than PCI and NUMA topology this badly - this is due
  to complexity of said resources. In order for scheduler decesions to not
  be based on basically guessing, in case of those two we will likely need
  to introduce either locking or special heuristics.

  * There is a lot of repeated code between the 'consume_from_instance'
  method and the actual filters. This situation should really be fixed but
  is out of scope for this bug fix (which is about preventing valid
  requests failing because of races in the scheduler).

Change-Id: If0c7ad20506c9dddf4dec1eb64c9d6dd4fb75633
Closes-bug: #1438238
(cherry picked from commit d6b3156a6c89ddff9b149452df34c4b32c50b6c3)

(1 comment)

A real initial review (didn't even get a chance to look at all the code). I think some cores like to see context (why is this patch needed), but I think it's a good initiative (thanks for the work).

Also, can you move the code in helpers.py (specifically Pinger and FakeVM) from the nuetron.tests.functional library to the neutron.tests.common library? It's a new lib which is supposed to hold all the common code between the various types of testing in Neutron (unit, functional, up-coming full-stack, up-coming api...), and this patch (the ability to simulate a VM via namespaces and ports without Nova) is definitely something we'll want in full-stack for simulating instances, meaning it should be common to both functional and full-stack :)

The lib is more-or-less empty but I'm working on patches to move stuff there..."}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2014-12-23 11:15:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Cool. Some minor comments.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2014-12-23 13:56:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

The scope of this patch is clear. However some words on the general direction of this kind of changes might be welcome.

For instance, are you aiming at doing scale tests by creating thousands of ports simulating vms? Or is your intention to have them just to validate connectivity?

I'm also not sure why you create a distinct namespace for each "fake vm"'}, {'account_id': 8124, 'date': '2014-12-23 16:16:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(7 comments)

FakeVM is an helper for simulating a VM in order to test network-based features (metadata service current, routing/natting tomorrow) which implies a specific namespace.

More generally FakeVM is an helper in network functional tests for simulating different types of machines:
* a VM (metadata proxy test)
* a server (iptables/ipset tests)
* an external machine (routing/natting tests to define)

So perhaps FakeVM is not the right name for the class.

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 12444, 'date': '2014-12-23 16:31:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

InstanceSimulator? MachineSimulator?

I'm fine with FakeVM btw..."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-12-23 17:56:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

(1 comment)

As Cedric and I discussed in IRC earlier today, 'create_namespace', 'bind_namespace_to_cidr' and 'set_namespace_gateway' should be split off from BaseLinuxTestCase and into their own helpers (perhaps a mixin?). This will increase usability for both functional and full-stack tests and will hopefully resolve issues where currently FakeMachine depends on 'isinstance(testcase, BaseLinuxTestCase) == True'.

BTW, I still think 'FakeVM' or simply 'VM' looks better :)"}, {'account_id': 8124, 'date': '2015-01-12 16:53:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12444, 'date': '2015-01-12 16:57:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2015-01-12 21:04:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

My apologies for taking so long to get to this.  I think I had anticipated it being a different beast entirely.

As a refactor that makes reasoning about connectivity more straightforward in testing, I think this is great work.  I'm not so fussy about the naming for now, but I would hope that future work would add more 'VM-like' capabilities including simulation of the vif-plugging operations that Nova performs and we can have a true 'FakeVM' capability.

On a side note: no more mixins, please.  It's been a good crutch to get us going, but as we get deeper into infrastructure around testing we'll be better served by the looser coupling that composition allows."}, {'account_id': 12444, 'date': '2015-01-13 05:39:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I think it's fine that FakeMachine instances are not fixtures themselves.  It would be better to separate the concept of a FakeMachine from its management - think FakeMachine and FakeMachineFixture as separate classes.  When we get around to enabling retargetable scenario testing in-tree, we're going to need to be able to manage FakeMachine instances via a fake nova client, so the less coupling the better."}, {'account_id': 8124, 'date': '2015-03-05 09:38:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-05 10:06:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Verified-1

@maru: fixtures support at least 3 modes:

* useFixture: 

 my_fixture = self.useFixture(MyFixture())

* context:

 with MyFixture() as my_fixture:
   ...

* setUp/cleanUp:

 my_fixture = MyFixture().setUp()
 try:
   ...
 finally:
   my_fixture.cleanUp()

useFixture mode ensures cleanup is done after the test where context setUp/cleanup modes allows to delete the fixture during the test.

Does it match with retargeable scenario test needs?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-05 11:09:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Verified-1

By the way, this makes me wonder - what happens if I specify "amount=10", but it fails on the 7th (for example, because the IP is taken)? Currently I don't see any special code to handle this situation. Should it roll back the first 6 machines which were assigned (and probably had namespaces and ports created)? Should it return the already-created machines to the consumer (via exception data) so that he may choose what to do in this case? I think we should think what we want to do here since using a 'transaction-like' approach will add way too much overhead here.

Also, how do I go about *manually* deleting a FakeMachine? Say I want my test to create a FakeMachine, check connectivity to that machine, then remove that FakeMachine and make sure that the IP is no longer reachable.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-23 14:44:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Verified+1

useFixture saves us! It ensures fixture.cleanUp is added to test cleanups if fixture.setUp() succeed. So all created fake machines will be cleaned if PeerMachines.setUp fails for whatever reason. 


To delete manually a fake machine:

  with FakeMachine():
    ...

or:

  fake_machine = FakeMachine()
  fake_machine.setUp()
  try:
    ...
  finally:
    fake_machine.cleanUp()'}, {'account_id': 8124, 'date': '2015-03-23 16:27:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Patch Set 26 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 8124, 'date': '2015-03-23 16:31:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

- check-neutron-dsvm-functional http://logs.openstack.org/12/143412/38/check/check-neutron-dsvm-functional/49acba9/ : SUCCESS in 5m 44s'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2015-04-20 21:47:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 38: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2015-04-20 22:54:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 38: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Although I welcome the effort on relying on fixtures more and more, I sense that the lack of a consistent branch topic or devref docs may not work in your favor in getting these patches accepted. Furthermore, without evangelizing why and how you're doing what you're doing, other people's work can get in ahead of yours, pushing you further workload to increase further and you'll end up chasing a moving target.

I strongly encourage you to start documenting, with or without the help of other testing focused folks, the rationale of this work and what we all need to adhere to in terms of testing guidelines and good practices. This will not only benefit you, but everybody involved in this project.

As a gesture of goodwill I am happy to see this merged, but I am hoping you will follow up with some doc patches."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-20 22:54:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 38: -Verified

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-22 09:55:46.000000000', 'message': 'Define FakeVM helper for functional tests

The change defines the FakeVM helper class which emulates a VM through a
namespace by:
* creating a namespace,
* creating a port in the namespace bound to an OVS bridge,
* setting an ip on the port,
* setting a gateway to the namespace (if requested).

The change defines also create_peer_vms method providing an environment
for testing network features through 2 FakeVMs on the same bridge/cidr.
It allows to remove BaseIPVethTestCase class.

Change-Id: I4fde1a03badd9adfd14b9124b5602331b69dda9d
'}, {'created': '2015-01-05 22:38:56.000000000', 'message': 'Define FakeMachine helper for functional tests

The change defines the FakeMachine helper class which emulates a
machine through a namespace with:
* a port bound to an OVS bridge,
* an ip on the port,
* a gateway (if requested).

The FakeMachine class can be used to emulate:
* a VM for testing network features (ex: metadata service),
* an external machine for testing "external" network features (ex:
  routing/natting),
* a server for low level tests of network features (ex: iptables).

The change defines also create_peer_vms method providing an environment
for testing network features through 2 FakeMachines on the same bridge/cidr
which allows to remove BaseIPVethTestCase class.

Change-Id: I4fde1a03badd9adfd14b9124b5602331b69dda9d

'}, {'created': '2015-01-29 21:00:57.000000000', 'message': 'Define FakeMachine helper for functional tests

The change defines the FakeMachine helper class which emulates a
machine through a namespace with:
* a port bound to an OVS bridge,
* an ip on the port,
* a gateway (if requested).

The FakeMachine class can be used to emulate:
* a VM for testing network features (ex: metadata service),
* an external machine for testing "external" network features (ex:
  routing/natting),
* a server for low level tests of network features (ex: iptables).

FakeMachine constructor requires a testcase which is an instance of
BaseOVSLinuxTestCase or implementing BaseOVSLinuxTestCase methods.
Follow-up changes will transform BaseOVSLinuxTestCase methods into
helpers in order to remove such constraint.

Change-Id: I4fde1a03badd9adfd14b9124b5602331b69dda9d

commit_message:
Define FakeMachine helper for functional/fullstack tests

The change defines the FakeMachine fixture/helper which emulates a
machine through a namespace with:
* a port bound to a bridge,
* an ip on the port,
* a gateway (if requested).

The FakeMachine class can be used to emulate:
* a VM for testing network features (ex: metadata service),
* an external machine for testing "external" network features (ex:
  routing/natting),
* a server for low level tests of network features (ex: iptables).

The change also defines PeerMachines fixture/helper to create some fake
machines bound to a bridge.

Change-Id: I4fde1a03badd9adfd14b9124b5602331b69dda9d

commit_message:
Release Import of Translations from Transifex

Manual import of Translations from Transifex. This change also removes
all po files that are less than 66 per cent translated since such
partially translated files will not help users.

This updates also recreates all pot (translation source files) to
reflect the state of the repository.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle the proposed branches and we need to sync with latest
translations.

Note: This is part of importing of translations, there are no new
translations for this project, thus only the pot file gets updated.

Change-Id: I0cbfdae3bd1662da54c58e91a13f49419eba9b2d

commit_message:
Use reconstruct insetad of decode/encode

With bumping PyECLib up to 1.0.7 on global requirements,
we can use the "reconstruct" function directly instead
of the current hack doing decode/encode on reconstructor.
That is because the hack was for treating PyECLib < 1.0.7
(strictly jearsure scheme) reconstruction bug so we don't
have to do decode/encode anymore.

Closes-Bug: 1446801
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I69aae495670e3d0bdebe665f73915547a4d56f99

(3 comments)

Not really a fan of this approach, Gary, sorry :(

a) We're after feature freeze and this is adding a feature

b) I don't think flavor extra specs are the right place for this (I think aggregate extra specs are more appropriate (see comment in commit message)

c) I think this leaks the VMWare internals way too much into the public interfaces.

Echoing Jay's previous comment:

> I might add that network latency is dependent on the underlying compute nodes and network connectivity. It seems very awkward to create a flavor type that has extra_specs that are predicting the underlying compute node latency. Flavors are supposed to be an abstraction over the instance resources, not the compute node resources.
> 
> Perhaps this is better left as an *aggregate extra spec*, not a flavor extra spec?

The current patch does not seem to address this comment, as the console delay is set per flavor rather than by aggregate. I agree, though, that aggregates seem more appropriate than flavors for this information."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2015-04-07 17:08:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

@Joel, I am not sure how setting this as an aggregate will help. When I am back from vacation I can explore that option. revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-10 13:08:10.000000000', 'message': 'VMware: enable configuring of addition information for virtual machine

This describes a set of modifications to the additional options. If the key
is already present, it will be reset with the new value provided. Otherwise,
a new option is added. Keys with empty values will be removed.

A use case for this is when running OpenStack in an environment where there
is network latency the administrator will be unable to use the instance
console. The solution to this is to set a extra config key
'keyboard.typematicMinDelay' with value 2000000.

DocImpact:
The extra configuration values will be passed as part of the flavor
extra_specs. This will be with a key 'vmware:extra_config'.

An example of this will be:
nova flavor-key eli set \
  vmware:extra_config='{"keyboard.typematicMinDelay":2000000}'

Change-Id: I1b4e89d8b4a236e5f1e328be3d8ee54eceb37e2a

commit_message:
VMware: enable configuring of console delay

When running OpenStack in an environment where there
is network latency the administrator will be unable to use the instance
console. Please see http://goo.gl/gKTqYZ for explanations.

DocImpact:
A new configuration variable in the vmware section will be added. This
is 'console_delay_seconds'. If set the instance created will have the
keyboard.typematicMinDelay set to this value.

Closes-bug: #1443082

Change-Id: I1b4e89d8b4a236e5f1e328be3d8ee54eceb37e2a

commit_message:
Update unregister_machine to use tasks

Updated the unregister_machine to utilize tasks for the main
actions taken by the module.

Additionally, added a docstring to the method and a basic unit.

Change-Id: I738d8573b0c5f7ae693a73326ffa517d401a8c53

Updated register_machine to utilize tasks instead of direct calls to
the ironicclient library which resulted in additional tasks beyond
the initial MachineCreate task. Added MachinePortCreate along with
MachinePortDelete and MachineDelete as the register_machine includes
rollback functionality if port creation fails.

Additionally, as part of this, the failure handling logic has been
cleaned up in order to help ensure that all ports and nodes are
completely deleted.

commit_message:
Update register_machine to use tasks

Updated register_machine to utilize tasks instead of direct calls to
the ironicclient library which resulted in additional tasks beyond
the initial MachineCreate task. Added MachinePortCreate along with
MachinePortDelete and MachineDelete as the register_machine includes
rollback functionality if port creation fails.

Additionally, as part of this, the failure handling logic has been
cleaned up in order to help ensure that all ports and nodes are
completely deleted.

Basic tests added to validate methods execute as expected.

Change-Id: Ide208ce5445bbc50c0a9bd6476bf7fe306658831

commit_message:
Add test of OperatorCloud auth_type=None

Ironic features a noauth mode which is intended for use in isolated
trusted environments.  As this is not a normal use case for shade,
it is an increadibly important item to have a test for.

Change-Id: If86b9df238982d912105fb08dcd59c9c85b7de4a

commit_message:
Update volume API for new getters and dict retval

This switches the volume API to use the new get/list/search style.
Doing this necessitated that we fix another issue with the volume
API and NOT return the volume object as received from cinder, but
rather convert it to a dict using meta.obj_to_dict.

Change-Id: I81ba97d2b4fc9465e1b3538e97f5ceb9bef4f7e8

commit_message:
Use new getters in update_subnet and update_router

Take advantage of the new style of object getters that will raise
an exception on duplicates for us.

Change-Id: I89799eeebef60adf92ffbe16b16cf6a798ecac83

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Sets *DataRoot paths for instances

Sets the path for the instance's ConfigurationDataRoot,
LogDataRoot, SnapshotDataRoot, SuspendDataRoot and
SwapFileDataRoot for vmutilsv2 instances and
ExternalDataRoot and SnapshotDataRoot for vmutils
to the instance's location.

Closes-Bug: #1430239

Change-Id: I3c9e2dece00df06cafdcd164ece6269337feda71

commit_message:
Remove saml2 comment in scoping federated token

Removes the comment stating that "saml2" is required in the
request to scope an unscoped token.

Change-Id: I5b4c0bb13e4425273f8348d7d070d8c618fd0c21

subject: Remove client cookbook from array
messages:
[{'account_id': 14790, 'date': '2015-04-22 14:41:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15068, 'date': '2015-04-22 14:44:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm still generally -1 on lumping all cookbooks together. When testing cookbooks locally using berkshelf I have to break out each cookbook individually."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-22 14:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

- gate-openstack-chef-repo http://logs.openstack.org/36/176336/1/check/gate-openstack-chef-repo/6bfc5bc/ : FAILURE in 2m 40s'}, {'account_id': 7128, 'date': '2015-04-22 15:08:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, I tend to agree with Chris on this one, maybe there's a more flexable way to do this.  For my dev setups, I usually end up with a Berks that looks like this:

cookbook 'openstack-bare-metal', path: './cookbook-openstack-bare-metal'
cookbook 'openstack-block-storage', path: './cookbook-openstack-block-storage'
cookbook 'openstack-common', path: './cookbook-openstack-common'
cookbook 'openstack-compute', path: './cookbook-openstack-compute'
cookbook 'openstack-dashboard', path: './cookbook-openstack-dashboard'
cookbook 'openstack-identity', path: './cookbook-openstack-identity'
cookbook 'openstack-image', path: './cookbook-openstack-image'
cookbook 'openstack-network', path: './cookbook-openstack-network'
cookbook 'openstack-ops-database', path: './cookbook-openstack-ops-database'
cookbook 'openstack-ops-messaging', path: './cookbook-openstack-ops-messaging'

so, maybe having an option/switch/flag to allow a simple way to go after default master branch, or local file copies.   Then we could also add in a script to make it easy to clone the local copies first in the dev case."}, {'account_id': 7128, 'date': '2015-04-22 15:09:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Better example

cookbook 'openstack-bare-metal', path: './cookbook-openstack-bare-metal'

cookbook 'openstack-block-storage', path: './cookbook-openstack-block-storage'

cookbook 'openstack-common', path: './cookbook-openstack-common'"}, {'account_id': 14790, 'date': '2015-04-22 18:00:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I think I see a better way to do this. For now, this is obsoleted by https://review.openstack.org/176366/'}]

Remove client cookbook from array

commit_message:
Bump PyECLib version from 1.0.3 to 1.0.7

In addition to fixing several bugs, 1.0.7 eliminates the need for a
few work-around code in Swift.  This code was only to hide issues in
the current version, but it also ends up breaking some third-party
integration.  In order to enable expected functionality and to avoid
dealing with deprecation issues right from the beginning, we need to
bump the minium PyECLib requirement to 1.0.7.

Closes-Bug: 1446727
Change-Id: I03e059e7335656c22be28ffd6157b56e13bdfc1b

commit_message:
compute: don't trace on InstanceNotFound in reverts_task_state

Commit c43f2b0d708f0f4b37850d2917c0abcc13b8789b added logging when
_instance_update fails in reverts_task_state but we shouldn't log
InstanceNotFound since it's a normal (expected) error when we're
deleting an instance shortly after it fails to build.

Closes-Bug: #1431404

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to the test modules being
moved in Kilo and the need to import nova.compute.manager.

Change-Id: Iec3dfaa16b472bc88d56d9c6680a7c247f2f50bd
(cherry picked from commit 95976ca1aff63c01ed119c9a3c39927f39ce1fbf)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-15 19:53:02.000000000', 'message': 'Restore Brocade Vyatta firewall functionality

Code changes related to the patch set
I467bb680666ec9bc82e55cfe534d74db29009cce removed the process_router()
method that was being used by the Vyatta Firewall agent code to
update/apply firewall to the Vyatta VRouter when an end user executed
the "Set Gateway" or "Add/Remove interfaces" method on a router.

The current patch set restores the functionality by leveraging
functionality provided by neutron.callbacks.

Change-Id: If3ad35ff08d69b6567350354bc7f4bf7fc71f263
Closes-Bug: #1442043
(cherry picked from commit 650e68b4f7a43b9a54f7bffac4d6055d6951163e)
'}]
commit_message:
Restore Brocade Vyatta firewall functionality

Code changes related to the patch set
I467bb680666ec9bc82e55cfe534d74db29009cce removed the process_router()
method that was being used by the Vyatta Firewall agent code to
update/apply firewall to the Vyatta VRouter when an end user executed
the "Set Gateway" or "Add/Remove interfaces" method on a router.

The current patch set restores the functionality by leveraging
functionality provided by neutron.callbacks.

Change-Id: If3ad35ff08d69b6567350354bc7f4bf7fc71f263
Closes-Bug: #1442043
(cherry picked from commit 650e68b4f7a43b9a54f7bffac4d6055d6951163e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-20 20:52:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix kwargs['migration'] KeyError in @errors_out_migration decorator

@errors_out_migration decorator is used in the compute manager on
resize_instance and finish_resize methods of ComputeManager class.
It is decorated via @utils.expects_func_args('migration') to check
'migration' is a parameter to the decorator method, however, that
only ensures there is a migration argument, not that it's in args or
kwargs (either is fine for what expects_func_args checks).
The errors_out_migration decorator can get a KeyError when checking
kwargs['migration'] and fails to set the migration status to 'error'.

This fixes the KeyError in the decorator by normalizing the args/kwargs
list into a single dict that we can pull the migration from.

Change-Id: I774ac9b749b21085f4fbcafa4965a78d68eec9c7
Closes-Bug: 1444300
(cherry picked from commit 3add7923fc16c050d4cfaef98a87886c6b6a589c)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix kwargs['migration'] KeyError in @errors_out_migration decorator

@errors_out_migration decorator is used in the compute manager on
resize_instance and finish_resize methods of ComputeManager class.
It is decorated via @utils.expects_func_args('migration') to check
'migration' is a parameter to the decorator method, however, that
only ensures there is a migration argument, not that it's in args or
kwargs (either is fine for what expects_func_args checks).
The errors_out_migration decorator can get a KeyError when checking
kwargs['migration'] and fails to set the migration status to 'error'.

This fixes the KeyError in the decorator by normalizing the args/kwargs
list into a single dict that we can pull the migration from.

Change-Id: I774ac9b749b21085f4fbcafa4965a78d68eec9c7
Closes-Bug: 1444300
(cherry picked from commit 3add7923fc16c050d4cfaef98a87886c6b6a589c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-04 09:57:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fixing some issue in logging

The method "assert_ostf_run_certain" in fuel_web_client.py
takes a list of tests that must have succes as one of parameters.
If the list has more than 1 item, method "assert_ostf_run_certain"
will not work correctly. For example, if we have three tests in the list,
only the last item of this list will always be passed into function for
logging.

Change-Id: I9887dee114c972c4b69823d794a491728f112ebc
'}, {'created': '2015-03-16 20:57:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fixing some issue in logging

commit_message:
Fixing issue with logging in method "assert_ostf_run_certain"

The method "assert_ostf_run_certain" takes a list of tests, that
must have success, as one of the parameters. If the list has more
than 1 item, logging in the method "assert_ostf_run_certain" will
work incorrectly. For example, if we have three tests in the list,
only the last item of this list will always be passed into function
for logging.

Closes-Bug: #1433184

Change-Id: I9887dee114c972c4b69823d794a491728f112ebc

commit_message:
Refactor environment variable aquisition class

In order to reuse the class code for another Openstack service
client initiation we have to put the code in a common file such
as utils.py

Change-Id: I03e2329170875d11e7cd47b487f0d7a8f688a99e
Implements: blueprint cinder-backup

commit_message:
Allow non-ssl to work correctly

when use_ssl is false, several ssl related items are still
in play, notably including mod_ssl.

Closes-Bug: #1445047

Change-Id: Iafd26f8eddfd74a90b6a8bde579bf53af57b5893

[{'created': '2015-04-15 22:08:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix heartbeat when clean step in progress

The agent returns command_result of None when a command is in progress.
The code assumed it would return an empty dict. Fix the access of
command_result to never return None, and fix the tests to reflect
reality.

Closes-Bug: #1444715
Change-Id: Iae6cd90517cb7b268ce2c089c92f64b09a606a42
(cherry picked from commit 2e2fb8c4997b1cac7dc18e67e43a0d8ba65a79d5)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix heartbeat when clean step in progress

The agent returns command_result of None when a command is in progress.
The code assumed it would return an empty dict. Fix the access of
command_result to never return None, and fix the tests to reflect
reality.

Closes-Bug: #1444715
Change-Id: Iae6cd90517cb7b268ce2c089c92f64b09a606a42
(cherry picked from commit 2e2fb8c4997b1cac7dc18e67e43a0d8ba65a79d5)

[{'created': '2015-04-21 16:31:16.000000000', 'message': 'Remove scripts for migrating nova baremetal

In juno, ironic provided support for migrating from nova's
"baremetal" driver to its "ironic" driver. These scripts
were used for that.

The baremetal driver was removed from nova in kilo. Ironic
doesn't support migrating from pre-kilo nova's baremetal
driver to post-juno nova's ironic driver.

Hence, deleting these migration scripts.

Closes-Bug: #1446330
Change-Id: Ic4990caa83a2eca3ee9fbd105bfe0a12bdaa7efe
(cherry picked from commit 76ab94fcbdddd43278175b8e8421fad0fb72c0cc)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove scripts for migrating nova baremetal

In juno, ironic provided support for migrating from nova's
"baremetal" driver to its "ironic" driver. These scripts
were used for that.

The baremetal driver was removed from nova in kilo. Ironic
doesn't support migrating from pre-kilo nova's baremetal
driver to post-juno nova's ironic driver.

Hence, deleting these migration scripts.

Closes-Bug: #1446330
Change-Id: Ic4990caa83a2eca3ee9fbd105bfe0a12bdaa7efe
(cherry picked from commit 76ab94fcbdddd43278175b8e8421fad0fb72c0cc)

commit_message:
Integration test with vCenter Glance, vlan manager and cinder.

Scenario
1. Create cluster with vCenter support
2. Add 3 nodes with controller role
3. Add a node with Cinder role
4. Set Nova-Network VlanManager as a network backend
5. Deploy the cluster
6. Run network verification
7. Run OSTF

Change-Id: Icdb3d7508aec7f92cf9dedd60f0505a17015d168
Closes-bug: #1444473

commit_message:
Functional tests: minus tempest, plus noauth support

* Functional tests no longer need tempest installed
* Functional tests can run against a Keystone-less environment

Change-Id: I2c2603b7207bfa09bb96ad180b959e4164096858

commit_message:
Update the deprecated group/name to Kilo release

For Kilo release, there are many deprecated group/name in conf files of openstack,
so we need to change the deprecated group/name to new group/name.

blueprint conf-section-update-for-kilo
Closes-bug: #1436170

Change-Id: Ibdd35e55ab79bc684782182d3e4341e672f04401

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-22 13:21:35.000000000', 'message': "Limit parameter is no longer ignored for packages

A 'packages.filter()' method was ignoring the 'limit' kwarg parameter by
overriding it with the value of 'page_size' parameter of the
DEFAULT_PAGE_SIZE constant if the 'page_size' was not set.

'page_size' is used by the dashboard, limit - by the engine, and right
now both of them have the same assumed semantics.

This change makes the client accept both of them (with priority for
'page_size'). This approach should be changed later, if we introduce
some client-side filtering: in this case 'limit' should define the
number of items requested by the client and the page_size should define
the number of items got from the API in each request. Right now this is
not the case, so these two parameters are quite interchangeable.

Change-Id: Ie4f4d1751bc5c12e46f230152a462c9b7a45ccd1
Partial-bug: #1445470
(cherry picked from commit 26436963c1126c9dec04af44481b2e8647e69bd7)
"}]
commit_message:
Limit parameter is no longer ignored for packages

A 'packages.filter()' method was ignoring the 'limit' kwarg parameter by
overriding it with the value of 'page_size' parameter of the
DEFAULT_PAGE_SIZE constant if the 'page_size' was not set.

'page_size' is used by the dashboard, limit - by the engine, and right
now both of them have the same assumed semantics.

This change makes the client accept both of them (with priority for
'page_size'). This approach should be changed later, if we introduce
some client-side filtering: in this case 'limit' should define the
number of items requested by the client and the page_size should define
the number of items got from the API in each request. Right now this is
not the case, so these two parameters are quite interchangeable.

Change-Id: Ie4f4d1751bc5c12e46f230152a462c9b7a45ccd1
Partial-bug: #1445470
(cherry picked from commit 26436963c1126c9dec04af44481b2e8647e69bd7)

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2015-04-20 19:55:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'll admit to just carrying forward the PowerVM semantic, out of ignorance of anything else.  So I checked some of the other drivers.

VMWare throws an exception if you issue reboot to a shut-down instance.
Xen and libvirt boot it.
I can't tell easily what ironic and hyperv do.

I asked the question on the openstack forum (https://ask.openstack.org/en/question/65461/expected-behavior-of-reboot-on-a-shut-down-instance/) but given the above, I'm not sure I'll get a reliable answer."}, {'account_id': 8662, 'date': '2015-04-21 13:09:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's sometimes helpful to look at the checks the API makes to determine the intended semantics.  Take a look at nova/compute/api.py at the reboot method.  There you'll see the vm_states and task_states that are checked and allowed before the request is allowed to progress."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2015-04-21 15:43:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

nova.compute.api.API.reboot will throw an exception if SOFT and not ACTIVE.  If HARD, it allows STOPPED, PAUSED, SUSPENDED, and ERROR as well.  I can follow that logic - but I'm still getting the feeling that you want me to try to second-guess possible discontinuity between the nova state and the PowerVM state."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2015-04-21 19:18:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-21 19:46:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Provide PowerVMDriver.reboot

This implementation heeds the reboot_type (HARD or SOFT) parameter.

commit_message:
Revert "Move rabbit/kombu settings to oslo_messaging_rabbit section"

This reverts commit 96eafbd792e2ceaa5ee972e85337fc1ff7d1f008.

Kilo deprecates these settings, but they still work. We should wait to
merge this until upstream distro packages are ready so that master is
not broken.

Change-Id: Ifa7782c6f2a9fc8a50e7724d6f5d7d2414c83690

commit_message:
Revert "Move rabbit/kombu settings to oslo_messaging_rabbit section"

This reverts commit e6e8f6a56231409028ff1e7cdcd44781ca37d5b0.

Kilo deprecates these settings, but they still work. We should wait to
merge this until upstream distro packages are ready so that master is
not broken.

Change-Id: Ib05943e89969eb810527943426c566cf4a77e7ad

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-15 18:41:33.000000000', 'message': 'VMware NSX: Fix DVR operations

The switch to the community management layer mixin introduced
several bugs in the NSX-mh plugins.
This patch:
1) Stops creating centralized SNAT interfaces for NSX distributed
   routers. The NSX backend does not need those and they therefore
   only waste IPs and create confusion. This is done by providing
   an empty implementation for the relevant methods.
2) Does not query l3-agents when removing router interface. This
   is causing errors during interface removal and preventing router
   removal, as the NSX plugin does not use l3 agents at all.
   This patch provides an empty implementation for the relevant
   method thus preventing the DVR mixin from doing any sort of
   operations pertaining l3 agents.
3) It ensures DVR router interfaces are taken into account in the
   management of metadata network for routers.

Applied for stackforge/vmware-nsx commit id:
e248f87867a74722df243598d6a6d707170ca5ce

Change-Id: I149307ff67e464e78ae393bb57c25bbee607ee4b
Closes-Bug: #1433550
Closes-Bug: #1433553
Closes-Bug: #1433554
'}]
commit_message:
VMware NSX: Fix DVR operations

The switch to the community management layer mixin introduced
several bugs in the NSX-mh plugins.
This patch:
1) Stops creating centralized SNAT interfaces for NSX distributed
   routers. The NSX backend does not need those and they therefore
   only waste IPs and create confusion. This is done by providing
   an empty implementation for the relevant methods.
2) Does not query l3-agents when removing router interface. This
   is causing errors during interface removal and preventing router
   removal, as the NSX plugin does not use l3 agents at all.
   This patch provides an empty implementation for the relevant
   method thus preventing the DVR mixin from doing any sort of
   operations pertaining l3 agents.
3) It ensures DVR router interfaces are taken into account in the
   management of metadata network for routers.

Applied for stackforge/vmware-nsx commit id:
e248f87867a74722df243598d6a6d707170ca5ce

Change-Id: I149307ff67e464e78ae393bb57c25bbee607ee4b
Closes-Bug: #1433550
Closes-Bug: #1433553
Closes-Bug: #1433554

commit_message:
Update package composing command

* Add forgotten default logo for heat template

[{'created': '2015-04-22 15:27:33.000000000', 'message': 'Allow a dev to specify puppet-modules override

Currently it is pretty cumbersome to specify the puppet module one wants
to test since they are put in the image during build.

The idea of this commit is to allow one to specify a list of module s/he
wants to override for a given run

A puppet-modules file ($TRIPLEO_ROOT/puppet-modules) is formatted as follow:

tripleo https://review.openstack.org/stackforge/puppet-tripleo master
refs/changes/58/175958/2
rabbitmq https://github.com/me/puppetlabs-rabbitmq mybranch

Both puppet-tripleo and puppet-rabbitmq will be overiden in the images
at /opt/stack/puppet-modules/ to apply the one that were specified in
this file.

Change-Id: I622fa354b1129f8152895e876eb488c6bbab1e6a
'}]
commit_message:
Allow a dev to specify puppet-modules override

Currently it is pretty cumbersome to specify the puppet module one wants
to test since they are put in the image during build.

The idea of this commit is to allow one to specify a list of module s/he
wants to override for a given run

A puppet-modules file ($TRIPLEO_ROOT/puppet-modules) is formatted as follow:

tripleo https://review.openstack.org/stackforge/puppet-tripleo master
refs/changes/58/175958/2
rabbitmq https://github.com/me/puppetlabs-rabbitmq mybranch

Both puppet-tripleo and puppet-rabbitmq will be overiden in the images
at /opt/stack/puppet-modules/ to apply the one that were specified in
this file.

Change-Id: I622fa354b1129f8152895e876eb488c6bbab1e6a

commit_message:
Reduce use of plan_definition['artifacts'][0]

Refactored app-create code to remove uses of
plan_definition['artifacts'][0].

Refactored some of the languagepack code
to use a common method.

When use_syslog is false, heat will use log_dir to store log files,
but default value of log_dir is none in heat, so heat will output
log to stdout.
This patch set the log_dir's default value to /var/log/heat/.

Closes-Bugs: #1446963
Change-Id: Ia53b557d56662994e095ccd1e2c3ca583460b55d
"}, {'created': '2015-04-22 06:18:31.000000000', 'message': "Set default value for log_dir in heat.conf

When use_syslog is false, heat will use log_dir to store log files,
but default value of log_dir is none in heat, so heat will output
log to stdout.
This patch set the log_dir's default value to /var/log/heat/.

Closes-Bug: #1446963
Change-Id: Ia53b557d56662994e095ccd1e2c3ca583460b55d
"}]
commit_message:
Set default value for log_dir in heat.conf

When use_syslog is false, heat will use log_dir to store log files,
but default value of log_dir is none in heat, so heat will output
log to stdout.
This patch set the log_dir's default value to /var/log/heat/.

Closes-Bug: #1446963
Change-Id: Ia53b557d56662994e095ccd1e2c3ca583460b55d

Sorry, I know I sounds like a dog with a bone here...but there is still something wrong with this picture. If we accept that a ValidationError is indeed the right thing to return to the client, why should the manager level have to understand the semantics of HTTP in terms of massaging error stati?  Surely it's the job of the controller to understand how we pack/unpack/set return codes etc.? It doesn't feel right to pollute the manager with this kind of knowledge."}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2015-04-09 20:08:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 29:

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-27 18:34:37.000000000', 'message': 'Add domain_id checking in create_project

It was possible to create a project with invalid domain_id,
this patch adds a check in the create_project() method in
order to verify if the domain_id is valid (there is a domain
with such id).

Co-Authored-By: Hugo Nicodemos <hugonicodemos@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I8f394f46ab915844228de00c5a9223c1e3fb6be1
Closes-Bug: 1426496

Closes-Bug: 1426496
'}, {'created': '2015-03-03 16:58:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add domain_id checking in create_project

It was possible to create a project with invalid domain_id if
we are using engines that do not support foreign keys (such
as sqlite). If the engine being used supports foreign keys
the returned error was a generic Internal Server Error.

This patch adds a check in the create_project() method in
order to verify if the domain_id is valid (there is a domain
with such id), returning DomainNotFound error if it is case.

Co-Authored-By: Hugo Nicodemos <hugonicodemos@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I8f394f46ab915844228de00c5a9223c1e3fb6be1
Closes-Bug: 1426496
'}, {'created': '2015-03-03 22:27:27.000000000', 'message': 'Add domain_id checking in create_project

commit_message:
Add domain_id checking in create_project

It was possible to create a project with invalid domain_id if
we are using engines that do not support foreign keys (such
as sqlite). If the engine being used supports foreign keys
the returned error was a generic Internal Server Error.

This patch adds a check in the create_project() method in
order to verify if the domain_id is valid (there is a domain
with such id), returning DomainNotFound error if it is case.

Co-Authored-By: Hugo Nicodemos <hugonicodemos@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Erickson Santos <erickson@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Change-Id: I8f394f46ab915844228de00c5a9223c1e3fb6be1
Closes-Bug: 1426496

commit_message:
Removed ml2_conf_odl.ini config file

The file is already packaged into decomposed networking-odl repo [1].

[1]: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/stackforge/networking-odl/tree/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf_odl.ini

Closes-Bug: #1442615
Change-Id: Ic280454190aab4e3b881cde15a882808b652861e
(cherry picked from commit b3334eca0ae9f9c64ccd646035e69081f669e3e4)

commit_message:
Revert "Add ipset element and hashsize tunables"

This reverts commit b5b919a7a3569ccb93c3d7d523c1edfaeddb7cb9.

The current ipset manager code isn't robust enough to handle
ipsets that already exist with different parameters. This reverts
the ability to change the parameters so we don't break upgrades
to Kilo.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/ipset_manager.py
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ipset_manager.py

Change-Id: I538714df52424f0502cb75daea310517d1142c42
Closes-Bug: #1444201
(cherry picked from commit 03be14a569d240865dabff8b4c30385abf1dbe62)

subject: Fix a wrong argument of create method

Fix a wrong argument of create method

Change the argument 'QoSSpecs.create' to 'qos_specs.create'.

Closes-Bug: #1443331
(cherry picked from commit a3c0a4104f95acff00d3a9721caa4da730619fb7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 14:41:05.000000000', 'message': 'Windows SMBFS: fix volume extend

The Windows SMBFS driver inherits the Linux SMBFS driver,
overriding Windows specific methods.

This commit Ic89cffc93940b7b119cfcde3362f304c9f2875df added the
volume name as an extra argument to the _do_extend_volume in order
to check if differencing images are pointing to backing files other
than the according volume disks.

Although this is not required on Windows, this method should accept
this extra argument in order to have the same signature as the
method it overrides. At the moment, this raises the following
exception:

TypeError: _do_extend_volume() takes exactly 3 arguments (4 given)

Closes-Bug: #1437290
(cherry picked from commit dca29e9ab3cdde210d3777e7c6b4a6849447058a)
Change-Id: I868d7de4a2c68f3fc520ba476a5660a84f440bb1
'}]
commit_message:
Windows SMBFS: fix volume extend

The Windows SMBFS driver inherits the Linux SMBFS driver,
overriding Windows specific methods.

This commit Ic89cffc93940b7b119cfcde3362f304c9f2875df added the
volume name as an extra argument to the _do_extend_volume in order
to check if differencing images are pointing to backing files other
than the according volume disks.

Although this is not required on Windows, this method should accept
this extra argument in order to have the same signature as the
method it overrides. At the moment, this raises the following
exception:

TypeError: _do_extend_volume() takes exactly 3 arguments (4 given)

Closes-Bug: #1437290
(cherry picked from commit dca29e9ab3cdde210d3777e7c6b4a6849447058a)
Change-Id: I868d7de4a2c68f3fc520ba476a5660a84f440bb1

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-15 19:49:49.000000000', 'message': 'Verify all quotas before updating the database

Update quota multi-value in one request is not an atomic operation, so
even if a quota is invalid (e.g., volumes has a non-integer value),
some values may change but the response code is 400.

This patch will make sure the quota limits are of integer type for all
the requested quota keys before updating the database.

Closes-Bug: 1432972
Change-Id: If83af0a80489887098e52b03b9c4012e3ef061b5
(cherry picked from commit 197299985a52535ad995dbd111491b58462f140a)
'}]
commit_message:
Verify all quotas before updating the database

Update quota multi-value in one request is not an atomic operation, so
even if a quota is invalid (e.g., volumes has a non-integer value),
some values may change but the response code is 400.

This patch will make sure the quota limits are of integer type for all
the requested quota keys before updating the database.

Closes-Bug: 1432972
Change-Id: If83af0a80489887098e52b03b9c4012e3ef061b5
(cherry picked from commit 197299985a52535ad995dbd111491b58462f140a)

[{'created': '2015-04-15 19:49:22.000000000', 'message': "Include boot properties from glance v2 images

In order for users to take advantage of COW volumes created from
a glance image, Cinder must be configured to use Glance API version
2 (default is 1). In version 2, the required boot metadata (kernel_id
and ramdisk_id) are no long stored in the 'properties' dict, but as
standalone fields in the GET response from glance. The existing cinder
parser for the glance request is not aware of this and the volume
created form a v2 image will lack this required metadata.

This was causing the recent Ceph CI gate failures for
test_volume_boot_pattern.

Change-Id: I688898b3841691369d73887f7eabdceb05155db1
Closes-Bug: #1439371
(cherry picked from commit ea109b5f24dca93fd6f660bc436a685d6101bcea)
"}]
commit_message:
Include boot properties from glance v2 images

In order for users to take advantage of COW volumes created from
a glance image, Cinder must be configured to use Glance API version
2 (default is 1). In version 2, the required boot metadata (kernel_id
and ramdisk_id) are no long stored in the 'properties' dict, but as
standalone fields in the GET response from glance. The existing cinder
parser for the glance request is not aware of this and the volume
created form a v2 image will lack this required metadata.

This was causing the recent Ceph CI gate failures for
test_volume_boot_pattern.

Change-Id: I688898b3841691369d73887f7eabdceb05155db1
Closes-Bug: #1439371
(cherry picked from commit ea109b5f24dca93fd6f660bc436a685d6101bcea)

commit_message:
Add locking to PureISCSIDriver around creating Purity Host objects.

This will prevent us from getting conflicting credentials for
connection methods which will result in iSCSI attach operations to fail.

Change-Id: Ia206e7b5ff330c8fccb49ed23a31b120a5c04eb3
Closes-Bug: 1444224
(cherry picked from commit a712afe42833443878898bb42851376cd8615ff9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 15:47:52.000000000', 'message': 'Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

Change-Id: I37e0acc5ed8e1af565359290fa622456901c735e
'}]
commit_message:
Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

Change-Id: I37e0acc5ed8e1af565359290fa622456901c735e

commit_message:
Document how to configure Neutron with iPXE

In order to use iPXE with neutron we need to create a tag in Neutron,
this patch document how to do it.

Change-Id: I313eb3600e864ff7a868154fe2d0aa6fb8cc69a2

commit_message:
remove deprecated partitioned alarm service

in Juno we deprecated the non-tooz based partitioned alarm service.
this patch removes this code so partitioning is handled solely by
tooz.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ie1f1f6593e058167fd1aa1587cfe19f2b867d5e1

- check-tempest-dsvm-python-ironicclient-src http://logs.openstack.org/34/175534/1/check/check-tempest-dsvm-python-ironicclient-src/1331224/ : SUCCESS in 36m 16s'}, {'account_id': 13997, 'date': '2015-04-21 03:54:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

John, LGTM, but some minor comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2015-04-21 09:05:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Hi John,

Thanks for the patch. I understand this have been discussed and that's why I won't -1 this patch. But, I feel that it's unnecessary to remove those lines. As you pointed out in the commit message we had a patch adding it before, now we have this one removing and maybe in the future we are going to have yet-another-patch adding it back. So I would just leave it as-is, it's harmless, those are not editors setups (shebang lines), editors yes look at it, but mostly important this is for the python interpreter[1]. Plus, py3 defaults to utf-8, having those lines makes also sure that we defaults to utf-8 on py2 interpreters, it's consistent since we support both versions.

[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0263/

My 0.2c"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2015-04-21 15:13:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Lucas. I'm somewhat ambivalent on this but jroll asked for it and there seemed to be agreement (no one opposed) in yesterday's Ironic meeting, not to do this. The rationale is that really, we *only* want this utf8 line for files that need it, but we're not going to add a hack or anything to prevent folks from adding it. However, we also don't want to encourage people to submit patches that just add it or remove it.

The reason for removing the unneeded ones from the client, is to make it more consistent with ironic. Otherwise, someone down the road may think that ironic needs it too. Also, copy/pasting the header of a client file to a new client file will propagate the use of the line, which we don't really want to do."}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2015-04-21 16:44:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-21 17:43:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Remove unneeded 'utf-8' coding lines

This is basically a revert of commit:
  af741ec2236619880fa902d68aef4a6ae6cef534

It was decided that only files that need to have the line:
  # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
Should have the line[1] as a general principle

This patch removes the 'utf-8' coding line from files that consist
entirely of ASCII characters.

[1]
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/ironic/2015/ironic.2015-04-20-17.00.html

Partial-bug: #1325193
Change-Id: I88c1c37f7b580aa805eae9d4a1e66d33302a325f

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-22 00:08:51.000000000', 'message': '[install-guide] Modify cinder content for Kilo

Modify cinder content for Kilo as follows:

1) Mostly revert commit 1e494c3e22a24baaafcaf777d4d467eb
   because cinder and services that use the cinder API such
   as nova expect the volume service rather than the
   volumev2 service.

2) Reference the v2 API in the endpoint for both the volume
   and volumev2 services.

3) Adjust the output of the commands to verify cinder operation.

4) Adjust the output of the commands to attach a volume to an
   instance.

5) Change tenant to project where applicable.

Change-Id: Ibac7ba7a931c889a9424ac944597b263aa16dc3b
Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo
'}]
commit_message:
[install-guide] Modify cinder content for Kilo

Modify cinder content for Kilo as follows:

1) Mostly revert commit 1e494c3e22a24baaafcaf777d4d467eb
   because cinder and services that use the cinder API such
   as nova expect the volume service rather than the
   volumev2 service.

2) Reference the v2 API in the endpoint for both the volume
   and volumev2 services.

3) Adjust the output of the commands to verify cinder operation.

4) Adjust the output of the commands to attach a volume to an
   instance.

5) Change tenant to project where applicable.

Change-Id: Ibac7ba7a931c889a9424ac944597b263aa16dc3b
Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo

commit_message:
Use SSL to access git.openstack.org

Replace all occurrence of http://git.openstack.org with
https://git.openstack.org.

Change-Id: I85b9011ae49c5a4ea8f272b1ee0d93c2c14e43c7

subject: Add keystone update_user_password scenario

Hi Anish, I just discovered that ironic configs will be in the manuals. AWESOME!

But I am puzzled as to how the input for configs is being generated. It seems like the key files are autogenerate-config-flagmappings/ironic.flagmappings and ironic.headers.

How did you determine the headers and config variables? Eg, I don't recall Ironic ever having a 'cells' section in the ironic configs.

Ironic keeps a sample ironic config file [1] in the repo, maybe that can be used? We try to make sure it is up-to-date.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2015-04-22 14:35:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ruby, have a look at the generated draft manual:
http://docs.openstack.org/draft/config-reference/content/ch_configuring-openstack-bare-metal.html

we've split up the large file in smaller chunks like we did for other projects.

The readme in the directory should explain usage"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2015-04-22 14:46:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Andreas. Oh, I just read the autogenerate_config_docs/README [1]. If I understand it, the autohelp-wrapper script is the one that generates the autogenerate-config-flagmappings/*.flagmappings files? If that's the case, either Ironic code is doing something unexpected, or the autohelp-wrapper code is assuming something that isn't correct, because the ironic-related .flagmappings files are "close" but not correct.


[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-doc-tools/plain/autogenerate_config_docs/README.rst'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2015-04-22 14:48:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ruby, flagmappings file are manually done. Let'S discuss better on irc or openstack-docs mailing list instead here."}]

commit_message:
MySQL: change default MySQL collate to utf8_general_ci

Install & configure MySQL database by using utf8_general_ci collation
which is the way documented in OpenStack [1] and already the default
in puppetlabs-mysql [2].

[1] http://goo.gl/GA5gyZ
[2] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/blob/master/manifests/db.pp#L7

Change-Id: I5b07cb4c76af31d0ab9bd552b7aa03f720641f6e
Closes-bug: #1446375

in puppetlabs-mysql [2].

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 14:58:55.000000000', 'message': 'Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

Change-Id: I11b17f90ad351f369f012eb954da9f63804b4eb5
'}]
commit_message:
Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

Change-Id: I11b17f90ad351f369f012eb954da9f63804b4eb5

commit_message:
[WIP] Import the Linuxbridge Legacy Scenario

This is the legacy linuxbridge scenario covered in Architecture 4b in
deployment scenarios in the new Networking Guide Table of Contents

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NetworkingGuide/TOC

Change-Id: I8dedcb671e129acf6082e2327baa394a2ada1545
Co-Authored-By: Matthew Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Implement advanced apt pinning

Current approach is an error prone, because Debian repos may contain
metadata that doesn't fit our pinning template. Yes, in some cases
our template will work (and it does with upstream Ubuntu and Fuel),
but we want to be flexible and cover all cases.

In order to set corrent pinning, we have to use repo's metadata and
that means download repo's Release file, parse it and create pinning
based on it. In that case we'll use all available pinning rules, so
all possible issues will be up to repo maintainer and not because
we're using error prone approach.

Related-Bug: #1435892
Related-Bug: #1438783
Closes-Bug:  #1446686

Change-Id: I5279b7f414f831503fd993109dd5c91bef51a9ef
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

commit_message:
Resource tracker: unable to restart nova compute

The resource tracker calculates its used resources. In certain cases
of failed migrations and an instance being deleted the resource tracker
causes an exception in nova compute. If this situation arises then nova
compute may not even be able to restart.

Change-Id: I4a154e0cae3b8e22bd59ed05ba708e07eed8dea7
Closes-bug: #1444439
(cherry picked from commit ee7a7446cc6947a6bacacb6cb514934cc22e5782)

This opens up liberty development by adjusting the branches for kilo,
will not pass until devstack is branched.
