I'm not approving this yet because I'm curious if anyone has any concerns about managing RAIDs with Ironic, even through vendor-passthrough."}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2014-08-07 23:26:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-2

(9 comments)

I have several significant objections to the current proposal, and this spec needs a lot more detail.

I'm particularly concerned that it's introducing a new periodic task that is wholly dependent on calling methods within vendor_passthru unique to a specific driver, thus violating the driver API contract. The conductor shouldn't contain code that is specific to a driver. And that internal driver data is going to be exposed to (and writable by) users.

I think this will take some iterations to get the design to support other drivers (eg, IPA) and a common set of interactions with Nova that I believe we want to enable (such as raid-aware scheduling). Given our current backlog of work for Juno3, I am going to block this spec until Kilo opens.

All concerns and timing aside, I do want to see HW RAID support in Ironic. I'd like to revisit this very early in Kilo.

Regards,
Devananda"}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2014-08-07 23:33:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2014-08-08 06:08:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: -Code-Review

agreed'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2014-10-03 17:49:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 8106, 'date': '2014-10-13 09:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

Specs for Kilo are open! If you intend on pursuing this spec for Kilo, move it to the specs/kilo/ directory, update it to fit the new template and verify tests pass then reviews can start.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2014-10-29 12:39:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2014-10-29 12:40:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
DRAC vendor passthru for RAID management

This spec adds support for a vendor passthru API for managing RAID
configuration for Dell Remote Access Controller.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I302123f8fb9f4fb9137ff974e6749c12dd6e7f18

(1 comment)

I've have real thoughts that this approach is an overkill to achieve simple goal to add instance_id in some log messages. It also make code more complicated. In few places I see following code:

with context.set_current_instance_id(instance.instance_id):
     some_function(instance, *args, **kwargs)

but inside some_function we have only one log message, and possibly only debug message. I looks very strange for me.

As an possible solution I have only following: keep in logs only cluster_id (job_ex_id). I think, that would be enough in most debugging and deployment cases. Also, event_log would for help to debug problems with instances. Also we can try to push instance_id to resource_uuid for event_wrapper.

So, as result, I would not put any +1 mark until of possible approach changing."}, {'account_id': 12038, 'date': '2015-02-12 10:09:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-02-16 15:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Verified-1

'}, {'created': '2015-03-13 10:28:47.000000000', 'message': 'Adding cluster, instance, job_execution ids to logs

Looking at some Sahara logs it is difficult to determine what
cluster/instance/job_execution to which they refer.

Adding additional information in Sahara log messages:
* logs associated with cluster creation/scaling/deletion now contain
  cluster id;
* logs associated with job execution/canceling/deletion now contain
  job execution id;
* logs associated with operations executed on specific instance now
  contain id of this instance.

implements bp: logs-improvement

Change-Id: Ic4b64fa44e5a9a8bddcceef87fe5c706e31048d9'}, {'created': '2015-03-16 09:26:09.000000000', 'message': 'Adding cluster, instance, job_execution ids to logs

commit_message:
Make driver validation asynchronous

Closes-Bug: #1314961

TODO:
 - request update when driver_info is changed
 - expose result in the REST API, as part of the complete node result
 - write tests

Change-Id: I2f9103db40847047879f7e8bd946aa38537b9b64

Ethan was probably led astray by my initial incorrect comment - in fact `six.text_type` *is* just `unicode` (*not* `str`) in Python 2, so it should be used in __unicode__() too. Although the good news is that __unicode__() is never called in Python 3, so it doesn't actually matter.

The bad news is that in Python 3 __str__() has to return a unicode string, not bytes, and encode('UTF8') returns a bytes object. In Python 3:

  >>> class Foo:
  ...   def __str__(self):
  ...     return 'foo'.encode('UTF8')
  ... 
  >>> str(Foo())
  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  TypeError: __str__ returned non-string (type bytes)

So just substituting `six.text_type` for `unicode` in __str__ is not sufficient to make this actually work in Python 3.'}, {'account_id': 13009, 'date': '2014-12-09 16:33:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-12-09 17:32:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

commit_message:
Convert unicode to six in heat/common

This patch converts unicode to six.text_type in
heat/common for python 3.x compatibility.

Change-Id: I6bc18c40e99c049b31784f26b68e304571ad54b8

commit_message:
fuel_upgrade: install rpm packages with fuel 6.1

We don't need to install bootstrap images, provisioning images and new
puppet manifests, because we have them packaged now. Since now, the
fuel_upgrade is supposed to install the "fuel-release" package, run
puppet and create new Docker containers.

Depends-On: I417f8e9495e7dc8b22fc33b3c88408b879abaec2
Implements: blueprint package-fuel-components

Change-Id: I379749673c67c459c7070d986094ec6236d7ca6e
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

commit_message:
Add fuel-release base package

Fuel base package contains only the yum repo config
and package dependencies for the other components
required on Fuel Master.

blueprint bp/package-fuel-components

Change-Id: I417f8e9495e7dc8b22fc33b3c88408b879abaec2

commit_message:
Extract lrz archive for fuel-docker-images

Install loadable docker images instead of
simply putting a compressed file in the
Docker images directory.

Closes-Bug: #1445401
blueprint package-fuel-components

Change-Id: Ic573c1547c857192ad4aa2e2d5037f7f1c9d2b06

I'm actually wondering -- why do you need web context in an async worker? You're using ActionLog in rpc receiver and there is no web context AFAIK?"}, {'account_id': 10959, 'date': '2015-04-17 09:58:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

@Przemyslaw, we use web context for passing identifier of user, who is performing operation. For proper ActionLog creation we should know who is actor of operation. So we have to pass this info into mule in the special way.

In RCP receiver we only update ActionLog status.'}, {'account_id': 10959, 'date': '2015-04-17 10:00:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-17 10:00:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

It's still invalid for me. Before async task is created we create supertask. In receiver I see you can get the ActionLog by passing the task uuid. Why can't you create ActionLog in the task manager right after you've created the supertask and then update it in the mule by getting ActionLog by supertask.id ? revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-16 14:35:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix for passing web request env to mule

When we perform async task processing in the mule, web request context
and environmet is lost. So action_log couldn't be constructed properly.
For passing required data into async functions, the web_ctx_env param
added into async functions signature.
Also workaround for passing env from webpy to mule process added.

Change-Id: I5f0f78073f514d9600cd53d5bf757f27b8bfabe6
Closes-Bug: #1442990

Actor_id is required for proper constructing of the action log.
Actor_id value is added into web context environment in the connection
monitoring middleware. When we perform async task processing in the mule,
web request context and environmet is lost. So action_log couldn't be
constructed properly.
Extraction of actor_id from action_log of parent task is added as fix.

Change-Id: I5f0f78073f514d9600cd53d5bf757f27b8bfabe6
Closes-Bug: #1442990
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for fetching actor_id for action log

Actor_id is required for proper constructing of the action log.
Actor_id value is added into web context environment in the connection
monitoring middleware. When we perform async task processing in the mule,
web request context and environmet is lost. So action_log couldn't be
constructed properly.
Extraction of actor_id from action_log of parent task is added as fix.

Change-Id: I5f0f78073f514d9600cd53d5bf757f27b8bfabe6
Closes-Bug: #1442990

commit_message:
Update package composing command

* Add forgotten default logo for heat template
* Add logo for regular package
* Resource dir is unnecessary parameter


Closes-Bug: #1438593
Change-Id: I578c4bde19e7b31f7470b25734fe30677d6d5c56

[{'created': '2015-04-17 12:53:43.000000000', 'message': "Limit parameter is no longer ignored for packages

A 'packages.filter()' method was ignoring the 'limit' kwarg parameter by
overriding it with the value of 'page_size' parameter of the
DEFAULT_PAGE_SIZE constant if the 'page_size' was not set.

'page_size' is used by the dashboard, limit - by the engine, and right
now both of them have the same assumed semantics.

This change makes the client accept both of them (with priority for
'page_size'). This approach should be changed later, if we introduce
some client-side filtering: in this case 'limit' should define the
number of items requested by the client and the pacge_size should define
the number of items got from the API in each request. Right now this is
not the case, so these two parameters are quite interchangeable.

Change-Id: Ie4f4d1751bc5c12e46f230152a462c9b7a45ccd1

commit_message:
Limit parameter is no longer ignored for packages

A 'packages.filter()' method was ignoring the 'limit' kwarg parameter by
overriding it with the value of 'page_size' parameter of the
DEFAULT_PAGE_SIZE constant if the 'page_size' was not set.

'page_size' is used by the dashboard, limit - by the engine, and right
now both of them have the same assumed semantics.

This change makes the client accept both of them (with priority for
'page_size'). This approach should be changed later, if we introduce
some client-side filtering: in this case 'limit' should define the
number of items requested by the client and the page_size should define
the number of items got from the API in each request. Right now this is
not the case, so these two parameters are quite interchangeable.

Change-Id: Ie4f4d1751bc5c12e46f230152a462c9b7a45ccd1
Partial-bug: #1445470

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Revert "Optimization of waiting subprocesses in ProcessLauncher"""

This reverts commit f5646edc61b9653d7ff71ed0177ed77811bbdcd0.

It turns out this affects more project than we thought initially.

Closes-Bug: #1446583

commit_message:
raise stevedore requirements

stable/juno is currently broken because of conflicts between cliff and
stevedore caused by things like barbicanclient, and oslo.utils likewise.

Depends-On: I40a40ca47f5c80a947436048e6b83f162c86c0b5

Change-Id: If48a8444b02ee1e105bc1d9ce78a0489ea0c405b
Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>
Related-Bug: #1446847

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-22 10:59:11.000000000', 'message': 'fix FloatingIP repr

The FloatingIP repr added in d614dbcab9cc8c5732ce28c655738218e147aad7
is incorrect, and can cause fails when you attempt to do bulk creation
activities with logging turned on.

This removes the __repr__ for FloatingIP so that it fails back to the
Resource defaults which are safe.

Partial Revert of d614dbcab9cc8c5732ce28c655738218e147aad7

Closes-Bug: #1437244

Change-Id: I8cedf418917157ce632606bef640049140134372
'}]
commit_message:
fix FloatingIP repr

The FloatingIP repr added in d614dbcab9cc8c5732ce28c655738218e147aad7
is incorrect, and can cause fails when you attempt to do bulk creation
activities with logging turned on.

This removes the __repr__ for FloatingIP so that it fails back to the
Resource defaults which are safe.

Partial Revert of d614dbcab9cc8c5732ce28c655738218e147aad7

Closes-Bug: #1437244

Change-Id: I8cedf418917157ce632606bef640049140134372

commit_message:
uncap stevedore entirely

stevedore is a reasonable stable library, and doesn't have transitive
requirements library issues. This is needed for unblocking the world.

Partial-Bug: #1446847

Change-Id: I40a40ca47f5c80a947436048e6b83f162c86c0b5

Fixed except of "Line 1198:             &:nth-child(3) {
Maybe give columns name-based classes for readability?"

I don't think it's reasonable to put classnames to each column of the auto-generated table. It just makes browser memory consumed a lot. It woluld be more reasonable if columns formatting would differ significantly, but for cases when the only width is defined index-based reference imo is more than enough.
Does it make sense?'}, {'account_id': 8766, 'date': '2015-04-21 08:45:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-20 05:47:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add API based plugin option

This patch adds the API based plugin to the project. With this patch,
the user can configure the plugin to use either the SQL based plugin,
or the API based plugin.

The new config added is "use_cluster". When set to True, the SQL based
plugin will be loaded. The default value is False, and with that the
API based plugin will be loaded.

config.py: added the use_cluster config.
util.py: added some API utils useful for handling error cases.
plugin.py: Added MidonetMixinApi class which implements the API
    based plugin.
test_midonet_plugin.py: Override the use_cluster flag to True.
test_midonet_plugin.api.py: Added Unit Tests for the API based
    plugin

Change-Id: I5bd8191cba0aabb2a8e93979d8a4ca93dd8159fa
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>
'}, {'created': '2015-04-20 08:27:48.000000000', 'message': 'Add API based plugin option

the user can configure the plugin to use either the SQL based plugin,
or the API based plugin.

The new config added is "use_cluster". When set to True, the SQL based
plugin will be loaded. The default value is False, and with that the
API based plugin will be loaded.

config.py: added the use_cluster config.
util.py: added some API utils useful for handling error cases.
plugin.py: Added MidonetMixinApi class which implements the API
    based plugin.
test_midonet_plugin.py: Override the use_cluster flag to True.
test_midonet_plugin.api.py: Added Unit Tests for the API based
    plugin

Change-Id: I5bd8191cba0aabb2a8e93979d8a4ca93dd8159fa
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Add API based plugin option

This patch adds the API based plugin to the project. With this patch,
the user can configure the plugin to use either the SQL based plugin,
or the API based plugin.

The new config added is "use_cluster". When set to True, the SQL based
plugin will be loaded. The default value is False, and with that the
API based plugin will be loaded.

config.py: added the use_cluster config.
util.py: added some API utils useful for handling error cases.
plugin.py: renamed the cluster plugin to MidonetMixinTasks
plugin_api.py: add the API based plugin.
test_midonet_plugin.py: Override the use_cluster flag to True.
test_midonet_plugin_api.py: Added Unit Tests for the API based
    plugin

Change-Id: I5bd8191cba0aabb2a8e93979d8a4ca93dd8159fa
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Lower the CIB validator version for Ubuntu

W/o this fix, the crm tool from the vivid version of the crmsh
package will report ERROR: CIB not supported: validator 'pacemaker-2.0'

The work around is to lower the validator version in CIB:
  validate-with="pacemaker-1.2"

Closes-bug: #1445478

Change-Id: I968b98178c0f015bafe445de732d7ee4af3783de
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Add ceph-compute task

Configures compute to use Ceph volumes. Without a
separate Ceph tasks compute nodes were not configured
to use Ceph volumes

Change-Id: Id3ffbe6b75fa6001789a970aa22972463f3be7cd
Closes-Bug: 1438369

[{'created': '2015-04-20 19:56:02.000000000', 'message': 'Reorder common apt repo tasks

An apt cache update was being initiated after the apt package pinning
occured, but before apt repos were put in place. The order has changed
so that both apt package pinning and an apt cache update occur after
repos have been configured.

Change-Id: I96bacfbf565903ffce49486fff1d14409e9135dc
Closes-Bug: 1446339
Related-Bug: 1421679
'}]
commit_message:
Reorder common apt repo tasks

An apt cache update was being initiated after the apt package pinning
occured, but before apt repos were put in place. The order has changed
so that both apt package pinning and an apt cache update occur after
repos have been configured.

Change-Id: I96bacfbf565903ffce49486fff1d14409e9135dc
Closes-Bug: 1446339
Related-Bug: 1421679

commit_message:
Add support for DLO configuration in swift

- New class swift::proxy::dlo for DLO configuration.
- Fixes for spec tests pulled from upstream.
- Upstream DLO patch spec tests adjusted to our version of
  swift module.

Related-bug: #1430765
Upstream change-id: Ie209e494d7affd72c3fea3f2cc3459b91d7c6765

Change-Id: I31099aa2efc3accc5ac9f4c3c182995c9fc2e547

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-22 11:25:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed problem with the NO_DATA type in sqlalchemy

sqlalchemy storage backend uses a special type _NO_DATA_ to be able to
store frames where no data where collected.
Since this change, the data exposed by get_time_frame was leaking
NO_DATA frames, they should be masked.

Change-Id: Id682d92f82a4db8419f9d98a7b50ee5a65e7816f
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed problem with the NO_DATA type in sqlalchemy

sqlalchemy storage backend uses a special type _NO_DATA_ to be able to
store frames where no data where collected.
Since this change, the data exposed by get_time_frame was leaking
NO_DATA frames, they should be masked.

Change-Id: Id682d92f82a4db8419f9d98a7b50ee5a65e7816f

commit_message:
Fix GetConsoleOutput and GetPasswordData

1 Add optional receiving instance_id as a list of id with single id
2 Encode console output and password data

There is one more Depends-On which we can't wait for so it's purely 
informational: Depends-On: I36ef88a561e60fb5dc3e687cb8bc02b27ec2e814

Depends-On: I711314408ec7c4ea75f93348a7335843713e9a2b

Change-Id: I0d62238bbf3a549344d578e131e8be9b3f268cf1

commit_message:
Fix rally plugins relative imports

We are not able to use relative imports for plugins that are
outside of rally package.

To fix this we should add to sys.path all directories with Rally
plugins.

This is quite easy fix. But in any case it includes functional test
that checks that this actually works in real life.

+ Fix of Rally gates to copy whole tree not just *.py files from
  rally-jobs/plugins/

Change-Id: Ie53dc2ba5c32a5e83d84d0ea5703e2e04b10ff33
Closes-bug: #1446923

commit_message:
Fixed potentially uninitialized session in sqlalchemy storage

On some given paths, the session of a given tenant wasn't initialized
and caused a crash.

Change-Id: Ie1abd7cffa98a5b25aaf235133ff902a621e09f8

commit_message:
Role with pending nodes should not be deleted

Added verification for pending_nodes in roles validator.
400 Bad-Request will be returned in case user will try it.

Change-Id: Ieeb4f3233cbd1928193aa9b96efc2792d3581411
Closes-Bug: 1446730

commit_message:
Elements for Docker and Kubernetes migrated to murano-apps

Versions for kubernetes components fixed to:
* Kubernetes v0.15
* etcd v2.0.9
* flannel v0.3.1
* confd v0.7.1
* Docker v1.6.0

Change-Id: Ibf4028dc4fbc4568e5de24805669d9caa6d4caf1
(cherry picked from commit cc765433d6878f752a0709b04676de0a96e93c13)

commit_message:
Folder Not Found with Git Downloadable File

When there is a downloadable type file which is a git repository,
a folder not found error appears:  No such file or directory

Also updated unit tests to work on Windows

Closes Bug: #1444862

Change-Id: I5ebb01b8d2c324e4e603a90142433b2abbbd62a2

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 13:29:34.000000000', 'message': "Force ntp on controllers work faster

As long as standard NTP divergency time floats between 8-20 minutes,
this time can be easily improved. What's changed:

* add iburst - send packets with less interval if server unreachable
  after first sended packet
* add tinker panic 0 - time can be stepped a lot
* add tinker stepout 5 - time can be stepped a lot many times and fast
* add minpoll 3 - minimal upstream poll interval now 8s

Closes-Bug: #1443647
Change-Id: I14d2c629f433e7528c803227d4b5afc74a8c2496
"}]
commit_message:
Force ntp on controllers work faster

As long as standard NTP divergency time floats between 8-20 minutes,
this time can be easily improved. What's changed:

* add iburst - send packets with less interval if server unreachable
  after first sended packet
* add tinker panic 0 - time can be stepped a lot
* add tinker stepout 5 - time can be stepped a lot many times and fast
* add minpoll 3 - minimal upstream poll interval now 8s

Closes-Bug: #1443647
Change-Id: I14d2c629f433e7528c803227d4b5afc74a8c2496

Currently, nothing prevents the port status to be changed to BUILD

Closes-Bug: #1416933

commit_message:
ML2: Change port status only when it's bound to the host

Currently, nothing prevents the port status to be changed to BUILD
state when get_device_details() is sent by a host that doesn't own
the port.
In some cases the port might stay in BUILD state.
This could happen during a live-migration, or for multi-hosted ports
such as HA ports.
This commit allows the port status modification only if the port
is bound to the host that is asking for it.

Closes-Bug: #1439857
Closes-Bug: #1438040
Closes-Bug: #1416933

Change-Id: I9b3673f453abbafaaa4f78542fcfebe8dc93f2bb
(cherry picked from commit 9b53b82ce7dad551ebc0f02ff667d5345fb7e139)

commit_message:
IPv6 SLAAC subnet create should update ports on net

If ports are first created on a network, and then an IPv6 SLAAC
or DHCPv6-stateless subnet is created on that network, then the
ports created prior to the subnet create are not getting
automatically updated (associated) with addresses for the
SLAAC/DHCPv6-stateless subnet, as required.

Change-Id: I88d04a13ce5b8ed4c88eac734e589e8a90e986a0
Closes-Bug: 1427474
Closes-Bug: 1441382
Closes-Bug: 1440183
(cherry picked from commit bd1044ba0e9d7d0f4752c891ac340b115f0019c4)

commit_message:
fix bugs with project id in DB for public objects

- public ami images in DB had incorrect project id
- public aki,ari images had incorrect project id

Change-Id: I752d0f98fed150cfa7c5de792d50b091e00afae1

commit_message:
Add nfs_mount_options variable when backend is NetApp

Bring the NetApp backend's options on par with the NFS backend mount options.

Change-Id: I619305890327ed09b0951582f34fe5eab7f8c427
Closes-Bug: #1445090

commit_message:
Storwize driver should only report active wwpn port

Current code will report both active and inactive wwpn port which
will cause connection failure.We should only report active port.

Closes-bug: #1445409

Change-Id: Ide74df778294bfec50fbedd2ac3cd9207201b187

commit_message:
Make the metadata_workers attribute in metadata_agent.ini configurable.

The default value of metadata_workers in metadata_agent.ini is half of the
number of CPU cores in the computer system. The value will be large only if
there are many CPU cores, which may not be necessary. It should be acceptable
to make this attribute configurable, which follows what has been done for
api_workers and rpc_workers in neutron.conf.

Change-Id: I823b485d72fb74c13e4bce221a256cfed6770d65

Application icons: css/html tweaks

commit_message:
neutron nova_admin_auth_url requires a protocol version

In my recent patch to move to identity_url, I mistakenly also
touched the nova_admin_auth_url which removed the v2.0 protocol
version from it.  This prevents neutron from working properly
with nova.

Change-Id: Ib48a9a4be4478eb5f6fd1a07c8bd13d57af1c4db
Closes-Bug: #1446652

commit_message:
Report already installed dependencies as warnings

Before already installed dependencies of packages were reported as
errors. This code make reporting consistent with bundle-import
behaviour.

Change-Id: Idfd4b5a92fbf063fb102ca4f85dafbfcd729ef77
Closes-Bug: #1446707

commit_message:
Set IMAGE_UPDATE_POLICY default to REBUILD

If a server network using port id, update image property will fail
with error 'port is still in use'. Set IMAGE_UPDATE_POLICY to
REBUILD will preserve the port information when update the image.

Closes-Bug: #1439708
Change-Id: I023ee076682bd5febb960dc8754d61986fd9bedf
(cherry picked from commit 9062453aa5aa0bb197623e80128f4ada63cd5fac)

subject: Add check for 'release:has-stable-branches'
messages:
[{'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2015-04-16 00:44:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2015-04-16 00:48:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

still a bit unclear on how this tag differs from 'release:at-6mo-cycle-end' and if its possible to automatically validate 'release:at-6mo-cycle-end'"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-16 01:14:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-governance-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/69/174169/1/check/gate-governance-docs/533a4c3//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 24s'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2015-04-20 10:28:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Looks good, see class naming nit inline.

I expect this will result in a lot of misses (the stable tag was applied based on the promise for Kilo, but reality caught us last week).

As far as at-6mo-cycle-end goes, it's a bit trickier since this is more a commitment from the project team than something tangible. We could rely on whether said project uses the YYYY.S versioning scheme, but that would leave Swift out (which may or may not be what we want). It's a relatively simple tag to maintain though, so I'm fine with not having a validator for it."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2015-04-20 15:31:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add tool/framework to automatically validate the tag applications.

Add tools/validate_tags.py framework to automatically validate the usage
of tags in reference/projects.yaml. This is only for tags that can be
enforced pragmatically.

This is not intended for gating purposes, rather to make the process of
updating projects.yaml easier.

Supports both team and repository based tags.

Updated diversity.py to work with validate_tags

Change-Id: Id477bfcfccb4dbf5f03f328273c9487ccc48e054

commit_message:
Update formatting of teams page

Make the teams page a little easier to use.

* Add  section titles for clarity and for hrefs, so you can link to say
  the mission of a team (neutron.html#mission)
* List each tag on its own line. As the number of tags grow putting all
  the tags for a given repo on a single line will become unwieldy.

Change-Id: I1aef7897f718ab851a5ac83a1a979ee8ca48f6c2

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-17 19:55:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes race condition and boosts the scheduling performance

This patch fixes a race-condition that occurs when the
scheduler tries to check for dvr serviceable ports before
it schedules a router when a subnet is associated with
a router.

Sometimes the dhcp port creation is delayed and so the
router is not scheduled to the l3-agent.

Also it boosts the scheduling performance on dvr-snat
node for scheduling a router.

This patch will provide a work around to fix this race
condition and to boost the scheduling performance
by scheduling a router on a dvr-snat when
dhcp is enabled on the provided subnet, instead of checking
all the available ports on the subnet.

Closes-Bug: #1442494

Change-Id: I089fefdd8535bdc9ed90b3230438ab0bfb6aab4f
(cherry picked from commit c65d3ab6ad4589e6e4a6b488d2eb5d1e4cfee138)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes race condition and boosts the scheduling performance

This patch fixes a race-condition that occurs when the
scheduler tries to check for dvr serviceable ports before
it schedules a router when a subnet is associated with
a router.

Sometimes the dhcp port creation is delayed and so the
router is not scheduled to the l3-agent.

Also it boosts the scheduling performance on dvr-snat
node for scheduling a router.

This patch will provide a work around to fix this race
condition and to boost the scheduling performance
by scheduling a router on a dvr-snat when
dhcp is enabled on the provided subnet, instead of checking
all the available ports on the subnet.

Closes-Bug: #1442494

Change-Id: I089fefdd8535bdc9ed90b3230438ab0bfb6aab4f
(cherry picked from commit c65d3ab6ad4589e6e4a6b488d2eb5d1e4cfee138)

commit_message:
Update sphinx docs to support team based tags

I7a71ebb508d3f8d2fd8d9e33f920e2de70ebb7a4 applied the first set of team
based tags, but the tag weren't properly rendered in the html output.

* Update the sphinx extensions to support team based tags
* Update the team:diversity-affiliation page to use 'tagged-projects'

Change-Id: I936c4d528d229d64484eaed86d689111777fdb8e

commit_message:
File key is wrongly created when the File Type is downloadable

When execution plan is created in murano for dowloadable files,
the file key is not the same as script file key, so that,
 there is an error in murano-agent.

Closes-Bug: #1441187

Change-Id: I608d6b2d683f19670c6285cf40cbc265dd7227b3

commit_message:
File key is wrongly created when the File Type is downloadable

When execution plan is created in murano for dowloadable files,
the file key is not the same as script file key, so that,
 there is an error in murano-agent.

Closes-Bug: #1441187

Change-Id: I608d6b2d683f19670c6285cf40cbc265dd7227b3

commit_message:
Fixed is_glance_image(image_href) predicate logic

is_glance_image() returned True if image_href was a normal file like
"deploy.iso". It should return False for this case.
This patch fixed is_glance_image() predicate logic so that it returns
True only if image_href is glance URL or glance UUID.

Change-Id: I338964d05280175dd86bb2b6e1c7073871382277
Closes-Bug: #1446052

After +2ing for this, I felt the reverted test just detected real problem of stable/juno.
Can we already find the lack patch of stable/juno for fixing the problem?
Ideally, it was the best to merge the patch instead of reverting.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2015-04-20 21:47:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Ken'ichi, I asked devananda if he had ideas about what's broken in ironic but it might not even be a stable/juno thing, it could just be that this test didn't with a baremetal (ironic) setup.  I thought this was passing on kilo because of the ironic pxe ssh job passing on the original change, but after digging into the tests for that job, it doesn't even run the test, so it probably doesn't work on master either (I think it has something to do with how security groups are setup with neutron for baremetal?).  Anyway, mtreinish said it was also leaking floating IPs so it probably need some work anyway, but should be skipped if running with CONF.service_available.baremetal=True."}, {'account_id': 13342, 'date': '2015-04-21 05:50:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If this patch is able to find some problem in the ironic then why we have to revert the test instead of resolving the issue in the ironic.Since this is a very basic scenario and i don't think that  its a good idea to revert this test. Please let me know your thoughts on this."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2015-04-21 16:21:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Abhishek the revert was because I noticed stable/juno gate was completely broken on Sunday because of the new test, so the fastest way to resolve that when I wasn't familiar at the time with all of the details or how to fix (backports to table/juno for ironic maybe?) was to revert.

Then you can push a new change that re-introduces the test but skips it if CONF.service_available.baremetal=True since we know it doesn't work in the ironic case.  *why* it doesn't work, I'm not totally sure, but I'm told ironic + neutron have to be setup in a special way, which is why there is a lot of skipping in tempest if running baremetal (or not).

But as noted, mtreinish also said there was a floating IP leak in the original test too so that would need to be addressed in the new patch."}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2015-04-22 00:59:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Abhishek

As Matt said, we need to avoid breaking the gate tests because we need to avoid blocking patches' mergers. Most developer (including me) want to merge their own patches asap, and they feel frustrations if their mergers fail due to unrelated problems.

If we merges this kind of test patches into Tempest, they can blame us, that is an important and interesting point of Tempest. We should take care of test patches mergers. But in this case, it was difficult to find problem before merging the test patch, because the gate job didn't run on Tempest gate.

The other important point is that "who does own the responsibility of the gate failure?". We could find the problem with this reverted patch, but we cannot point necessary patch out yet for stable/juno. If this kind of gate failure happen, we need to fix it asap. Is it possible to spend your time for that?'}, {'account_id': 13342, 'date': '2015-04-22 09:06:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Ken'ichi Ohmichi: As i am new contributor to openstack/tempest, i am not familiar with how to handle the gate failure. I need to learn on it."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-19 15:45:38.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Test creation of server attached to created port"

This reverts commit 2b34ec3ff444e6e6ec7b3e52832ecd6e8ca20552

This breaks gate-grenade-dsvm-ironic-sideways on
stable/juno because the requested port's mac address is not
in the list of available mac addresses from the ironic
driver.

It's also unclear how useful this is given we already have
the test_preserve_preexisting_port test which is
essentially testing the same scenario, except it's not
run on stable/icehouse or stable/juno since preserving
pre-existing ports in nova wasn't fixed until Kilo.

Change-Id: I24403c1ae734b2137ddee5c3bf5a1594cf5375d8
Closes-Bug: #1445917
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Test creation of server attached to created port"

This reverts commit 2b34ec3ff444e6e6ec7b3e52832ecd6e8ca20552

This breaks gate-grenade-dsvm-ironic-sideways on
stable/juno because the requested port's mac address is not
in the list of available mac addresses from the ironic
driver.

It's also unclear how useful this is given we already have
the test_preserve_preexisting_port test which is
essentially testing the same scenario, except it's not
run on stable/icehouse or stable/juno since preserving
pre-existing ports in nova wasn't fixed until Kilo.

Change-Id: I24403c1ae734b2137ddee5c3bf5a1594cf5375d8
Closes-Bug: #1445917

* Many fixes and improvements

Related blueprint: deployment-dryrun

commit_message:
Folder Not Found with Git Downloadable File

When there is a downloadable type file which is a git repository,
a folder not found error appears:  No such file or directory

Also updated unit tests to work on Windows

Closes Bug: #1444862

Change-Id: I5ebb01b8d2c324e4e603a90142433b2abbbd62a2

Are we really need copies of 56-docker? This files are the same. 
Maybe we can find a place, where elements will live together?'}, {'account_id': 7226, 'date': '2015-04-21 16:45:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Victor: they are the same at this moment this is will not necessary be true in the future. When each application has its own copy of element you can make changes to it and evolve independently from other apps without a risk to break old code that was tested with previous version. Remember that there will also be package versions and next k8s package release may use updated docker element. Another case is that next DSH version will require something that is not necessary for k8s'}, {'account_id': 13962, 'date': '2015-04-21 16:52:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7225, 'date': '2015-04-21 17:12:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13752, 'date': '2015-04-21 17:48:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think we don't really need a different elements. We just need unified parametrized elements. And if we need specific version, we can provide specific environment variable and get the version we need."}, {'account_id': 13752, 'date': '2015-04-21 18:11:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7226, 'date': '2015-04-21 18:31:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-21 18:32:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

commit_message:
Elements for Docker and Kubernetes migrated to murano-apps

Versions for kubernetes components fixed to:
* Kubernetes v0.15
* etcd v2.0.9
* flannel v0.3.1
* confd v0.7.1
* Docker v1.6.0

Change-Id: Ibf4028dc4fbc4568e5de24805669d9caa6d4caf1

commit_message:
Lacp bond verification failure

If LACP/802.3ad bond configured for 2 interfaces on switch
we should verify that packets received from atleast one interface

Closes-Bug: #1321765
Change-Id: I4f4c6ec76b7d29acd637a84369d38df93d48216c

commit_message:
Added missing execution plan

Execution plan to patch existing k8s services to include node IPs
when number of nodes changed and we are not using gateways
or we was using gateways and now we don't

These 2 files were supposed to be in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/175506/
but I forgot to commit them

Also fixes typo that is already fixed in stable/kilo

Change-Id: I6af644511bf25ae7ae31c88914d33b8c518a4eec

when number of nodes changed and we are not using gateways
or we was using gateways and now we don't

These 2 files were supposed to be in

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Add unique constraint to Service.type field.

Change field service.type to unique and add a test case to create
two services with the same type which should fail.

Change-Id: I0a4d2f938db17b325f4c3f974f15879da3033c3b
Closes-Bug: #1439928

commit_message:
Add option values log for cloudkitty-api

Currently, when launch the cloudkitty-api service, the configure option
values will don't be record in log file, unlike others projects in
openstack. This patch add the options value logging and the info of api
server stating.

Change-Id: I63957e23dbbd109d62fa50c8d0797b1d56649259

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

Change-Id: I37e0acc5ed8e1af565359290fa622456901c735e
'}]
commit_message:
Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

Change-Id: I37e0acc5ed8e1af565359290fa622456901c735e

[{'created': '2015-04-20 09:04:04.000000000', 'message': 'Use Hieroglyph instead of landslide in Training Guides

- delete landslide files
- convert existing rst files to Hieroglyph format
- add new slide build command to the tox.ini
- change default CSS to make output more OpenStack-like
  - used the Foundation Slides' OpenStack-Powered-April2015.ppt
  - title slide with image
  - white h1 css text
  - "openstack's special red" for h2

Change-Id: Icb22482862a85c3d174d9292fb470f64fb95f7aa
'}, {'created': '2015-04-20 09:25:37.000000000', 'message': 'Use Hieroglyph instead of landslide in Training Guides

- delete landslide files
- convert existing rst files to Hieroglyph format
- add new slide build command to the tox.ini
- change default CSS to make output more OpenStack-like
  - used the Foundation Slides' OpenStack-Powered-April2015.ppt
  - title slide with image
  - white h1 css text
  - "openstack's special red" for h2

Change-Id: Icb22482862a85c3d174d9292fb470f64fb95f7aa

commit_message:
Use Hieroglyph instead of landslide in Training Guides

- delete landslide files
- convert existing rst files to Hieroglyph format
- add new slide build command to the tox.ini
- change default CSS to make output more OpenStack-like
  - used the Foundation Slides' OpenStack-Powered-April2015.ppt
  - title slide with image
  - white h1 css text
  - "openstack's special red" for h2

Change-Id: Icb22482862a85c3d174d9292fb470f64fb95f7aa

Bakckported bunch of changes that improve removing
data from database. Instead of removing just tables
that was defined in models, all data will be removed.

Change-Id: Id2bebc9009c269b464606db3938e8f45a8a1f44e

commit_message:
Backport improved database cleaning

Bakckported bunch of changes that improve removing
data from database. Instead of removing just tables
that was defined in models, all data will be removed.

Change-Id: Id2bebc9009c269b464606db3938e8f45a8a1f44e
Closes-Bug: #1445423

subject: DNM: A noop change to demonstrate the devstack plugin

commit_message:
DNM: A noop change to demonstrate the devstack plugin

This change depends on all the changes needed to move the devstack
configuration of trove from the devstack repo to trove itself as
a plugin.

Depends-On: I8f9f1a015edb7ec1033e2eaf0b29ab15d89384ce

Change-Id: I76e7f09722c72fe3889e20756a70f6bba98be4bc

commit_message:
To attach interface for server when using 'uuid'

If user using 'uuid' to specify the network id, to make
sure to attach interface for server when updating.

Change-Id: Ie7ceb9c54ab4da4ad9a5d19803791edd41e5604c
Closes-Bug: #1439497
(cherry picked from commit 6523afe8c9739a098955d462551f6da829045ce0)

commit_message:
Bumped netaddr version to 0.7.14

Version was bumped because we need new netaddr version for handling
eui-64 addresses.

Change-Id: I57097e043a479f9001d73a3c121df2acbb1c1ac4
Partial-Bug: #1398882

commit_message:
Cleans nullable=True in db model column declaration

By default sqlalchemy considers the Column's nullable=True and
this patch cleans those column declaration which is having
default value for the nullable field as it is not required
explicitly

Change-Id: I22b0d62238298fa49da09c53019408bc2049b893
Closes-bug: #1439959
(cherry picked from commit 1dbb1ed98f98a8b474f4d54df6554e4e1d93a296)

[{'created': '2015-04-21 23:17:07.000000000', 'message': "Don't re-bind environment for get_file during stack update

While we're in the process of updating a stack, we set the stack's
environment to the new, updated values. However, we don't want to change
existing resources' idea of their own values until we have explivitly done
an update of them to bring them into line with the new
template/environment. So when parsing a template snippet containing the
get_file intrinsic, store the files dict to which it will refer. get_file
will resolve to the new file only when the template has been updated.

Closes-Bug: #1445170
Change-Id: I8ec32b0e38389cd314e4b2b2d8c65f61f8a9c41e
(cherry picked from commit e4447e7b66cf4691218b067643b5e25de72e31ba)

Change-Id: I8ec32b0e38389cd314e4b2b2d8c65f61f8a9c41e
(cherry picked from commit e4447e7b66cf4691218b067643b5e25de72e31ba)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't re-bind environment for get_file during stack update

While we're in the process of updating a stack, we set the stack's
environment to the new, updated values. However, we don't want to change
existing resources' idea of their own values until we have explivitly done
an update of them to bring them into line with the new
template/environment. So when parsing a template snippet containing the
get_file intrinsic, store the files dict to which it will refer. get_file
will resolve to the new file only when the template has been updated.

Closes-Bug: #1445170
Change-Id: I8ec32b0e38389cd314e4b2b2d8c65f61f8a9c41e
(cherry picked from commit e4447e7b66cf4691218b067643b5e25de72e31ba)

commit_message:
Persist parent_resource_name and make sure it's available

We are persisting for a number of reasons:
- so we don't have to pass this through ever rpc call
- the API exposes parent_resource (currently always None as
  it is not persisted)

Closes-Bug: #1438978

Change-Id: I2fe3d371e76e09c11e34e89ce04638004ff36056

Dmitry, Ramakrishnan,

Thank you for the review and comment.

I understood your point as a developer.

My company as well as myself think that minimizing manual  procedure is more important from customer's point of view.

So "Discover node properties with node-set-provision-state" and "Discover node properties and capabilities for iLO drivers" are definitely nice for customer because of the same reason.
Typing "ironic node-update" for each property is very tedious and error prone.

Naohiro.'}, {'account_id': 13997, 'date': '2015-03-02 03:56:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13719, 'date': '2015-03-02 07:19:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-02 07:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23: Verified+1

I also tend to agree that ironic should not be automatically managing mounted filesystems on the conductor; that is purely an admin task just like ensuring /tftpboot exists and tftp is configured correctly.'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2015-03-03 05:52:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23: Code-Review-2

ironic-conductor is not, today, responsible for preparing the environment in which it runs. The PXE drivers do not start tftpd, httpd, or other system-level services which they rely upon.

Expanding the scope of the driver to also manage its environment and start system services is a significant architectural change, and merits separate discussion. I'm blocking this spec until we have reached a concensus on that."}, {'account_id': 13719, 'date': '2015-03-03 12:17:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23:

commit_message:
iRMC Virtual Media Deploy Driver for Ironic

* The proposal presents the work required to add support for
  deployment features for FUJITSU PRIMERGY iRMC, integrated Remote
  Management Controller, Drivers in Ironic.

Change-Id: I8761544bc9a19f167da59a754d7731567764fef5
Implements: blueprint irmc-virtualmedia-deploy-driver

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 09:53:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed a bug with uninitialized usage interval in nodata

A call to nodata was potentially using undefined interval data.
Updated functions used to check when we need to switch to a new period
and commit.

Change-Id: I6ced47e7f04756ae5b896953a299c4e277693e75
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed a bug with uninitialized usage interval in nodata

A call to nodata was potentially using undefined interval data.
Updated functions used to check when we need to switch to a new period
and commit.

Change-Id: I6ced47e7f04756ae5b896953a299c4e277693e75

One thing I couldn't figure out from looking at the code: If Nova sends a port request to neutron, but it does not supply the tap name. Here in the code we only store the tap name if it comes with the request. This could be an issue with data sync because the tap name won't be in the database. How is this handled?"}, {'account_id': 156, 'date': '2015-04-22 03:19:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I was thinking something along the line of, for data sync, either we don't try to rebind the VM ports or we just generate the tap names on the fly during data sync.  I think removing that code simplifies the logic.  So for now, we don't re-bind VMs, and later we can provide a way to 'fix' the actual bindings after discussing how we should do that.  Also, I noticed that for DHCP ports, the host was not set."}, {'account_id': 8837, 'date': '2015-04-22 04:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2015-04-22 06:27:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Refactor portbinding

In this patch the following changes are made:

 * Portbinding tasks are removed since the MidoNet translation
   code could handle them.  Keeping them in the plugin overly
   complicated the code.
 * Clean up db access code related to port binding in the mixin
   class
 * Simplify the unbinding of ports by only looking at the profile
   interface field to determine the unbinding action.
 * Add more thorough unit tests

Fixes: MNP-110
Change-Id: I09d556c3200103dd6dde0e238028e9c1abf0d176

[{'created': '2015-04-01 15:09:29.000000000', 'message': 'Moves taskmanager-common-code for clusters

Found that the following methods are quite similar in appearance:
1. update_statuses_on_failure
2. _all_instances_ready
3. get_ip
4. get_guest

Also, it seems that these methods would be needed
for any future cluster implementations,
so it would be better if they have some common residence.

Hence, moved these methods to taskmanager.models.ClusterTasks,
which is parent to both MongoDbClusterTasks and VerticaClusterTasks.

Change-Id: I39f7dc2f5ab318ac095b8bf4742c83ab2ca9a499
'}]
commit_message:
Moves taskmanager-common-code for clusters

Found that the following methods are quite similar in appearance:
1. update_statuses_on_failure
2. _all_instances_ready
3. get_ip
4. get_guest

Also, it seems that these methods would be needed
for any future cluster implementations,
so it would be better if they have some common residence.

Hence, moved these methods to taskmanager.models.ClusterTasks,
which is parent to both MongoDbClusterTasks and VerticaClusterTasks.

Change-Id: I39f7dc2f5ab318ac095b8bf4742c83ab2ca9a499

commit_message:
Extend rollback tests

- Add test to delete node after rollback
- Modify test rollback_automatically_ha_one_controller_env to use
ceph_multinode_compact snapshot and add ceph node after rollback

Change-Id: If5a552ad7bd2ec50f133a259929d411b5dbfa11a
Closes-Bug: #1441552

[{'created': '2015-04-20 10:00:12.000000000', 'message': 'Release Import of Translations from Transifex

Manual import of Translations from Transifex. This change also removes
all po files that are less than 66 per cent translated since such
partially translated files will not help users.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle the proposed branches and we need to sync with latest
translations.

Change-Id: I72a675c62c83538a07366cbef3bfa84318eb7bb9
'}]
commit_message:
Release Import of Translations from Transifex

Manual import of Translations from Transifex. This change also removes
all po files that are less than 66 per cent translated since such
partially translated files will not help users.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle the proposed branches and we need to sync with latest
translations.

Change-Id: I72a675c62c83538a07366cbef3bfa84318eb7bb9

commit_message:
fix for vmware test_driver_api to pass with random PYTHONHASHSEED

fix fake.FakeVim._search_ds, incorrect lstrip usage

Partial-Bug: #1348818

Change-Id: Iae75bbac678d997ff05ffec15aaffcaed6da5186

subject: Add exception catch for create bay rpc call.
messages:
[{'account_id': 15697, 'date': '2015-04-22 04:04:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2015-04-22 04:12:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think we don't need to handle this exception as 400 status is better than 500 status.

400 here means that the baymodel has invalid attribute and that seems ok than returning 500 status which means some error has occurred.

Rather the fix should be at baymodel-create to fail when invalid parameters are passed. Hence such exceptions will not be raised while creating bay.

A bug has already been logged for the same:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/magnum/+bug/1412181"}, {'account_id': 15697, 'date': '2015-04-22 04:26:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Madhuri Kumari: I think we can't ensure the bay_create rpc didn't raise a exception. Agree with that? There is many reason may cause raise exception.In the bug, i just miss keypair.The bug is didn't fix for miss parameter,It's fix for show traceback in the tty.It's not a good way show error to end-user.thougths?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-22 04:29:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-magnum-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/69/176169/1/check/gate-magnum-pep8/fcbd381/ : SUCCESS in 1m 35s

- check-functional-dsvm-magnum http://logs.openstack.org/69/176169/1/check/check-functional-dsvm-magnum/feb2ce0/ : SUCCESS in 20m 17s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 12385, 'date': '2015-04-22 04:49:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

agree with madhuri.

@Fang Fenghua if magnum.conf setting change debug to false, end-user will not see stack trace.'}, {'account_id': 15697, 'date': '2015-04-22 06:26:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Motohiro/Yuanying Otsuka  You are right, I update the conf and didn't show the tracecback.I will abandoned it and tag the bug valid.Tks Motohiro/Yuanying Otsuka  and Madhuri Kumari review it."}, {'account_id': 15697, 'date': '2015-04-22 06:26:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

bug is valid'}]

[{'created': '2015-04-22 04:04:27.000000000', 'message': 'Add exception catch for create bay rpc call.

If bay_create call raise a exception,
it will show the traceback info at the

Closes-Bug:#1446210

commit_message:
Add exception catch for create bay rpc call.

If bay_create call raise a exception,
it will show the traceback info at the
tty, so we need handle that case.

Change-Id: I77c4a929d8bebe5b26104be38f78a13a8ed1fd7b
Closes-Bug:#1446210

subject: refactored test in vmware test_read_write_util to pass with random PYTHONHASHSEED

I agree with you completely that the API should be changed to not allow this behavior.  However, given that it does right now, this is a valid fix to not mess up the volume's state."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2015-04-22 04:36:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

yeah, revert is a bit hasty... and probably not necessary.  We can certainly fix this all up in L.

I am objecting to this being marked as Kilo RC potential however, and also I strongly object to backporting it to Juno.  It most certainly doesn't meet the criteria for backporting to stable IMHO and it touches enough code that it raises concerns from my side."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-22 05:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-22 04:11:16.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Get volume from db again before updating it's status"

This reverts commit 4d6ddcb94435a20476536f4956de88ce4ab15b66.

```````````````````````````````````
This is an invalid case, we don't allow multi-attach;   Upload volume_to_image works by attaching the volume to the Cinder node and uploading via the Cinder node as a proxy/worker.

This won't even work for almost every driver as there's no multi-attach.  The API shouldn't allow this and that's what should be changed IMO.

Change-Id: I05b8b94484eda4b051032b40cdbcfe38f7e78a1b
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Get volume from db again before updating it's status"

This reverts commit 4d6ddcb94435a20476536f4956de88ce4ab15b66.

```````````````````````````````````
This is an invalid case, we don't allow multi-attach;   Upload volume_to_image works by attaching the volume to the Cinder node and uploading via the Cinder node as a proxy/worker.

This won't even work for almost every driver as there's no multi-attach.  The API shouldn't allow this and that's what should be changed IMO.

Change-Id: I05b8b94484eda4b051032b40cdbcfe38f7e78a1b

fixed tests in test_matchers to pass with random PYTHONHASHSEED

changed order in dicts, build expected string in runtime.
Partial-Bug: #1348818

Support VHD output format

This useful for building images for xen.

Change-Id: Ib716bd7fc1ed979968ea92f46f1644038e40df66

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug

Change-Id: I37e0acc5ed8e1af565359290fa622456901c735e

commit_message:
Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

Change-Id: I37e0acc5ed8e1af565359290fa622456901c735e

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-20 16:30:36.000000000', 'message': "RBD: Add missing Ceph customized cluster name support

It turns out '--cluster' is also needed when RBD driver talks to
ceph cluster using 'ceph' command (not via librados).  This change
appends RBDDriver._ceph_args with '--cluster' when 'rbd_cluster_name'
config option is not None.

Change-Id: Ie957a3658a630947a140f4172f775e42b7611c6e
Closes-bug: #1444855
"}]
commit_message:
RBD: Add missing Ceph customized cluster name support

It turns out '--cluster' is also needed when RBD driver talks to
ceph cluster using 'ceph' command (not via librados).  This change
appends RBDDriver._ceph_args with '--cluster' when 'rbd_cluster_name'
config option is not None.

Change-Id: Ie957a3658a630947a140f4172f775e42b7611c6e
Closes-bug: #1444855

commit_message:
Reserve 5 migrations for Kilo backports

Reserve 5 migrations so that we can backport any fixes
that require a db migration to stable kilo.

Change-Id: I951f945e58698907a464e19d340222e41c0f31d1

commit_message:
Allow rc-update with rc name also.

This patch lets rc-update API to be called with name also.

Change-Id: I125f403855139425ccecfbcfd1672eaf27d4746d
Partially-Implements: blueprint name-based-resource-management

commit_message:
Allow pod-update with pod name also.

This patch lets pod-update API to be called with name also.

Change-Id: Ia181e374f66e8a440ab1d116fef20b27cb796010
Partially-Implements: blueprint name-based-resource-management

commit_message:
Standardize logging in volume.api.py

We now have resource tag support in oslo logging,
and our logging is pretty inconsistent and down right
ugly in places.  Let's clean things up based on the
standard logging guidelines and use the fancy new
resource tag.

This patch starts with the volume.api file as that's
'easy', so we can enforce things going forward and start
working out other files in future patches.

To use set the following in cinder.conf:
logging_context_format_string = \
%(asctime)s.%(msecs)03d %(levelname)s %(name)s [%(request_id)s \
%(project_name)s] %(resource)s%(message)s

Change-Id: I78708ba8bc372c2ca051aa7d84386dc7125a9b5e

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 22:48:28.000000000', 'message': '[install-guide] Modify horizon content for Kilo

Modify horizon content for Kilo as follows:

1) Add note assuming prior installation of Apache HTTP server
   and Memcached in keystone chapter.

2) Adjust syntax for ALLOWED_HOSTS option.

3) Trigger the Apache HTTP server to reload configuration rather
   than restarting it.

Change-Id: Ib691d19c4792a187511579df4f0fa8ff5a1fee7e
Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo
'}]
commit_message:
[install-guide] Modify horizon content for Kilo

Modify horizon content for Kilo as follows:

1) Add note assuming prior installation of Apache HTTP server
   and Memcached in keystone chapter.

2) Adjust syntax for ALLOWED_HOSTS option.

3) Trigger the Apache HTTP server to reload configuration rather
   than restarting it.

Change-Id: Ib691d19c4792a187511579df4f0fa8ff5a1fee7e
Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo

commit_message:
[install-guide] move call of heat-keystone-setup-domain

Prior to calling heat-keystone-setup-domain it is necessary to install
the command and to prepare the heat.conf configuration file.

Partially implements bp installguide-kilo.

Change-Id: I5248cad0f778ebec3c71eae2a8446dff8b69c0dc

commit_message:
Support testing on 32 bit systems

Under a 32 bit OS, the type of max/min is long, not int.

Allow both long and int as valid types for these parameters.

Change-Id: If0ae44090229e2bf77405d81f06698e75ac54b97
Closes-Bug: #1446174

commit_message:
Reenable some doc8 tests

Enable doc8 but disable D000 (RST validation) and
D001 test (overlong lines). This also disables
all the problems we had in the past with doc8 checking, the current
files pass doc8 after fixing a few minor problems (part of change).

This basically tests for whitespace.

Change-Id: I648ac7f78b3a31f3b1434dc7d7d0b887ce4d5128

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 20:42:54.000000000', 'message': "Remove [Service] section from mongo config tmpl

The mongodb guest wasn't starting up on Ubuntu or Fedora
due to the presense of a [Service] section in /etc/mongodb.conf.
I believe this section was not intended for config.template but
should be in the systemd script for mongo. For now, we will
revert this change and consider a better way to fix it for
Liberty.

The change that introduced this is:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/150131

Change-Id: I090c95185f732485a21f6d38df1655e205a07224
Closes-bug: 1446735
"}]
commit_message:
Remove [Service] section from mongo config tmpl

The mongodb guest wasn't starting up on Ubuntu or Fedora
due to the presense of a [Service] section in /etc/mongodb.conf.
I believe this section was not intended for config.template but
should be in the systemd script for mongo. For now, we will
revert this change and consider a better way to fix it for
Liberty.

The change that introduced this is:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/150131

Change-Id: I090c95185f732485a21f6d38df1655e205a07224
Closes-bug: 1446735

commit_message:
Constraint violation error of physical locator

This patch fixes the physical locator dict which was
being passed to the agent during the second
l2gateway connection

Change-Id: I0670ff18c855e5ea045e0047227c2dbe044d91ce
Closes-Bug:1446604

Hi Walter,
As you mentioned, no way to create a consistent image out of in-use volume without freeze i/o to volume and flush it before creating an Image. I think that is why we have –force option default set to false. IMO what we have to do is properly document it.'}, {'account_id': 14863, 'date': '2015-03-05 14:39:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: -Code-Review

Hi,

We need to stop instance (to which volume is attached or which is created from bootable volume) before coping volume to image, to do not corrupt data.
Also when we stop instance with volume attached, then volume still remains in 'in-use' state."}, {'account_id': 8300, 'date': '2015-03-09 07:05:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Commit message was updated'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-09 07:52:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified+1

commit_message:
Get volume from db again before updating it's status

During uploading a volume which is attached to an instance to image service,
if the instance is deleted then the volume remains in "in-use" status.
So get the volume again from db before updating it's status.

Added new db api called 'volume_update_status_based_on_attachment'.
It gets volume from db and updates its status using the same session.

Closes-Bug: #1406703
Change-Id: I01d313438f021cd2fe0d6f5c23f2029279d4b55a

commit_message:
Move devstack's Zaqar code into the codebase

This, besides making devstack slimner, will give us more control on
what's in the plugin and it'll allow us to experiment with different
configurations.

Change-Id: I38c6cf71e2ae73f60e4494d853fee5796aa1f0f8

commit_message:
Modulefile: install RabbitMQ module

puppet-glance requires to have puppetlabs-rabbitmq installed to make
Glance working.
This commit adds the module to the Modulefile list with the same version
as puppet-nova/icehouse module for consistency.

Closes-bug: #1393845
Change-Id: Ia31c597960cfac77f11428c5e073c7947b95fdd8

commit_message:
MySQL: change default MySQL collate to utf8_general_ci

Install & configure MySQL database by using utf8_general_ci collation
which is the way documented in OpenStack [1] and already the default
in puppetlabs-mysql [2].

[1] http://goo.gl/GA5gyZ
[2] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/blob/master/manifests/db.pp#L7

Change-Id: I2d5fc688c75c54703624797eb1829973623ef916
Closes-bug: #1446375

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-22 01:05:41.000000000', 'message': 'Enable "set -e" by default

Run stack.sh with "set -e" to make devstack exit immediately if something
fails. This should make debugging easier as we will exit on the first
sign of trouble, so it will be easier to find the root cause.

Change-Id: I39e2c07916e0440c6bd1b632eaf792b2fa9e4bb5
WIP: I assume we want to make this configurable like  we do for nounset
'}, {'created': '2015-04-22 01:18:00.000000000', 'message': 'Enable "set -E" by default

Run stack.sh with "set -E" to make the ERR trap is used everywhere:

'If set, any trap on
ERR is inherited by shell functions, command substitutions, and commands
executed in a subshell environment. The ERR trap is normally not
inherited in such cases'.
http://linux.die.net/man/1/bash

Change-Id: I39e2c07916e0440c6bd1b632eaf792b2fa9e4bb5
'}]
commit_message:
Enable "set -E" by default

Run stack.sh with "set -E" to make the ERR trap is used everywhere:

'If set, any trap on
ERR is inherited by shell functions, command substitutions, and commands
executed in a subshell environment. The ERR trap is normally not
inherited in such cases'.
http://linux.die.net/man/1/bash

Change-Id: I39e2c07916e0440c6bd1b632eaf792b2fa9e4bb5

commit_message:
Added API support for getting node with details

This patch enhance the node_get api to return details about the physical
object associated with the node.

Change-Id: I1cf342fd5647ab154bac2fdf620cbe82240b64b4

commit_message:
Support to get details of physical objects

This patch adds support to get details about physical objects which is
associated with a node. There will be a parameter specifying whether the
details will be returned.

Change-Id: I1e9bf3a1192c44a635756c46e435463469e26242

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-20 09:30:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes unit-tests in test_dbaas.py

- mongoDbApp.reset_configuration raises UnprocessableEntity exception
  because of missing destination path as
  mongodb.service.CONFIG_FILE is returned as None from operating_system.file_discovery
  (in the absence of a mock of os.path.isfile),
  so updated the exception in assertRaise in
  test_mongodb_error_in_write_config_verify_unlink.

- Also, in test_mongodb_error_in_write_config_verify_unlink,
  since we are using operating_system.move
  so no need of mocking the execute_with_timeout, so just removed that.

- test_mongodb_error_in_write_config and
  test_mongodb_error_in_write_config_verify_unlink are nearly same,
  so removed test_mongodb_error_in_write_config.

Change-Id: I391dda4696ba30f24b2f9efd68a7d617010d680c
Closes-Bug: #1446105
'}, {'created': '2015-04-20 10:29:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes unit-tests in test_dbaas.py

- Updated test_mongodb_error_in_write_config_verify_unlink,
  to mock operating_system.move instead of mocking execute_with_timeout.

- test_mongodb_error_in_write_config and
  test_mongodb_error_in_write_config_verify_unlink are nearly same,
  so removed test_mongodb_error_in_write_config.

Change-Id: I391dda4696ba30f24b2f9efd68a7d617010d680c
Closes-Bug: #1446105
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes unit-tests in test_dbaas.py

- Updated test_mongodb_error_in_write_config_verify_unlink,
  to mock operating_system.move instead of mocking execute_with_timeout.

- test_mongodb_error_in_write_config and
  test_mongodb_error_in_write_config_verify_unlink are nearly same,
  so removed test_mongodb_error_in_write_config.

Change-Id: I391dda4696ba30f24b2f9efd68a7d617010d680c
Closes-Bug: #1446105

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-13 23:04:33.000000000', 'message': "Refactor redstack to use local.conf

devstack moved away from a localrc file and towards using a
[[local|localrc]] section in the new local.conf file a while ago
(Jan 10, 2014-https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/38e38fb )
Although there is no indication that support for the old-style file is
being withdrawn, it's probably time to upgrade the redstack script to use
the new format.

This becomes a more important issue when different configurations
are desired.  For example, in order to support profiling (osprofiler),
entries have to be made in the corresponding trove configuration files.
If we want the ability to turn profiling on and off, we need to switch
to the new local.conf file.  This would allow us to include
configurations such as the following:

[[post-config|$TROVE_CONF]]
[profiler]
enabled = True

where the line 'enabled = True' could be generated from redstack in
the form of 'enabled = $ENABLE_PROFILER'

Being able to add commands like that depends on
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/155486/ merging, although order is
not important as devstack will ignore configuration files that do not
exist.

Refactoring will also permit user specified configuration to become
more in-depth, allowing greater control over the trove/devstack
environment.  This was enhanced by including a USER_LOCAL_CONF
variable that defaults to $HOME/.local.conf
All the contents of that file are now included in devstack's local.conf
file on each invocation of 'redstack install.'

Backwards compatibility was maintained by deferring to an existing
localrc file in the devstack base directory.  In order to use the
new stype configuration file, the localrc file must first be
deleted or renamed.  This would be a good time to move any 'user'
configuration to $HOME/.local.conf

Stubs for the four Trove configuration files were added as well.

Change-Id: I319476b29aada7f24829ae2308bf88c8c4bdafa7
Closes-Bug: #1421859

"}, {'created': '2015-02-19 23:37:07.000000000', 'message': "Refactor redstack to use local.conf

devstack moved away from a localrc file and towards using a
[[local|localrc]] section in the new local.conf file a while ago
(Jan 10, 2014-https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/38e38fb )
Although there is no indication that support for the old-style file is
being withdrawn, it's probably time to upgrade the redstack script to use
the new format.

This becomes a more important issue when different configurations
are desired.  For example, in order to support profiling (osprofiler),
entries have to be made in the corresponding trove configuration files.
If we want the ability to turn profiling on and off, we need to switch
to the new local.conf file.  This change would allow us to include
configurations such as the following:

[[post-config|$TROVE_CONF]]
[profiler]
enabled = True

where the line 'enabled = True' could be generated from redstack in
the form of 'enabled = $ENABLE_PROFILER'

Refactoring will also permit user specified configuration to become
more in-depth, allowing greater control over the trove/devstack
environment.  This was enhanced by including a USER_LOCAL_CONF
variable that defaults to $HOME/.local.conf
All the contents of that file are now included in devstack's local.conf
file on each invocation of 'redstack install.'

Backwards compatibility was maintained by deferring to an existing
localrc file in the devstack base directory.  In order to use the
new stype configuration file, the localrc file must first be
deleted or renamed.  This would be a good time to move any 'user'
configuration to $HOME/.local.conf

A directory 'local.conf.d' has been added to store configuration
files.  The existing using_vagrant and use_uuid_token confgurations
have been moved there.  Stubs for the four Trove configuration files
were added in trove.conf.rc.  Files are loaded by default, unless a
corresponding variable is set to false.  For example, setting
TROVE_CONF=false in redstack.rc will cause the trove.conf.rc file to
be skipped.  USING_VAGRANT=false and USE_UUID_TOKEN=false have been
added in redstack.rc to maintain backwards compatibilty.

A sample.rc file was created with detailed comments about how the
configuration can be set up.

Change-Id: I319476b29aada7f24829ae2308bf88c8c4bdafa7
Closes-Bug: #1421859

files.  The existing using_vagrant and use_uuid_token confgurations
have been moved there.  Stubs for the four Trove configuration files
were added in trove.conf.rc.  Files are loaded by default, unless a
corresponding variable is set to false.  For example, setting
TROVE_CONF=false in redstack.rc will cause the trove.conf.rc file to
be skipped.  USING_VAGRANT=false and USE_UUID_TOKEN=false have been
added in redstack.rc to maintain backwards compatibilty.

A sample.rc file was created with detailed comments about how the
configuration can be set up.

"}, {'created': '2015-02-20 04:57:17.000000000', 'message': "Refactor redstack to use local.conf

devstack moved away from a localrc file and towards using a
[[local|localrc]] section in the new local.conf file a while ago
(Jan 10, 2014-https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/38e38fb )
Although there is no indication that support for the old-style file is
being withdrawn, it's probably time to upgrade the redstack script to use
the new format.

This becomes a more important issue when different configurations
are desired.  For example, in order to support profiling (osprofiler),
entries have to be made in the corresponding trove configuration files.
If we want the ability to turn profiling on and off, we need to switch
to the new local.conf file.  This change would allow us to include
configurations such as the following:

enabled = True

where the line 'enabled = True' could be generated from redstack in
the form of 'enabled = $ENABLE_PROFILER'

Refactoring will also permit user specified configuration to become
more in-depth, allowing greater control over the trove/devstack
environment.  This was enhanced by including a USER_LOCAL_CONF
variable that defaults to $HOME/.local.conf
All the contents of that file are now included in devstack's local.conf
file on each invocation of 'redstack install.'

Backwards compatibility was maintained by deferring to an existing
localrc file in the devstack base directory.  In order to use the
new stype configuration file, the localrc file must first be
deleted or renamed.  This would be a good time to move any 'user'
configuration to $HOME/.local.conf

A directory 'local.conf.d' has been added to store configuration
files.  The existing using_vagrant and use_uuid_token confgurations

were added in trove.conf.rc.  Files are loaded by default, unless a
corresponding variable is set to false.  For example, setting
TROVE_CONF=false in redstack.rc will cause the trove.conf.rc file to
be skipped.  USING_VAGRANT=false and USE_UUID_TOKEN=false have been
added in redstack.rc to maintain backwards compatibilty.

A sample.rc file was created with detailed comments about how the
configuration can be set up.

Change-Id: I319476b29aada7f24829ae2308bf88c8c4bdafa7
Closes-Bug: #1421859

"}, {'created': '2015-03-03 22:11:33.000000000', 'message': "Refactor redstack to use local.conf

devstack has moved away from a localrc file and now uses a
[[local|localrc]] section in the new local.conf file to accomplish the
same thing.  redstack should do the same.
(Jan 10, 2014-https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/38e38fb )

The redstack script has been modified to set up devstack configuration
in the new format.

Backwards compatibility was maintained by deferring to an existing
localrc file in the devstack base directory.  In order to use the
new style configuration file, the localrc file must first be
deleted or renamed.  At the same time, any 'user' configuration
would need to move to USER_LOCAL_CONF (see below).

The refactor solves the important issue of when different configurations
are desired.  For example, in order to support profiling (OSProfiler),
entries have to be made in the corresponding trove configuration files.
The ability to turn profiling on and off is now possible, by using
configuration entries such as the following:

[[post-config|$TROVE_CONF]]

where the line 'enabled = True' could be generated from redstack in
the form of 'enabled = $ENABLE_PROFILER'

The refactoring also permits user specified configuration to become
more in-depth, allowing greater control over the trove/devstack
environment.  This was accomplished by including a USER_LOCAL_CONF
variable that defaults to '$HOME/.devstack.local.conf'.  All the
contents of that file are now included in devstack's local.conf
file on each invocation of 'redstack install'.

A directory 'local.conf.d' has been added to store additional
configuration files.  The existing using_vagrant and use_uuid_token
configurations have been moved there.  Stubs for the Trove
configuration files were added in 'trove.conf.rc'.  Files are loaded
by default, unless a corresponding variable is set to false.
For example, setting TROVE_CONF=false in options.rc will cause the
trove.conf.rc file to be skipped.  USING_VAGRANT=false and
USE_UUID_TOKEN=false have been added in redstack.rc to maintain
backwards compatibility.

An additional file for persistent redstack options was added,
'$HOME/.redstack.options.rc', and is sourced before options.rc if it
exists.

A sample.rc file was created with detailed comments about how the
configuration can be set up (this file is ignored).

Change-Id: I319476b29aada7f24829ae2308bf88c8c4bdafa7
Closes-Bug: #1421859
