commit_message:
Refactor redstack to use local.conf

The devstack project has moved away from a localrc file and now uses a
[[local|localrc]] section in the new local.conf file to accomplish the
same thing.  The redstack script should set up this file.
(see https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/38e38fb )

The redstack script has been modified to set up devstack configuration
in the new format.

Backwards compatibility was maintained by deferring to an existing
localrc file in the devstack base directory.  In order to use the
new style configuration file, the localrc file must first be
deleted or renamed.  At the same time, any 'user' configuration
would need to move to USER_LOCAL_CONF (see below).

The refactor solves the important issue of when different configurations
are desired.  For example, in order to support profiling (OSProfiler),
entries have to be made in the corresponding trove configuration files.
The ability to turn profiling on and off is now possible, by using
configuration entries such as the following:

[[post-config|$TROVE_CONF]]
[profiler]
enabled = True

where the line 'enabled = True' could be generated from redstack in
the form of 'enabled = $ENABLE_PROFILER'

The refactoring also permits user specified configuration to become
more in-depth, allowing greater control over the trove/devstack
environment.  This was accomplished by including a USER_LOCAL_CONF
variable that defaults to '$HOME/.devstack.local.conf'.  All the
contents of that file are now included in devstack's local.conf
file on each invocation of 'redstack install'.

A directory 'local.conf.d' has been added to store additional
configuration files.  The existing using_vagrant and use_uuid_token
configurations have been moved there.  Stubs for the Trove
configuration files were added in 'trove.conf.rc'.  Files are loaded
by default, unless a corresponding variable is set to false.
For example, setting TROVE_CONF=false in options.rc will cause the
trove.conf.rc file to be skipped.  USING_VAGRANT=false and
USE_UUID_TOKEN=false have been added in redstack.rc to maintain
backwards compatibility.

A sample.rc file was created with detailed comments about how the
configuration can be set up (this file is ignored).

An additional file for persistent redstack options was added,
'$HOME/.redstack.options.rc', and is sourced before options.rc if it
exists.

A side effect of this refactor is that it regenerates the localrc
part each time, thus effectively fixing bug 1370946 as well.

Change-Id: I319476b29aada7f24829ae2308bf88c8c4bdafa7
Closes-Bug: #1421859
Closes-Bug: #1370946

(2 comments)

Not all containers require a command to be specified. Sometimes the command is actually in the image metadata, not supplied as a create parameter.

For example, if you build the Docker container from a Dockerfile that specifies a CMD line, the command from the Dokerfile will be saved into the resulting Docker image metadata, and used even if no command is supplied as a parameter when the container is "run" (created+started) from that image. We need a way to support both use cases, for containers that are started with a command, and without a command.

The same concern applies when an ENTRYPOINT directive is used in a Dockerfile instead of a CMD line.'}, {'account_id': 15697, 'date': '2015-04-18 05:30:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Adrian Otto	
One suggestion  We had implement a very few container API, i think we should have a discuss about how many container API we should implement?Otherwise, we are always tinkering. thought?'}, {'account_id': 7049, 'date': '2015-04-20 01:00:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'd like to see more explain about the new docker-py changes, as before, we used 
echo '{"name":"mycontainer", "image_id":"cirros"}' | magnum --debug container-create

it worked. 

So could you update with more detailed 

it is just a docker-py API changes or just some docker images require such cmd ?'}, {'account_id': 12927, 'date': '2015-04-20 09:28:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12927, 'date': '2015-04-20 09:28:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

@Adrian, address your comment, thanks.
@Kai Qiang, command is only needed for some special images (don't specify the command in image metadata), you can refer the Adrian's comment in patch set 2. 
I think we need the capability to pass command field when creating a  container, thanks for your review."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-20 10:00:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- check-functional-dsvm-magnum http://logs.openstack.org/39/174839/3/check/check-functional-dsvm-magnum/e189aa3/ : SUCCESS in 23m 49s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 668, 'date': '2015-04-20 21:24:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Fang, my prevailing attitude about this is let's continue to tweak and adjust as we have real use cases to justify each. When a project is as young as ours, this is expected. When we need to make API contract breaking changes, we will bump API version numbers.

With that said, if we find ourselves actually fooling with a particular section of code a lot, and there is a solution to do better future-proof work on that, then we should welcome that as a topic of discussion.

In this case, I'm actually asking for additional choice to be given to the use, not less. So, this should allow us to adapt to other container formats more easily than if we accepted the patchset 2."}, {'account_id': 668, 'date': '2015-04-20 22:46:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Add command field for container

Currently, We create a container, if the "Cmd" attribute of the
corresponding image is not null, the container can be created
successfully, but it will result in a failure if the "Cmd" attribute
is null.

This patch add a new column 'command' for container, and user can
choose to pass it when creating a container.

Closes-bug: #1445504

Change-Id: Icdd47b2343fd1ebc6ebc376764cedd0340407721

commit_message:
Add v6-fixed-ip support for nova server

Now nova server fixed-ip only support ipv4 address,
this patch add IPv6 fixed ip support for nova server.

Closes-Bug: #1446532
Change-Id: I647abeedd36352f053a043d00ab87a84ee2470f3

commit_message:
Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

Change-Id: I37e0acc5ed8e1af565359290fa622456901c735e

This is fix for gate, but the really reason is that

https://github.com/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects/commit/4c0b0cb3676d24454e3dbbad9d80548cd3150326

the pip install is with latest version versionedobject, but that version require use such following

CONF.import_opt('fatal_exception_format_errors', 'oslo_versionedobjects.exception', group='oslo_versionedobjects')


Your fixes works because, you limit the version as global requirements did. 

In long term the global requirements would update version. So it works now."}, {'account_id': 12927, 'date': '2015-04-22 02:55:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Kai Qiang, yes, you are right, thanks for your clarification:)'}]

commit_message:
Do not check requirements when loading plugins

Turn off the setuptools requirements check when loading plugins to avoid
errors with code that works but where the package metadata makes
setuptools think it might not.

Change-Id: I0b15d3a8d311f0ad988c16758cec32280c83eb7e
Related-bug: #1446847

commit_message:
Added os-availability-zone API introdution in api-ref-compute-v2.1.html

Introduction for GET /v2.1/os-availability-zone and
GET /v2.1/os-availability-zone/detail is missing in
api-ref-compute-v2.1.html.

Change-Id: I7c5b3d5a2e1e8227830d10385407ff6ffadc81db
Closes-Bug: #1444887

subject: Added os-availability-zone API introductions in api-ref-compute-v2-ext.html

The issues were: 

- XML code responses no longer generated in v2.
- What's added for os-availability-zone is a POST request and response to create a server with an availability zone. 
- The show availability zone methods are already there in the OS-EXT-AZ extension.

commit_message:
Added os-availability-zone API introductions in api-ref-compute-v2-ext.html

Introduction for GET /v2/{tenant_id}/os-availability-zone and
GET /v2/{tenant_id}/os-availability-zone/detail is missing in
api-ref-compute-v2-ext.html.

Change-Id: I99f2c959af266f32bac443223a60ff089d39932d
Closes-Bug: #1354229

metrics exist in 5 places:
1. variable name
2. code comments
3. option name
4. option help
5. doc

1& 2 are out of the scope. 3 is not changed for compatibility concern. So this patch only changed 4 when metric is used in help instead of name.

For 5, I think a separated patch for doc is good, but can do otherwise if you insist.'}, {'account_id': 6676, 'date': '2015-04-09 06:47:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Replace 'metrics' with 'meters' in option and doc

So that the openstack manuals are consistent and use the same (right)
term, this replaces the term 'metrics' with 'meters' in the help for
the config and develop docs.

DocImpact

Closes-bug: #1436371

Change-Id: Iadc81a936f75dbe619130b3434188f564b67efd5

resouces, the user can scale resources by hand, such as the disk is
insufficient. The resources scaled by hand can be able to refresh db, but
the host_state.limits are not refreshed. At this time,

commit_message:
limits don't update without using filters

When creating a vm by specifying a host and the host has insufficient
resouces, the user can scale resources by hand, such as the disk, cpu,
memory or numa_topology. The resources scaled by hand can be able to
refresh db, but the host_state.limits are not refreshed. At this time,
if we creating a vm by specifying a host, it can't create a vm
successfully because of the host_state.limits. This patch just a transition
method and only deals with disk limits. If we want to solve these
problems perfectly, we need to wait for the following bp implemented.
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/allocation-ratio-to-resource-tracker

Change-Id: Ibbf5ffa2ee76d3948ee2de8bd1c64b8a57b6eaca
Closes-Bug: #1422048

commit_message:
Make directory structure match Angular modules

This patch changes the directory structure of the common Angular
components (horizon/static/angular/) to better match the structure
of the modules themselves.

For example, now the module hz.widget.wizard is defined by
/horizon/static/angular/widget/wizard/wizard.js (instead of
/horizon/static/angular/wizard/wizard.js). The problem was that
files from multiple modules lived in /horizon/static/angular
making it unclear where to find source for a particular module.

This patch also separates hz.widget and hz.framework (which were
two separate modules) into different directories.

This new structure tries to make it more clear where .js files
for existing modules, or new module directories will live.

These changes clear the way for new modules that contain services
such as a planned hz.framework.utilities (not added in this patch).

Finally, the login and MagicSearch code which were not part of
framework or widget modules are moved to the top level
(static/angular/).

Change-Id: I6734fdac8065b17b05f09aa7667a60e7bbcefacc

commit_message:
Fix some six related issues

There have been some inefficiencies in existing code regarding the
compatiblity between py2 and py3. This patch is an attempt to fix some
of them.

Change-Id: Ie2cb53e3558b012de87af77dda22571a994689bd

Application icons: css/html tweaks

Made fonts consistent. Centered app titles.
Made button/filter fields positioning consistent.
Fixed "Displaying 1 item" message with empty environment.
App title in application catalog aligned with icon.

[{'created': '2015-04-21 03:30:31.000000000', 'message': "Two changes about count calculation in ScalingPolicy

1. We don't allow the count to be negative when doing scalingout
operatioin and also don't allow positive count result when doing
scalingin operation.
2. Absolute value of count will be used to fill in both creation
and deletion fields of policy data.

Change-Id: Id6e12cacba52f3a3c673df50607c614ea025e3fa
"}]
commit_message:
Two changes about count calculation in ScalingPolicy

1. We don't allow the count to be negative when doing scalingout
operatioin and also don't allow positive count result when doing
scalingin operation.
2. Absolute value of count will be used to fill in both creation
and deletion fields of policy data.

Change-Id: Id6e12cacba52f3a3c673df50607c614ea025e3fa

commit_message:
Kolla runs process on rabbit, not rabbitmq

The kolla script runs its process on rabbit, not rabbitmq.  This
results in the rabbitmq compose scirpt not being executed.

Change-Id: I80f8d537c36b6cd598cdcf87f77df418db8ed035

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 20:10:27.000000000', 'message': 'Do not bindmount nova-compute directories

Nova uses a data container.  Data containers are expected to
use the VOLUME keyword and then use volumes_from to access
those volumes.  Throwing in a bindmount to the host filesystem
results in unpredicble behavior, usually in the form of files
being stored on the host filesystem that should be persisted
in the compute data volume.

Change-Id: I60a7873995c9397368ed4df61d5a6d4e8250f3c2
'}]
commit_message:
Do not bindmount nova-compute directories

Nova uses a data container.  Data containers are expected to
use the VOLUME keyword and then use volumes_from to access
those volumes.  Throwing in a bindmount to the host filesystem
results in unpredicble behavior, usually in the form of files
being stored on the host filesystem that should be persisted
in the compute data volume.

Change-Id: I60a7873995c9397368ed4df61d5a6d4e8250f3c2

[{'account_id': 14027, 'date': '2015-03-25 10:59:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6577, 'date': '2015-03-25 11:06:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

First of all I think it will should be merged after rc1. 

Also the main reason for -1 is loosing support for v1_1 api.
I think it should be done in the same way like for cinder client
https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/clients/os/cinder.py#L54-L59'}, {'account_id': 14027, 'date': '2015-03-25 11:42:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So I have one question - how long should we support 1.1 API?'}, {'account_id': 6577, 'date': '2015-03-25 11:45:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

we have timeout for deprecation staff equal 2 releases. So I suppose it's same for this. Or may be we should support it how long how nova do this."}, {'account_id': 14027, 'date': '2015-03-25 11:58:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for explanation. I will change this to way you proposed - like in Cinder client.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-25 12:21:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

While the migration from a deprecated version is a must, I am a bit shocked that we have to change so many test cases.

I'm putting a -1 here in hope that certain version independency can be done in this patch since it is already touching all tests impacted by the novaclient version.

For example, we can put a generic 'proxy' in the fakes dir and import that proxy from all the test cases. Next time when version changes, we don't have to do such a massive change.

Anyway, just some suggestions.  Feel free to override this review if it doesn't make sense to you."}, {'account_id': 14027, 'date': '2015-03-27 12:21:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14027, 'date': '2015-03-27 12:24:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

I am really not a fan of inferring the api version by matching on the endpoint URL. Fetching the root of the endpoint will give you some json for redirecting to a versioned endpoint, using that is way beyond the purpose of this change which is to remove a deprecation warning.

I think this is a case of when in doubt, do what horizon does, which is import v2 directly.

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/horizon/tree/openstack_dashboard/api/nova.py#n30'}, {'account_id': 14027, 'date': '2015-04-01 22:55:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

When I imported v2 version directly, my patchset was rejected by other reviewers... But maybe that was a good solution - novaclient just moved v1_1 to v2 and the main purpose of bug which I'm fixing is getting rid of deprecation warning.

Could please any other core reviewer share his/her opinion? I don't want to risk again with patchsets which might be rejected because of new or opposite thoughts."}, {'account_id': 14027, 'date': '2015-04-03 09:37:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-03 09:48:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

commit_message:
Novaclient v2 instead of v1_1

Nova API v1.1 is now deprecated and causes warnings.

Change-Id: Ib4b57a308b7637f4015a07b4e888ccd6347cb947
Closes-Bug: #1437158

commit_message:
To attach interface for server when using 'uuid'

If user using 'uuid' to specify the network id, to make
sure to attach interface for server when updating.

Change-Id: Ie7ceb9c54ab4da4ad9a5d19803791edd41e5604c
Closes-Bug: #1439497

commit_message:
Set IMAGE_UPDATE_POLICY default to REBUILD

If a server network using port id, update image property will fail
with error 'port is still in use'. Set IMAGE_UPDATE_POLICY to
REBUILD will preserve the port information when update the image.

Closes-Bug: #1439708
Change-Id: I023ee076682bd5febb960dc8754d61986fd9bedf

[{'created': '2015-04-16 10:25:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix kwargs['migration'] KeyError in @errors_out_migration decorator

@errors_out_migration decorator is used in the compute manager on
resize_instance and finish_resize methods of ComputeManager class.
It is decorated via @utils.expects_func_args('migration') to check
'migration' is a parameter to the decorator method, however, that
only ensures there is a migration argument, not that it's in args or
kwargs (either is fine for what expects_func_args checks).
The errors_out_migration decorator can get a KeyError when checking
kwargs['migration'] and fails to set the migration status to 'error'.

This fixes the KeyError in the decorator by normalizing the args/kwargs
list into a single dict that we can pull the migration from.

Change-Id: I774ac9b749b21085f4fbcafa4965a78d68eec9c7
Closes-Bug: 1444300

commit_message:
Fix kwargs['migration'] KeyError in @errors_out_migration decorator

@errors_out_migration decorator is used in the compute manager on
resize_instance and finish_resize methods of ComputeManager class.
It is decorated via @utils.expects_func_args('migration') to check
'migration' is a parameter to the decorator method, however, that
only ensures there is a migration argument, not that it's in args or
kwargs (either is fine for what expects_func_args checks).
The errors_out_migration decorator can get a KeyError when checking
kwargs['migration'] and fails to set the migration status to 'error'.

This fixes the KeyError in the decorator by normalizing the args/kwargs
list into a single dict that we can pull the migration from.

Change-Id: I774ac9b749b21085f4fbcafa4965a78d68eec9c7
Closes-Bug: 1444300

[{'created': '2015-04-06 05:49:20.000000000', 'message': "Cleans nullable=True in db model column declaration

By default sqlalchemy considers the Column's nullable=True and
this patch cleans those column declaration which is having
default value for the nullable field as it is not required
explicitly

Change-Id: I22b0d62238298fa49da09c53019408bc2049b893
Closes-bug: #1439959
"}]
commit_message:
Cleans nullable=True in db model column declaration

By default sqlalchemy considers the Column's nullable=True and
this patch cleans those column declaration which is having
default value for the nullable field as it is not required
explicitly

Change-Id: I22b0d62238298fa49da09c53019408bc2049b893
Closes-bug: #1439959

commit_message:
Add project-specific control over stable/kilo

Some repos participating in the integrated release process for the
first time lacked existing project-specific permissions to control
proposed patches on their stable/kilo branches. Add these for
consistency with other repos.

Change-Id: I151dc3cd13f4df91fdbc1d68405a80e798ad9506

commit_message:
Allow ACL sections to use .*-release group names

These are what the old .*-ptl groups were renamed to last year, for
better clarity.

Change-Id: I4764f6ab7c74adfbdcaba0a12d81a062beb9dc40

Verified that the 404 message does not appear when this patch is applied and that this fix brings the user back to the existing page and clears out any values entered.'}, {'account_id': 9981, 'date': '2015-04-13 16:32:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11881, 'date': '2015-04-13 18:49:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6610, 'date': '2015-04-15 10:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2015-04-15 22:01:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

If I click Cancel, I expect to be redirected back to the previous page.  Cancel button is more applicable to modal form.

What if we just hide the Cancel button for this two pages? Cancel button here doesn't really makes sense."}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2015-04-16 06:13:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2015-04-16 23:37:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

ok, this makes no sense to me at all

This is not a modal, so why did we add a cancel button (understand, not the scope of the bug). The save should be sufficient. Cancel is just confusing. I thought about changing the text on Cancel to Reset, but we are past hard string freeze and I'd like to have a fix for Kilo. 

More ideally these should be modals and not part of a dashboard, but that's not in the scope of this bug."}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2015-04-17 00:33:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

++'}, {'account_id': 6610, 'date': '2015-04-17 00:42:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

++'}, {'account_id': 11486, 'date': '2015-04-19 00:02:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I'm not sure why this is getting -1'ed.  It's a problem in the code today that is about to be released.  

It sounds like there are discussions that maybe the button should change, etc, but that is not what this patch is about.  You click on the button called cancel'ed which has been there for a long time and the user gets a negative experience.

I think if we want to change things then that is outside the scope of this patch."}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2015-04-19 01:04:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

This looks like an improvement over a 404, is a simple fix that has a chance of making it into a Kilo RC, and can be "properly" fixed in liberty.'}, {'account_id': 7725, 'date': '2015-04-19 13:36:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

This patch add behavior that is better that what exists and in crunch time that's probably good enough. I think it would be a good idea to put in a real fix for the next cycle, but we shouldn't wait until then to do something."}, {'account_id': 13948, 'date': '2015-04-20 06:39:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12826, 'date': '2015-04-20 14:36:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@David I agree that what's implemented here is far from ideal; however at this stage it seems to me we have a choice between Not-ideal-and-broken versus working-but-clumsy.

I'd rather we have an oddly named Cancel button shipped with Kilo (vs. reset, or a proper modal window), then just shipping something as broken as a cancel causing a 404."}, {'account_id': 12826, 'date': '2015-04-20 14:37:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

than* just shipping...'}, {'account_id': 1699, 'date': '2015-04-20 14:47:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Let's get this fixed before shipping..  If you want to -1, offer an alternative patch.  This is a bug fix not a feature request."}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2015-04-21 03:53:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd prefer to have the right fix rather than a band-aid solution since the long term solution is simple enough as well.

I proposed an alternative patch to solve the issue: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/175702/"}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2015-04-21 13:55:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

the alterntive fix for this bug has been merged'}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2015-04-21 16:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Stepping back, to close this out, the proposed fix was suggested in the comments which was removing the cancel button. The author did not use that feedback. The alternative patch did.'}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2015-04-21 16:46:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

An alternative solution merged based on the review feedback provided in reviews of this patch.'}, {'account_id': 11486, 'date': '2015-04-21 22:53:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think this was handled really poorly.  

As a new contributor, I felt that I was pushed aside and had a different solution committed instead of just telling me what those changes should have been.  

Even then, there was no discussion, no review period, nothing. Instead a new change was made and merged, while the patch that has been sitting out for review and discussion completely ignored. 

It doesn't make a new contributor feel welcomed in a project. At least it doesn't make me want to contribute very much if this is how my contributions are going to go."}]

[{'created': '2015-03-22 02:42:13.000000000', 'message': 'Added cancel_url to settings dashboard

The settings dashboard currently did not have a cancel_url
which created a 404 message to the user when selecting the
cancel button instead of the submit button. This fix brings
the user back to the existing page and clears out any values
entered.

Future updates can redirect the user to a different page
instead of the current page they are on, but this avoids
giving the user a 404 page.

Change-Id: I42888b6323928c94713117dac20e597e74bdfb0c
Closes-Bug: #1434548
'}]
commit_message:
Added cancel_url to settings dashboard

The settings dashboard currently did not have a cancel_url
which created a 404 message to the user when selecting the
cancel button instead of the submit button. This fix brings
the user back to the existing page and clears out any values
entered.

Future updates can redirect the user to a different page
instead of the current page they are on, but this avoids
giving the user a 404 page.

Change-Id: I42888b6323928c94713117dac20e597e74bdfb0c
Closes-Bug: #1434548

commit_message:
MySQL: change default MySQL collate to utf8_general_ci

Install & configure MySQL database by using utf8_general_ci collation
which is the way documented in OpenStack [1] and already the default
in puppetlabs-mysql [2].

[1] http://goo.gl/GA5gyZ
[2] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/blob/master/manifests/db.pp#L7

Change-Id: Iafdb875ce636aefd81e07861230e3a60b3cd22c7
Closes-bug: #1446375

commit_message:
MySQL: change default MySQL collate to utf8_general_ci

Install & configure MySQL database by using utf8_general_ci collation
which is the way documented in OpenStack [1] and already the default
in puppetlabs-mysql [2].

[1] http://goo.gl/GA5gyZ
[2] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/blob/master/manifests/db.pp#L7

Change-Id: I56c19b78ff4d9b313d666f6ede7591848556b840
Closes-bug: #1446375

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 11923, 'date': '2014-08-05 18:19:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2014-08-05 18:40:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

IMO this is not the right set of arguments for the client to accept.  If you specify a backup id, you don't have to specify whether it is an incremental or not separately.

If it accepts a single --backup <id> option indicating what backup it depends on (not sure what the best name is), we:

a) can later support incremental backups rather than differential backups
b) don't add a misleading argument to the client (since these are not incremental backups -- see comments in the server patch)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-08-05 20:56:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

commit_message:
Add support to incremental backups in cinder

Added a new option to "cinder backup-create" to support incremental backups.
Specify --incremental to create an incremental backup. By default, it will
be a full backup.

Co-Authored-By: Xing Yang <xing.yang@emc.com>
Implements: blueprint incremental-backup
Change-Id: Id11ecd2982ea838181b4adaa5a742fc65f864acb

subject: WIP: Add reference to running an election to new projects requirements
messages:
[{'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2015-03-09 22:52:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6316, 'date': '2015-03-09 23:07:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry I think this patch is a tad premature.

Since we have to discuss tooling for the new thundering herd of projects needing to be administered under the big tent I would rather hold on pointing the world to use the -dev mailing list for now. Since we are putting together the structure for the next round of ptl and tc elections I would rather not confuse the electorate by having multiple elections using the mailing list at the same time.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-09 23:50:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-governance-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/89/162789/1/check/gate-governance-docs/2b2738d//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 18s'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2015-03-10 16:23:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Anita, sounds reasonable do you have any alternatives in mind?'}, {'account_id': 6316, 'date': '2015-03-13 01:31:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

How about wait until we have some tools that scale? The requirement as it reads now is just fine for how each project has chosen a leader up until now. What this has successfully managed to do is confuse both the electorate and new senior election official. I was hoping for a smooth transition here.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2015-03-13 15:09:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I tend to agree with Anita... Our current tooling doesn't scale, so if projects want to resort to simpler election mechanisms I don't think we should actively prevent them...

Condorcet-as-a-Service anyone ?"}, {'account_id': 6316, 'date': '2015-03-13 15:43:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

And to be honest this whole need to show something exists that isn't broken in the first place prompts me to wonder if we need to also be looking for projects that are congnizant of the impact of their presence on the rest of openstack. The "but I want some too" attitude is taking a toll on the rest of openstack, and not in a good way. The phrase used to be "how can I help?" I can't remember the last time I heard that.

This is breeding selfishness, not collaboration. "I have to look better than the next project, or I won't get what _I_ want." rather than "how do my actions benefit all of openstack".'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2015-03-13 17:11:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

so I can't mark this as WIP, ARGH.  But this sounds like something that belongs in WIP status now."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2015-03-16 19:47:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-16 19:50:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-governance-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/89/162789/2/check/gate-governance-docs/7eb35b2//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 46s'}, {'account_id': 668, 'date': '2015-03-17 22:23:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

From the perspective of a community project leader, it would be really great to tap into the existing PTL election, but only as-neeeded. It would be even more awesome if we build self-service tools that would allow any project to announce election nominations, and share in a common set of rules, schedules, officials, etc.

Most new projects have a clear leader, and don't actually need an election. What they need is a way for candidates to surface, and an election to be held in the event that the PTL seat for a given project is actually contended.

If more than one candidate surfaces for a given project's election within the candidacy window, then allow for the project's current leader to upload the list of email addresses to the election tool, and let the election run concurrently with all the other PTL elections.

This way the actual number of project level PTL elections we hold should be relatively small, the pressure on the election officials would be dramatically reduced due to the self-service nature of the approach, and projects that actually do need to select new leadership have a way to tap into an existing election framework, rather than re-inventing the wheel for themselves.

We can ask representatives from each of the community projects to pitch in to help with the development of self-service tools. I have a feeling the amount of engineering required is well within our collective reach."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-21 20:38:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2015-04-21 21:37:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
WIP: Add reference to running an election to new projects requirements

Make it easier for new projects to figure out how to run there first
leadership election by pointing to
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Election_Officiating_Guidelines

Change-Id: I1e7efe5173a4f33d57900b51e63bfa22abb6d66a

commit_message:
Use correct URI in show schema for datasource table command

This patch changes the command to use datasource id in API
request URI. It uses currently datasource name though Congress
server expects recieving datasource id in URI.

Change-Id: If718d72e2f05672a9774778f3c6935d46e33cd80
Closes-Bug: #1441418

commit_message:
Add validation to datasource creation

Previously, there was no validation performed when creating a datasource,
so if you failed to supply any --config options, you got an internal
server error.

This also fixes a bug where if the DSE creation-service fails, the code
fails to destroy the policy it already created before re-raising the
exception.

Change-Id: Ifd8e38ca5b9fead46e5d3fc9dcc4faa77ea42ab7

commit_message:
Remove passing DB reference to drivers in Share Manager

- Remove passing DB reference to drivers in __init__() method
- Remove db reference from Generic driver and service_instance
- Remove db reference from Netapp share driver
- Remove db reference from Glusterfs share driver
- Remove db reference from Glusterfs_Native share driver
- Remove db reference from Quobyte share driver
- Remove db reference from IBM GPFS driver
- Remove db reference from HDS_SOP driver
- Remove db reference from HDFSNative driver
- Remove db reference from fake driver
- Remove db reference from unit tests.

Change-Id: I74a636a8897caa6fc4af833c1568471fe1cb0987

commit_message:
Try 5 times for rmdir command call after umount

Sometime, we will get "Device or resource busy" during the mount point
deleting, umount return 0, but the resouce is busy for a while, so need
to add sleep interval to wait resource free, then we can delete it.
Change-Id: Idaa219d12e847824960eec8907739add5d619d1a
Closes-Bug: 1332521

[{'created': '2015-04-21 19:59:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bug in execute[] when rule inserted before data

Previously, inserting a rule with execute[p(...)] in the head would
sometimes fail to cause actions to execute immediately even when
the data that the body utilizes was already available.

This change fixes that bug by broadening the dependency analysis
performed during rule insertion.

Change-Id: I7220699daa8b4ce145fefc7c23ed3fcd71317338
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bug in execute[] when rule inserted before data

Previously, inserting a rule with execute[p(...)] in the head would
sometimes fail to cause actions to execute immediately even when
the data that the body utilizes was already available.

This change fixes that bug by broadening the dependency analysis
performed during rule insertion.

Change-Id: I7220699daa8b4ce145fefc7c23ed3fcd71317338

commit_message:
Add coe attribute to BayModel creation

Add coe as a required parameter to BayModel creation.

Partially implements https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/multiple-bay-templates

Change-Id: Ic353546de885b121a88d965b2d50698802f01402

Globally looks good to me and test work on Ubuntu14.
CentOS issues are unrelated to the code.

Comments :

* Could you provides a default.yml (which is a copy of ubuntu-server-1404-x64.yml), so it can work out of the box doing `bundler exec rake beaker`

* I am fine with the nodesets here as an initial commit, but in order to share them amongs other project, I'd rather see them in puppet-modulesync-configs

None of those two comments diserve a -1 as the code per-se is functional, but if #1 could be addressed that would be nice."}, {'account_id': 6554, 'date': '2015-04-20 14:10:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2015-04-20 15:51:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2015-04-20 15:55:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 27.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-20 16:28:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Verified+1

commit_message:
LDAP: add support to configure credential driver

Like it's the case for 'identity', add the support to configure
'credential' driver.

Closes-bug: #1238103

Change-Id: I9949dcb863c23461ce5fbe5e741d09a6a77eea9a

[{'created': '2015-04-20 23:51:53.000000000', 'message': 'Remove support for policy snapshot file

The snapshot file support bypasses the database when inserting rules into the
policy engine, so it makes it possible to insert rules into the engine without
the rules being in the db.  That means if Congress tries to synchronize rules
with the db, the synchronizer will delete rules from the snapshot because the
rules do not exist in the db.

Change-Id: Icbd6d1e1f1233aa00157d036f697933da07347f7

commit_message:
Remove support for policy snapshot file

The snapshot file support bypasses the database when inserting rules into the
policy engine, so it makes it possible to insert rules into the engine without
the rules being in the db.  That means if Congress tries to synchronize rules
with the db, the synchronizer will delete rules from the snapshot because the
rules do not exist in the db.

Change-Id: Icbd6d1e1f1233aa00157d036f697933da07347f7

commit_message:
Reject rules inserted into non persisted policies

This patch rejects rule creation requests that insert rules into
non persisted policies, i.e. datasource policies with error message
"Rules not permitted on non persisted policies".

Change-Id: I35d650a60213a31c090b91b654bb7259b7f03ed0
Closes-bug: 1436151

[{'created': '2015-04-14 18:21:05.000000000', 'message': 'remove wait_for from glance-api

For some reason glance sometimes fails to permanently find keystone
while other services do find keystone.  The host also has full access
to keystone.  Change wait_for to fail_unless.

This could be a docker bug, a wait_for bug, or some other problem.

Change-Id: I02d611d65b7ffddb9c27101fd60e2a8b7cc25658
'}]
commit_message:
remove wait_for from glance-api

For some reason glance sometimes fails to permanently find keystone
while other services do find keystone.  The host also has full access
to keystone.  Change wait_for to fail_unless.

This could be a docker bug, a wait_for bug, or some other problem.

Change-Id: I02d611d65b7ffddb9c27101fd60e2a8b7cc25658

commit_message:
rename keystone_v2_authenticate method

In puppet-neutron, keystone_v2_authenticate already exists and is in
colision with the keystone_v2_authenticate in puppet-heat.

While we move the whole method in puppet-openstacklib, let's just rename
the method from keystone_v2_authenticate to keystone_v2_auth.

Closes-bug #1429096

Change-Id: I15b6d0550bb3baef37d7536d264b822768802ad0

commit_message:
Change PTL to "Team" lead

A recent change incorrectly described PTL as being a "Technical"
lead but it currently stands for "Team" lead.

Change-Id: I10a2a7a63e268ac46f5279d064786654e15dcf95

commit_message:
Rename handle_request to neutron_handle_request

To avoid a future colision with other modules, we rename the
handle_request method with a prefix (module name).

Same patch in puppet-heat: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/162292/
Closes-bug: #1429096

Change-Id: If477dd15b1ffeb957481494a1da0b3e8ab29e299

commit_message:
[install-guide] Replace LVMISCSIDriver with LVMVolumeDriver

This solves the following issues:

LVMISCSIDriver is deprecated, you should now just use LVMVolumeDriver
and specify target_helper for the target driver you wish to use.

Also, use a specific backend section for LVM rather than the default
section.

Partially implements bp installguide-kilo.
Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>

Change-Id: If2e356553ea699f23a3462d0d73a92b1ab0c6bd6

commit_message:
Changes Rally to Benchmark service to better match other names

- Since we didn't use Database as a Service for trove name, request
changing for docs consistency. We also didn't use Policy as a Service.

Change-Id: I8e07ca6a6498d68c3b52adb268db92832f142ba1

commit_message:
Fix bug in "datasource table schema show"

Unlike "datasource schema show", the table version required you pass
in the ID of the datasource, instead of the name.

Change-Id: I07fee067f33f12530bed185d26ed38ef53d76bd3

[{'created': '2015-04-15 00:23:36.000000000', 'message': "Rename keystoneclient-federation to saml2

Federation is becoming a very core part of keystone's scope. We had
initially split keystoneclient-federation particularly to separate
additional dependencies. It was decided that it is more correct to call
this repository keystoneclient-saml2 as this is what will be there and
we may not want to lump together all federation plugins in one repo.

This library has never had a release so will not have an impact on
users.

Change-Id: Ia25e14a6afa939590ebba3a91973ceee4a8eaee2
"}]
commit_message:
Rename keystoneclient-federation to saml2

Federation is becoming a very core part of keystone's scope. We had
initially split keystoneclient-federation particularly to separate
additional dependencies. It was decided that it is more correct to call
this repository keystoneclient-saml2 as this is what will be there and
we may not want to lump together all federation plugins in one repo.

This library has never had a release so will not have an impact on
users.

Change-Id: Ia25e14a6afa939590ebba3a91973ceee4a8eaee2

commit_message:
Add glean to infra

Infra has a new tool in support of the diskimage-builder nodepool
project and the desire to have images that work on each of our clouds.

Change-Id: Idf43e88813cdfdd8ed224f4393546725624e8a9a

commit_message:
Adding nova creating and deleting for client

This is a way to create and delete nova instances leveraging an LWRP and
the fog gem.

This is just a POC on how to do it; but i think with this we can cargo
cult a lot of code to get all of fog supported.

Change-Id: I6ba402611d3f4a05470a01eed9c99abcb002045f

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-17 13:52:48.000000000', 'message': 'Modify openrc variables for broken clients

Enabling the newer versions of APIs for clients
requires different environment variables in openrc
files. For example:

1) With keystone API version 3, the glance client still
   expects OS_TENANT_NAME instead of OS_PROJECT_NAME.
   Version 0.16 apparently fixed this issue, but Ubuntu
   currently includes 0.15.

2) With glance API version 2, the glance client requires
   OS_IMAGE_API_VERSION=2 instead of using version 2
   by default if returned in the list of available API
   versions. Impacts all versions.

3) With keystone API version 3, the cinder client still
   expects OS_TENANT_NAME instead of OS_PROJECT_NAME.
   Impacts all versions.

4) With keystone API version 3, the swift client still
   expects a versioned endpoint and the "-V 3" command-line
   option. Best I can tell, it does not support environment
   variables for API version. Luckily, the other clients
   seem to work with a versioned endpoint, so we can
   configure it globally, at least for now.

I suspect some of these issues originate from distributions
packaging older versions of the clients and expect more
changes to these variables as we continue testing of
Kilo. I suggest we make these changes in the particular
service chapters to keep better track of them.

Change-Id: I617e3eaf86bbd33e859930baaa1e5cb4bb5850f0
Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo

commit_message:
Modify openrc variables for broken clients

Enabling the newer versions of APIs for clients
requires different environment variables in openrc
files. For example:

1) With keystone API version 3, the glance client still
   expects OS_TENANT_NAME instead of OS_PROJECT_NAME.
   Version 0.16 apparently fixed this issue, but Ubuntu
   currently includes 0.15.

2) With glance API version 2, the glance client requires
   OS_IMAGE_API_VERSION=2 instead of using version 2
   by default if returned in the list of available API
   versions. Impacts all versions.

3) With keystone API version 3, the cinder client still
   expects OS_TENANT_NAME instead of OS_PROJECT_NAME.
   Impacts all versions.

4) With keystone API version 3, the swift client still
   expects a versioned endpoint and the "-V 3" command-line
   option. Best I can tell, it does not support environment
   variables for API version. Luckily, the other clients
   seem to work with a versioned endpoint, so we can
   configure it globally, at least for now.

5) With cinder API version 2, the cinder client requires
   OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION=2 instead of using version 2
   by default if returned in the list of available API
   versions. Impacts all versions.

I suspect some of these issues originate from distributions
packaging older versions of the clients and expect more
changes to these variables as we continue testing of
Kilo. I suggest we make these changes in the particular
service chapters to keep better track of them.

Change-Id: I617e3eaf86bbd33e859930baaa1e5cb4bb5850f0
Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo

commit_message:
Add coe attribute to BayModel

Add the Core Orchestration Engine (coe) attribute to the BayModel API, model, and DB objects to be used by the Heat Conductor Handler when creating a Bay.
1) Add coe attribute to BayModel models
2) Use coe attribute in heat handler's get_template_definition(...) calls

Partially implements https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/multiple-bay-templates

Change-Id: I3383f6efa3f8839b8f0735ea022307a2d9549d65

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-14 18:49:56.000000000', 'message': 'Let projects add repos without prior-approval

Some OpenStack projects are adding git repos at a moderate pace
and generally the TC is rubber-stamping them as long as the PTL
approves.  Explicitly codify that this is desirable -- the TC
doesn't really care how many git repos it takes to accomplish a
task, so as long as a new repo fits within the existing mission
statement, indicate that it is permissible to add it without
prior TC approval.

This is not strictly a "new project requirement", however, this
document seems to be the best existing place to add it as it
relates to project creation.

Change-Id: I34acfe4ffe5a0af6a941e70a5315a07d036e6c24
'}]
commit_message:
Let projects add repos without prior-approval

Some OpenStack projects are adding git repos at a moderate pace
and generally the TC is rubber-stamping them as long as the PTL
approves.  Explicitly codify that this is desirable -- the TC
doesn't really care how many git repos it takes to accomplish a
task, so as long as a new repo fits within the existing mission
statement, indicate that it is permissible to add it without
prior TC approval.

This is not strictly a "new project requirement", however, this
document seems to be the best existing place to add it as it
relates to project creation.

Change-Id: I34acfe4ffe5a0af6a941e70a5315a07d036e6c24

For the record, I disagree with Anne. I think there is absolutely nothing wrong with a descriptive name in this case. These are puppet modules for installing OpenStack. Calling them anything else would be confusing, nor infringing, since it IS puppet code, and it IS OpenStack deploying.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-14 20:21:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2015-04-14 21:04:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2015-04-14 21:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2015-04-14 21:35:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(just a rebase)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-14 22:10:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-governance-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/12/172112/3/check/gate-governance-docs/8153652//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 49s'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2015-04-15 21:53:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Puppet is the name of the language and is commonly used in puppet-related projects, such as puppet modules and development utilities not affiliated with Puppet Labs. It's analogous to using Python as part of the name of the project. I'm working on getting more authoritative answer, but I do not think Puppet Labs would have a problem with us using Puppet as part of the name.

For the OpenStack part, I have no knowledge of the legal requirements, but Python-OpenStackClient comes to mind as an example of a project using the name. What is the distinction between the PuppetOpenStack projects and the Python-OpenStackClient project? If we add another descriptor (PuppetOpenStackModules? PuppetOpenStackCfgMgmt? ...Deployer? ...Automation?) could we use that?"}, {'account_id': 14496, 'date': '2015-04-16 18:54:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Regarding the name - here is the email I just sent out to the group:

---

I went ahead and had a discussion with Puppet's legal team on this issue. Unfortunately at this time we are unable to sanction the use of Puppet's name or registered trademarks as part of the project's name.

To be clear, this decision is in no way indicative of Puppet not feeling the project is 'worthy' or 'high quality' (in fact the opposite is true), but rather is a purely defensive decision.

We are in the process of reevaluating our usage guidelines, but there is no firm timetable as of this moment.

---

Keep in mind that this is just lack of active sanctioning on Puppet's part, nothing more. 

To Monty's point, I don't think that an accurate description of what the modules actually are could be construed as infringing. Obviously I am not a lawyer so take that for what it's worth."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2015-04-16 18:56:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I have apparently mistaken Puppet Labs's attitude on the subject. Please disregard my comment."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2015-04-16 19:24:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

So the irony here is typically I like to name things what they are. :) Thanks for following up.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2015-04-16 19:27:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

as an information for the TC, Puppet OpenStack community will come up with a name next week. I'll take care to proceed to a vote and let you know when it's done."}, {'account_id': 12323, 'date': '2015-04-16 19:28:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm impressed that this is moving forward. On the other hand as the Chef representative, this will spur us to move forward in attempting to add us in the OpenStack namespace also. This is great for the OpenStack community and opens many doors for many groups."}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2015-04-16 19:31:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This is a fantastic opportunity to come up with a fun and creative name. Naming things is hard, but also becomes interesting when name marks are on the line.'}, {'account_id': 12323, 'date': '2015-04-17 18:37:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'd like to thank yall for spear heading this: I have started the review for Chef here https://review.openstack.org/175000"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2015-04-21 00:27:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

Quick note inline about project name.
I'm about to send a new patchset with some modules we want to support."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2015-04-21 00:30:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-21 01:12:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-09 15:19:49.000000000', 'message': 'Adding the Puppet modules to OpenStack

The Puppet modules for OpenStack bring scalable and reliable IT
automation to OpenStack cloud deployments.
They enable system administrators to automate any lifecycle stage
of their OpenStack infrastructure.

The code base has existed for more than 3 years in the stackforge code
namespace. The contributors come from various companies including Puppet Labs,
Red Hat, iWeb, Time Warner Cable, Aptira, Mirantis and more.

Our meetings are weekly, on IRC, and our roadmap is transparent and
managed on Launchpad again using standard OpenStack community practices
[1].

Our group wanted to elect and only one (me) applied [2] so we have a
PTL of this project.

This patch is an official request to be part of the big tent and become
an official project.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Puppet
[2] https://www.mail-archive.com/openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org/msg49290.html

commit_message:
Adding the Puppet modules to OpenStack

The Puppet modules for OpenStack bring scalable and reliable IT
automation to OpenStack cloud deployments.
They enable system administrators to automate any lifecycle stage
of their OpenStack infrastructure.

The code base has existed for more than 3 years in the stackforge code
namespace. The contributors come from various companies including Puppet Labs,
Red Hat, iWeb, Time Warner Cable, Aptira, Mirantis and more.

Our meetings are weekly, on IRC, and our roadmap is transparent and
managed on Launchpad again using standard OpenStack community practices
[1].

Our group wanted to elect and only one (me) applied [2] so we have a
PTL of this project.

This patch is an official request to be part of the big tent and become
an official project.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Puppet
[2] https://www.mail-archive.com/openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org/msg49290.html

Change-Id: Ic6257647916e8fabf9f7032f2db2415696078ce7

commit_message:
Pin puppetlabs-concat to 1.2.1 in fixtures

Puppet Labs is in the process of releasing a 2.0.0 version of
puppetlabs-concat, which will have many breaking changes that affect
many dependent modules. Changes have been merged to master, but not yet
released. While we figure out what changes we need to make in our own
modules and wait for updates in dependent modules, we should just pin
to a stable version.

Change-Id: I8a3a0ef54ffeb55cf59ba8f9b79340d64065c905

commit_message:
WIP: Adds dhcp agent component of the neutron container set.

Previously, only the neutron-server component existed within
the neutron container set. This patch adds the neutron dhcp
agent.

Partially Implements: Container set compute-operation-neutron

Change-Id: Id9f9e5c1599e235ccd2e78c47362c15dbf4fb512

commit_message:
WIP: Fixes errors in Neutron Linux Bridge Agent

Previously, the linuxbridge agent was not loading it's config
file. This PS adds --config-file flags to the lb-agent process
The PS also adds the iproute package needed for the vxlan plugin
and removes the unnecessary soft link.

Partially Implements: Container set compute-operation-neutron

Change-Id: I1d7798acbb3b07763b731343aa31c42b6a699ef1

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-09 10:20:00.000000000', 'message': 'Adding MagnetoDB to OpenStack

MagnetoDB is a key-value store service for OpenStack. It provides horizontally
scalable, queryable storage, accessible via REST API.

MagnetoDB has been designed and developed in order to provide:

 - Easy integration: REST API. Support Amazon DynamoDB API
 - OpenStack interoperability: integrated with Keystone. Follows OpenStack
   design tenets, packaging and distribution
 - Database pluggability: supports Cassandra, any other databases could
   be easily added
 - Horizontal scalability: MagnetoDB is scalable lineary by amount of
   data and requests
 - High availability: just one working API node is enough to continue
   handling requests

Ilya Sviridov was choosen as PTL via elections.

MagnetoDB team has bi-weekly IRC meetings, uses Launchpad, openstack-dev mail
list,  spec repo for issue, roadmap traking and communication publicly.

MagnetoDB employs OpenStack Tempest for functional testing running within
gates on community resources.

OpenStack Keystone is used for authentification.

Change-Id: I46172d745ffc12df14cd3697c9ce4dcad0602a1f

commit_message:
Adding MagnetoDB to OpenStack

MagnetoDB is a key-value store service for OpenStack. It provides horizontally
scalable, queryable storage, accessible via REST API.

MagnetoDB has been designed and developed in order to provide:

 - Easy integration: REST API. Support Amazon DynamoDB API
 - OpenStack interoperability: integrated with Keystone. Follows OpenStack
   design tenets, packaging and distribution
 - Database pluggability: supports Cassandra, any other databases could
   be easily added
 - Horizontal scalability: MagnetoDB is scalable lineary by amount of
   data and requests
 - High availability: just one working API node is enough to continue
   handling requests

Ilya Sviridov was choosen as PTL via elections.

MagnetoDB team has bi-weekly IRC meetings, uses Launchpad, openstack-dev mail
list,  spec repo for issue, roadmap traking and communication publicly.

MagnetoDB employs OpenStack Tempest for functional testing running within
gates on community resources.

OpenStack Keystone is used for authentification.

MagnetoDB sends usage data to OpenStack Ceilometer.

Change-Id: I46172d745ffc12df14cd3697c9ce4dcad0602a1f

commit_message:
Add test for user_cache

Since we intend to invalidate the user_cache, and properties and caching
decorators don't play nicely, we split this into the property and a
getter which can be called explicitly.

Note that this test also uncovered a bug in user_cache, which was that
it called a non-existent task.

Change-Id: Ica04a82242cf4724155f99de5b8d3d9c356a8ec4

commit_message:
MonkeyPatch time.sleep in unit tests to avoid wait

There's no need to wait real world seconds when there are no real
world servers at the other end of these API calls. We still do wait a
little bit of time, in case there is some reliance on actually having
called the real time.sleep, but this should feed up test running in
a loop quite a bit.

Also lowering timeout on rebuild_server as it unnecessarily sleeps
for 1 second.

Change-Id: Ic26e90af12aedbedfbe0cc468332b921516a8409

[{'created': '2015-04-21 15:00:45.000000000', 'message': 'Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

Change-Id: I04c11e311b5d1610249ceacc2572f39851aef0ea
'}]
commit_message:
Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

Change-Id: I04c11e311b5d1610249ceacc2572f39851aef0ea

[{'created': '2015-04-10 20:18:43.000000000', 'message': "neutron: reduce complexity of allocate_for_instance (security_groups)

This pulls the security_group filtering loop out of
allocate_for_instance and into it's own private helper method.

Adds more documentation and cleans up the code a bit for readability.

Change-Id: I120b59d5d883ea58ead9a0ff70962a99b9881299
"}]
commit_message:
neutron: reduce complexity of allocate_for_instance (security_groups)

This pulls the security_group filtering loop out of
allocate_for_instance and into it's own private helper method.

Adds more documentation and cleans up the code a bit for readability.

Change-Id: I120b59d5d883ea58ead9a0ff70962a99b9881299

commit_message:
TOSCA: organize test templates

The test templates has two different locations, there is no overlapping but
it makes sense to have them all to a common place for easy reference.

Change-Id: I37badc8fb2fa6ae8286d0007a229ee76e8fb1986

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2015-04-14 16:56:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@lifeless, your comments on the security aspects here would be appreciated. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2015-04-14 17:08:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Changing exec_dirs globally for a devstack use case does not seem wise.  I'd rather see rootwrap.conf be rewritten by devstack to include /usr/local/bin than force packagers to modify our default."}, {'account_id': 6685, 'date': '2015-04-14 18:09:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Please see patchiest 4 for an alternative as well. In that case, it followed the example of metadata_proxy in l3.filters.'}, {'account_id': 7448, 'date': '2015-04-14 19:13:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

I don't think there is much of a security concern with including /usr/local/bin.  It is still a root-owned installation target.

-1 because I agree with @Maru that it would be better to have devstack do this than to add it here if the use case is truly just for devstack.  I think this should probably be abandoned."}, {'account_id': 6685, 'date': '2015-04-14 19:24:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Carl, what about the l3.filters that has an additional filter for metadata_proxy_local? Probably that's a special case?"}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2015-04-15 08:34:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2015-04-18 00:05:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I'd like to see all rootwrap filters with a command path prefix of /usr/local/bin removed and devstack updated to rewrite exec_dirs of the deployed rootwrap.conf in the same way we already update filters_path:

https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/lib/neutron-legacy#L1147

So something like the following

 sudo sed -e 's:^exec_dirs=\(.*\)$:exec_dirs=\1,/usr/local/bin:' $Q_RR_CONF_FILE"}, {'account_id': 6685, 'date': '2015-04-20 12:59:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

The consensus seems to be modifying the devstack script to do so. Therefore, I'll change this patch to remove the metadata local proxy, and post a devstack patch for the devstack change.

One question is how we can make the patch that removes metadata local proxy pass the gate? Would making it depend on the devstack patch work?"}, {'account_id': 6524, 'date': '2015-04-20 18:12:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Robert: yes, add "Depends-on:" to the commit msg here once the devstack patch is up for review.'}, {'account_id': 6685, 'date': '2015-04-21 19:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Refer to change in devstack to address this issue.
https://review.openstack.org/176041'}]

commit_message:
Add /usr/local/bin in exec_dirs

Devstack installs some of the neutron utilities into /usr/local/bin.
In stead of adding individual filters to allow them to run from that
directory, this patch adds /usr/local/bin into exec_dirs.

A followup patch will remove local filters for metadata_proxy

Closes-Bug: 1435971
Change-Id: I3abd1c173121dc8abb5738d1879db8ac9a98b690

[{'created': '2015-04-20 09:46:28.000000000', 'message': 'Release Import of Translations from Transifex

Manual import of Translations from Transifex. This change also removes
all po files that are less than 66 per cent translated since such
partially translated files will not help users.

This updates also recreates all pot (translation source files) to
reflect the state of the repository.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle the proposed branches and we need to sync with latest
translations.

Change-Id: Ifa211a8bd8d18d9b9b97bce8610587c829b94324
'}]
commit_message:
Release Import of Translations from Transifex

Manual import of Translations from Transifex. This change also removes
all po files that are less than 66 per cent translated since such
partially translated files will not help users.

This updates also recreates all pot (translation source files) to
reflect the state of the repository.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle the proposed branches and we need to sync with latest
translations.

Change-Id: Ifa211a8bd8d18d9b9b97bce8610587c829b94324

commit_message:
Temporarily ignore requirements on master libs

We need to disable checks of master branch requirements in libraries
so we can release updated versions of all libs that have no capped
requirements. We can restore the checks when that is done, and then
we'll look into ways to update the tools to not update caps on
library projects.

http://logs.openstack.org/32/174532/1/check/gate-python-heatclient-requirements/ba4c6dd/console.html#_2015-04-16_19_03_49_535

Change-Id: I4e4ac0580b9a1a98cc5cc9ba62d6977324a15296

commit_message:
[install-guide] [yum] install python-oslo-log on Cinder storage node

This is a workaround. python-oslo-log and python-oslo-db should be added
as dependencies of the openstack-cinder package.

Change-Id: If1eec807d667e83fb4e47c354ead152111d1cec3

commit_message:
Add console access origin validation

The configuration of console proxy can fail easily if not properly
configured, this change attempts to explain origin validation
errors.

This also fix a bad link.

Change-Id: Ica00481feab26c13e07d4ba7a7e4327664fcc606

commit_message:
[install-guide] fix/update the Ceilometer verification

* use the image ID to download an image from glance
* update outputs of the commands
* change wrong admin project IDs
* remove the downloaded image file after the verification

Partially implements bp installguide-kilo.

Change-Id: I9b69d66588bd21418614450107ac1b1d087373fa

This jobs already working ok for some some time as non-voting check job
and now we're ready to enable it as voting for branches starts with kilo.

stable/juno where this tests were not yet implemented.

Change-Id: I6f8b11d03dc944b4b3595750bb0b090fad74ee61
"}]
commit_message:
The sahara-tox-py27-scenario-unit job should be voting since kilo

This jobs already working ok for some some time as non-voting check job
and now we're ready to enable it as voting for branches starts with kilo.
In addition to it, this change is needed to stop running this job for
stable/juno where this tests were not yet implemented.

Change-Id: I6f8b11d03dc944b4b3595750bb0b090fad74ee61

Fixed regression in RatingProcessorBase: nodata missing

During a previous rebase of a branch the nodata part of
RatingProcessorBase was erroneously removed.

Change-Id: Idc1afcf5e734481b3fb461020ddbd4207e8921b9

commit_message:
Remove concatenation in csv file

The download CSV summary file from both the Admin and Project
overview pages includes concatenation in its contents.
The : needs to be included as part of the label so translators
have control of spacing. Note that the commas are part of the
CSV file format and should not be translated.

Change-Id: I13137fda9b3e93edf97a7539044e791d04017ea7
Closes-Bug: 1444135

[{'created': '2015-04-17 19:59:56.000000000', 'message': '[install-guide] Remove use_namespaces option

In the l3_agent.ini and dhcp_agent.ini files, remove the
deprecated use_namespaces option because minimum Linux
kernel versions support namespaces. Option defaults to
"true" until removal of the option in Liberty.

Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo
Change-Id: I8013c468d9fd9834b769bf24998c2214e7106e83
'}, {'created': '2015-04-20 14:30:11.000000000', 'message': '[install-guide] Remove use_namespaces option

In the l3_agent.ini and dhcp_agent.ini files, remove the
deprecated use_namespaces option because minimum Linux
kernel versions support namespaces. Option defaults to
"true" until removal of the option in Liberty.

Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo
Change-Id: I8013c468d9fd9834b769bf24998c2214e7106e83

commit_message:
[install-guide] Remove use_namespaces option

In the l3_agent.ini and dhcp_agent.ini files, remove the
deprecated use_namespaces option because minimum Linux
kernel versions support namespaces. Option defaults to
"true" until removal of the option in Liberty.

Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo
Change-Id: I8013c468d9fd9834b769bf24998c2214e7106e83

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-17 21:59:07.000000000', 'message': 'Suppress nagios_wrapper valueMeta for empty detail

Checks processed by the nagios_wrapper typically contain a text string
and return code.  The text string is submitted to the API as valueMeta
'detail'.  However, if the Nagios check does not return a text string,
the 'detail' field is empty, this condition has been known to cause an
UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY error in the API ("valueMeta detail cannot have an
empty value").

This change prevents valueMeta 'detail' from being submitted to the API
if the Nagios check outputs no text string along with its return code.

Change-Id: Ic6b584d6f988323d25676ebbdbdbe3edd06c4c3a
'}]
commit_message:
Suppress nagios_wrapper valueMeta for empty detail

Checks processed by the nagios_wrapper typically contain a text string
and return code.  The text string is submitted to the API as valueMeta
'detail'.  However, if the Nagios check does not return a text string,
the 'detail' field is empty, this condition has been known to cause an
UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY error in the API ("valueMeta detail cannot have an
empty value").

This change prevents valueMeta 'detail' from being submitted to the API
if the Nagios check outputs no text string along with its return code.

Change-Id: Ic6b584d6f988323d25676ebbdbdbe3edd06c4c3a

commit_message:
Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation
and bug tracker in a parseable format in order for some of the
release tools scripts to work (particularly the on that prints the release
note email).

Change-Id: I9200a1cc2147b12a617762d0dabaa72464a9d70f

messages:
[{'account_id': 8467, 'date': '2015-04-21 16:49:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2015-04-21 16:49:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

[{'created': '2015-04-21 16:49:43.000000000', 'message': 'Adds support for container selection for backup

Changed argument from parsed_args.volume to parsed_args.container as per what
is expected in python-cinderclient.

If not defined, defaults to "backup_swift_container" in cinder.conf.

Stops there being a container for every volume you take backups off.

Change-Id: I4a34894222f71b0f207d007c32427040589406aa
Closes-Bug: 1446751
'}]
commit_message:
Adds support for container selection for backup

Changed argument from parsed_args.volume to parsed_args.container as per what
is expected in python-cinderclient.

If not defined, defaults to "backup_swift_container" in cinder.conf.

Stops there being a container for every volume you take backups off.

Change-Id: I4a34894222f71b0f207d007c32427040589406aa
Closes-Bug: 1446751

commit_message:
Remove /trunk/index.html

Redirect /trunk/index.html to /.
Also fix some redirects that should not go to /trunk

Also add /draft to robots.txt.

Partially implements bp draft-publishing
Change-Id: I70ed40908fa40f6d59d1aa2230cc86a77c6ee2cb

Tell me more about who needs this and why docs-draft is insufficient? Too temporal?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2015-04-13 12:34:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Anne: Too temporal - see current thread on mailing list.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2015-04-13 13:58:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Okay I like draft better than trunk because we have a bad expectation set with trunk and possibly some search hits that we don't want to keep. Christian, is draft okay with you? Shall we also change docs.openstack.org/trunk/index.html?"}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2015-04-13 14:03:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

/draft is fine for me.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2015-04-13 14:09:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3114, 'date': '2015-04-13 14:25:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Great idea; thanks Andreas!'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2015-04-13 14:37:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3114, 'date': '2015-04-13 14:39:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2015-04-13 14:52:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Let's discuss a bit more."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-13 15:15:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

(2 comments)

I found a few potential issues.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2015-04-13 17:55:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2015-04-13 17:56:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

Matt, thanks for the review, I've addressed your comments.

Marking as WIP since we need some more discussion about the way forward."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-13 18:37:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-openstack-manuals-tox-checkniceness http://logs.openstack.org/91/172891/4/check/gate-openstack-manuals-tox-checkniceness/44fa964/ : SUCCESS in 1m 58s
- gate-openstack-manuals-tox-checkdeletions http://logs.openstack.org/91/172891/4/check/gate-openstack-manuals-tox-checkdeletions/43f0814/ : SUCCESS in 2m 00s
- gate-openstack-manuals-tox-doc-publish-checkbuild http://docs-draft.openstack.org/91/172891/4/check/gate-openstack-manuals-tox-doc-publish-checkbuild/bcd9304//publish-docs/ : SUCCESS in 18m 50s'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2015-04-14 08:24:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I value having the install guide available as well.

Should we add robots.txt to avoid it being indexed?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2015-04-14 08:26:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Tom, I don't understand your -1. Is it because you want robots.txt updated for /draft ?"}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2015-04-14 13:08:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

One consideration I realized yesterday that I didn't realize is there are /ja/trunk/ guides published that have partial translations. Do we need to change trunk to draft everywhere?

About robots.txt, perhaps hide the install guides but don't hide the config reference, I see a lot of page views on the /trunk/ config reference any time of the year."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2015-04-14 13:22:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Anne, the Install Guides have been removed from /trunk but we still publish the Config Reference there.

The Japanese Install Guide is a problem in itself - it's published from master and we cannot really translate on stable branches. We need to wait for Zanata to handle branches properly and then can publish it from stable.

In general, if we go down this road, we have a few more things to discuss.

What about writing a spec that explains doc publishing to draft?"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2015-04-18 07:35:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2015-04-18 07:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

spec has been approved, this is one step in implementing it.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-18 07:53:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

commit_message:
Publish to /draft/ instead of /trunk

Publish Install Guide to docs.openstack.org/draft/install-guide

Publish Networking Guide to docs.openstack.org/draft/networking-guide
Publish Configuration Reference to /draft as well.

Update link /trunk/index.html

Partial implements bp draft-publishing

Change-Id: I620339c45e07bc492328f8df908e7b9f5f5ef9fa

commit_message:
Remove obsolete tables

In previous changes, configuration options have been removed from
flagmappings and thus a few table are now completely obsolete.

Remove these tables and update the flagmappings header.

Change-Id: I08b8f92a679a572eeb64d5dbe111e7e693da3914

commit_message:
Remove XenAPINFS driver

With change I2123b2d52180bbdffe90c458f115c67f50dfd5e9 the driver was
removed from cinder, remove it from our documents as well.

This removes also the obsolete table cinder-storage_xen.xml.

Related-Bug: #1372836
Change-Id: Iffff1f5cd21ae7ed09da7f9923e1d4c99f876d43
